text: High salt has been shown to play a role in the pathogenesis of autoimmune diseases such as rheumatoid arthritis, multiple sclerosis, and systemic lupus erythematosus. In this study, we investigated the effect of high salt on the production of inflammatory mediators by arpe-19 cells. Addition of high salt led to an increase in the production of pro-inflammatory cytokines IL-6 and MCP-1 and had no effect on the release of IL-8. Mannitol, as an osmotic stress control, had no effect on the secretion of inflammatory mediators by arpe-19 cells. Co-culture of arpe-19 cells with high salt led to significant increases in the phosphorylation of p38 MAPK, Akt, and NF-kB as well as an upregulation of the transcription factors NFAT5 and SGK1. High salt also increased IL-6 and MCP-1 production in arpe-19 cells. This effect is mediated by activation of the p38 MAPK, Akt, NF-kB, and NFAT5-SGK1 pathways.
label: dolly

text: A 72-year-old woman presented with symptomatic anemia, and an enhanced computed tomography scan of her abdomen revealed swelling of multiple intraperitoneal lymph nodes and a high density of mesenteric adipose tissue. F-dG- positron emission tomography showed high f-dG accumulation at the intraperitoneal lymph nodes. A double- balloon enteroscopy revealed severe stenosis with an annular ulcer in the lower ileum. We strongly recommend consideration of gastrointestinal follicular lymphoma in the differential diagnosis of annular ulcers in the small intestine. Treatment included chemotherapy with rituximab and bendamustine for one year, which resulted in the improvement of her disease.

text: We study the semilinear partial differential equation (PDE) associated with the non-linear Black-Scholes equation (BSE) that characterizes a buyer and a seller of a collateralized contract. We use asymmetric funding, repo and collateral rates, and early contract termination due to counterparty credit risk to show the existence of a unique classical solution to the PDE. We prove the existence and uniqueness of a viscosity solution, and then show its regularity. We use the uniqueness result to study the numerical implications of the various factors on the total valuation adjustment.

text: The High Court overturned a previous ruling by the High Court. The inquiry had determined witnesses didn't need representation and should not have any public funding. In January, the High Court announced it had reversed its previous ruling. The inquiry was investigating allegations of child abuse in residential institutions and other child care establishments in Northern Ireland from 1922 to 1995. It was the largest child abuse inquiry ever held in the UK. The witness known as BP had suffered from severe mental health issues and had been serving a prison sentence. She submitted that being questioned on her background in public could have a detrimental effect on her character. She had applied for legal representation at the inquiry, as she anticipated the allegations would be robustly rejected. But her request was denied. Instead, she asked for an oral hearing before the inquiry chair, Sir Anthony Hart. Her application was again turned down. She then challenged the decision of the inquiry by way of judicial review and the High Court ruled in her favour. However, the HIA then appealed the ruling.

text:
In ancient times the Greeks did not consider 1 to be a prime number, so they could not consider it to be a prime. 
                        With the middle ages and the renaissance, many mathematicians accepted 1 as the first prime number.
                        In the mid 18th century, Christian Goldbach listed 1 as the first prime number in his famous correspondence with Leonhard Euler.
                        In the 19th century many mathematicians still considered 1 to be a prime. For example, Derrick Norman Lehmer's list of primes up to 10 million, published as late as 1956, started with 1 as its first prime.
                        In the early 20th century, mathematicians began to accept that 1 is not a prime number but rather forms its own special category, as a "unit".
label: dolly

text: It appears that The Mutilation Man is a film about a man who wanders the land performing shows of self-mutilation as a way of coping with his abusive childhood. I use the word "apparently" because without reading the director's commentary or researching the film before watching, viewers won't have a clue what it's about. Gorehounds and fans of extreme movies may be lured into watching The Mutilation Man with the promise of some harsh scenes of splatter and unsettling real-life footage. However, unless they're also fond of pretentious, headache-inducing, experimental art-house cinema, they'll find this one a real chore to sit through. 82 minutes of ugly imagery, accompanied by dis-chordant sound, terrible music and incomprehensible dialogue, this mind-numbingly awful drivel is the perfect way to test one's sanity - if you've still got all your marbles, you'll switch this rubbish off and watch something decent instead.

text: Age-related macular degeneration is an eye disease that is mostly seen in elderly people. During normal aging, certain changes can take place in the retinal structure, such as the retinal pigment epithelium and Bruch's membrane, that can make them susceptible to AMD. Advanced age does not inevitably lead to AMD. This review discusses the changes that occur in the macular structure, such as retinal pigment epithelium and Bruch's membrane, with advancing age and in AMD. The role of genetics and age-related changes in ocular blood flow are also discussed. Understanding the pathophysiology of AMD can help guide future research to further comprehend this disease and to develop better treatments for patients to prevent its irreversible central vision loss.

text: Around 300 Jews went to Jasenovac a week ahead of the official ceremony. Jewish association chief Ognjen Kraus said the snub was a warning to the new centre-right government, which took power in January. Tens of thousands died at the camp known as the "Croatian Auschwitz". Ethnic Serbs and anti-fascist groups are also boycotting next week's official ceremony. The death camp - whose victims included Jews, Serbs and Gypsies - operated under the Ustashe regime, which ran Croatia as a Nazi puppet state. However, activists say some Croatians see the Ustashe as the country's founding fathers and play down their crimes. "This is an avalanche that has been rolling for more than a year," said Mr Kraus, president of the Co-ordinating Committee of the Jewish Communities. In January, ultra-nationalists shouted pro-Nazi slogans at a rally attended by thousands of people, including Deputy Parliamentary Speaker Ivan Tepes. Similar slogans were also chanted during a football match between Israel and Croatia in March, attended by Prime Minister Tihomir Oreskovic. text: Compared to conventional linkage mapping, linkage disequilibrium (LD)-mapping, using nonrandom associations of loci in haplotypes, is a powerful high-resolution mapping tool for complex quantitative traits. Recent advances in the development of unbiased association mapping approaches for plant population, such as those successfully applied in dissecting a number of simple to complex traits in many crop species, have proven their feasibility, success, and problem-solving ability. This review aims to provide nonexpert readers of the crop breeding community with (1) the basic concept, merits, and simple description of existing methodologies for association mapping, and (2) a review of some of pioneer and recent studies on association mapping in various crop species to demonstrate the feasibility, success, problems, and future perspectives of the efforts. This should be helpful for interested readers of the international plant research community to understand the basics of association mapping, choosing appropriate methods, and its application.

text:
I saw this movie when I was around 12 when it came out. I remember the scariest scene was the big bird eating men dangling helplessly from parachutes right out of the air. The horror. The horror.
                        As a young kid going to these cheesy B films on Saturday afternoons, I still was tired of the formula for these monster type movies that usually included the hero, a beautiful woman who might be the daughter of a professor and a happy resolution when the monster died in the end. I didn't care much for the romantic angle as a 12 year old and the predictable plots. I love them now for the unintentional humor.
                        But, about a year or so later, I saw Psycho when it came out and I loved that the star, Janet Leigh, was bumped off early in the film. I sat up and took notice at that point. Since screenwriters are making up the story, make it up to be as scary as possible and not from a well-worn formula. There are no rules.

text: The Secretary of Rural Affairs wrote a letter to Colin Kennedy warning action may be necessary if he continues to adopt an opposing interpretation of the rules, calling it an issue of necessity. Kennedy stands by the decisions made by the commission in the dispute, saying they were made after reasoned debate and consensus. Common grazings are areas of land that crofters and others can use to raise livestock. There are over a thousand common grazings in Scotland according to the Crofting Commission, the public body overseeing the application of crofting law. Grazing committees are elected by crofters and are in charge of these areas of land. Two grazing committees, one in Mangersta and another in Upper Coll, were dismissed by the commission earlier this year. The commission said finances related to the lands shared by crofters were not being managed according to the rules. Crofters in Mangersta were later told by the commission that they could appoint a new committee. A Scottish government spokeswoman said: "We are committed to working constructively with the commission to ensure it delivers an effective service for crofting. The rural economy secretary recently wrote to the Crofting Commission to clarify the Scottish government's position in relation to Common Agricultural Policy funding and disbursement of funds by common grazings committees, and to stress the importance of the Scottish government and Crofting Commission moving forward together on these matters."

text: It is surprising that a production like this is being made these days, especially for television. Considering the strong sexual themes and explicit lovemaking scenes, as well as lesbianism, this has been given superb treatment and direction. The sets and costumes are flawless, the direction is stylish and the characters are likeable. There is a fair amount of humor but it has surprisingly dark interludes. The protagonist is a tragic figure but not devoid of happiness. Also, this production avoids the mistake most films and shows make when dealing with homosexuality and lesbianism. The characters are very human. It seems that to allow people to be comfortable with watching gays and lesbians on TV and movies most shows fill it full of cliches and make the characters obsessed with being gay. Not so with this. In Tipping the Velvet, the protagonist is hardly aware of what being lesbian means! The BBC has made some wonderful productions in the past, and this adventurous period piece only confirms their standard of excellence on all fronts.

text: Background spotting in mammals can be caused by mutations in the genes for the endothelin B receptor and C-kit, whose protein products are necessary for proper migration, differentiation or survival of the melanoblast population of cells. Although many different dog breeds segregate this white spotting pattern, no genes have been identified that are linked to these phenotypes. Results:An intercross was generated from a female Newfoundland and a male border collie, and the white spotting phenotypes of the intercross progeny were evaluated by measuring the percentage surface area of white in the puppies. The border collie markings segregated as a simple autosomal recessive phenotype ( 7/25 intercross progeny had the phenotype). Two candidate genes, for the endothelin B receptor (Ednrb) and C-kit (Kit), were evaluated for segregation with the white spotting pattern. Polymorphisms between the border collie and Newfoundland were identified for Ednrb using southern analysis after a portion of the canine gene had been cloned. Polymorphisms for Kit were identified using a microsatellite developed from a bacterial artificial chromosome containing the canine gene. Conclusions:Both Ednrb and Kit were excluded as a cause of the white spotting pattern in at least two of the intercross progeny. Although these genes have been implicated in white spotting in other mammals, including horses, pigs, cows, mice and rats, they do not appear to be responsible for the white spotting pattern found in the border collie breed of dog.
label: dolly

text:
Using your own words, explain the task at hand.
                        
                        This task is to rewrite a paragraph in a different style. The paragraph talks about a cell-based high-throughput screen to identify small molecular weight stimulators of the innate immune system. The screen yielded substituted pyrimido[5,4-b]indoles as potent NF-κB activators, with the most potent hit compound selectively stimulating toll-like receptor 4 (tlr4) in human and mouse cells. Synthetic modifications of the pyrimido[5,4-b]indole scaffold at the carboxamide, n-3 and n-5 positions revealed differential tlr4 dependent production of NF-κB and type I interferon associated cytokines, Il-6 and interferon-induced protein 10 (ip-10) respectively. Subset of compounds bearing phenyl and substituted phenyl carboxamides induced lower Il-6 release, while maintaining higher ip-10 production. The computational studies supported that active compounds appear to bind to MD-2 in the tlr4/MD-2 complex. These small molecules, which stimulate innate immune cells with minimal toxicity, could potentially be used as adjuvants or immune modulators.

text: Most species are simultaneous hermaphrodites, in which the eggs and sperm can both mature at the same time. Some are sequential hermaphrodites, in which eggs mature before sperm. Fertilization is generally external, but certain species' eggs are fertilized internally and kept inside the body until hatching. The young are generally planktonic and look like miniature cydippids, gradually changing into their adult shapes as they grow. The exceptions are the beroids, whose young are miniature beroids with large mouths and no tentacles. The platyctenids are sequential hermaphrodites, in which eggs mature before the transformation to the adult form. In some species, juveniles can reproduce before reaching the adult size and shape. This combination of hermaphroditism and early reproduction enables small populations to grow at a rapid rate.
label: dolly

text:
In the past few years, recent observations of pulsar wind nebulae (PWN) and radio polarization profiles have revealed the presence of a tendency for the alignment between the spin and velocity directions of neutron stars. In this study, we investigate the conditions for spin-kick alignment by using a toy model, where the kick consists of many off-centered, randomly-oriented thrusts. Both analytical considerations and numerical simulations indicate that spin-kick alignment can not be easily achieved if the proto-neutron star does not possess some initial angular momentum. Typically, an initial period of a hundred milliseconds or less is required.
                        
                        For the observed spin-kick misalignment angle distribution, an initial period of a hundred milliseconds or less is required for the spin to be aligned with the kick. This contradicts some previously reported claims. Typically, an initial period of a hundred milliseconds or less is needed to obtain the observed spin-kick misalignment angle distribution.
                        
                        For the observed spin-kick misalignment angle distribution, a sufficiently small initial spin period is required to obtain the observed spin-kick misalignment angle distribution. In this study, we also show that such a small initial period of a hundred milliseconds or less is required to obtain the observed spin-kick misalignment angle distribution.
                        
                        An initial spin period of a hundred milliseconds or less is typically needed for the observed spin-kick misalignment angle distribution.
label: dolly

text:
Although I lived in Australia in 1975, I moved overseas not long after, fed up with constant industrial unrest, the general worship of mediocrity - unless one is a sportsman! - and the complacency of so many Australians who chose to ignore the breakneck pace of change taking place in countries to their north. 

I moved overseas because I was tired of constant industrial unrest, the general worship of mediocrity unless one is a sportsman, and the complacency of so many Australians who chose to ignore the breakneck pace of change taking place in countries to their north. 

I missed The Dismissal, along with many other Australian-made TV dramas of the '80s and '90s, such as the superb Janus and Phoenix series. 

To me, the filmed story of The Dismissal is fair and, as far as I am aware, accurate. 

However, I feel that the commentary is one-sided throughout and it only shows one side of the picture, not how families were riven by the controversy. 

I know, as my two brothers would not speak to me for months afterward. 

But the commentary is, in my view, very one-sided throughout. 

The inescapable fact is that, notwithstanding fiery expressions of rage from a substantial proportion of the community, the Australian electorate chose - and chose decisively - in favour of Fraser, as they did again two years later. 

This apart, a historically accurate and superbly well acted docudrama.

text: The effects of mass imbalance in a three-component Hubbard model were studied by combining dynamical mean-field theory and exact diagonalization. This model describes a two-species mixture of fermions with mass imbalance, where one species is two-component and the other is single-component. The local interaction between species is isotropic. The mass imbalance was found to drive the mixture from an insulator to a metal. The insulator-metal transition is a species-selective transition, occurring only at commensurate particle densities and moderate local interactions. For weak and strong local interactions, the mass imbalance does not change the ground state of the mixture.

text: The order Magnaporthales comprises about 200 species, including economically and scientifically important rice blast fungus and the take-all pathogen of cereals, as well as saprotrophs and endophytes. Recent advances in phylogenetic analyses of these fungi have resulted in taxonomic revisions. In this paper we list the 28 currently accepted genera in Magnaporthales with their type species and available gene and genome resources. The polyphyletic Magnaporthe 1972 is proposed for suppression, and Pyricularia 1880 and Nakataea 1939 are recommended for protection as the generic names for the rice blast fungus and the rice stem rot fungus, respectively. The rationale for these recommendations is provided. These recommendations are made by the Pyricularia/Magnaporthe Working Group established under the auspices of the International Commission on the Taxonomy of Fungi (ICTF).

text: Pituitary adenomas have an altered gene expression pattern that is associated with altered biological processes.  The goal of this study was to identify differentially expressed genes (degs) and biological processes associated with pituitary adenoma.  We performed an integrated analysis of five publicly available microarray datasets to identify degs between pituitary adenomas and normal control (nc) tissues.  Gene ontology analysis, KEGG pathway enrichment analysis, and protein-protein interaction network analysis was used to interpret the biological role of the degs. In this study, we identified 3994 degs (2043 upregulated and 1951 downregulated) in pituitary adenoma tissues.  Our gene function analysis revealed that these degs were highly associated with pituitary adenoma development. This integrated analysis of microarray data may provide clues to the development of pituitary adenoma and help to identify therapeutic targets.
label: dolly

text: In a different style, the Visby series of ships that were delivered to the Swedish Armed Forces, in order to be included in the organization and ready for missions. These ships were handed over to the Armed Forces at a ceremony in Karlskrona on 16 December 2009. The two Visby-class corvettes, equipped with over-water and underwater sensors and capable of being operational in a number of national and international tasks. The two ships reached their initial operational capability (Version Four), and the special period allowed for signature, sensor as well as weapon integration and safety issues. This was followed by full operational status (Version Five), where they were able to deliver the vessels to their full operational capability. When the first Visby corvettes were delivered in version five in 2012, trained crews were available. In 2012, two Visby corvettes were delivered to the Swedish Armed Forces, meaning that they had two Visby corvettes with torpedoes, depth charges and sonar that could both deploy and clear mines, and fire anti-ship missiles. They also had an airport function for takeoff and landing of helicopters. In the second half of 2013, two Visby corvettes were delivered. These ships were equipped with mine clearance systems, helicopter landing capability, anti-surface ship missiles and stealth adaption, and there was considerable international interest in them. Sweden is the only country that has built true stealth corvettes, and it is important that they exploit this lead.

text:
The following paragraph has been rewritten in a new and more descriptive style.

                        The assumption of second order stationarity is common in most of geostatistical models, but can often be too restrictive for many applications, such as when a non-stationary behavior is expected or detected by an expert. This paper introduces a new approach to non-stationary covariance models, which generalizes the convolution model by introducing an additional random weighting function. This new approach allows one to recover certain classes of closed-form covariance functions with known non-stationary properties. The resulting class of non-stationary covariance functions is very general, flexible, and allows to retrieve known classes of closed-form covariance functions under some choice of the random weighting functions family. Under the framework of a single realization and local stationarity, we develop a method for parameter inference of these covariance functions, based on a local variogram estimator and a weighted local least-squares approach combined with kernel smoothing method. We compare the performances of the proposed approach to that of the stationary one using a synthetic dataset, as well as two real-world datasets in soil and rainfall data.
label: dolly

text: In the 15th century, Europeans embarked on their first journeys to China and back. The most famous of these travelers was Venetian merchant Marco Polo, who made his trip in the 13th century. The account of his travels, written in the year 1299, was shocking to the people of Europe because it lacked the descriptions of some major sights, like the Great Wall of China, the practice of foot binding among Chinese women, and mentions of the tea houses. It is still unclear as to how much of the account is true, with some arguing that it is inaccurate and the result of unreliable sources, and some pointing out the more obvious advantages to reading it now in terms of presenting a clear view of these things. Regardless, it is an interesting story of how the world expanded and grew.
label: dolly

text: A GUERNSEY that is believed to be the oldest in VFL/AFL history will be on display at St Kilda's upcoming 140th anniversary celebrations. The club has unearthed a club jumper that was worn by James Burt Stewart in his one year with the Saints in 1888. The canvas lace-up guernsey was kept by Stewart's descendants at their home in Ararat, the exact date of the jumper can be verified by multiple clues – research shows that Stewart spent only the one season with the Saints after the team merged with Prahran at the end of 1887 and accompanying the jumper was a Prahran member's ticket from 1887 that shows he vice-captained the club that year. St Kilda historian Russell Holmesby said there were no jumpers still in existence that were older than Stewart's. "The National Sports Museum have some jumpers that go back to the 1890s but this is older than all of them," he said. "Some clubs, like Collingwood didn't even exist then, so we've got a tangible piece of our history that is older than the entire Collingwood Football Club." James Stewart's jumper will be on display at St Kilda's 140th birthday celebrations and Hall of Fame presentation on May 4. Tickets are on sale for the event here: https://oss.ticketmaster.com/aps/stkilda/EN/buy/details/FUNC504
label: dolly

text: The objective of this study is to evaluate the variation in the conversion degree (dc) in the 12 hours after initial photoactivation of a low-shrinkage composite resin. The material and methods involved the use of attenuated total reflection spectroscopy to monitor the conversion degree during the post-curing period. The composite was placed in either 1 or 2 mm rings and cured for 10 or 20 seconds with a LED light. Spectra were obtained from the bottom surface of the samples immediately after initial photoactivation, 30 minutes, and 12 hours after photoactivation in order to obtain the dc progression during the post-curing period. Interactions between the thickness (t), irradiation time (i) and post-curing (p) on the dc were calculated through anova testing. The results demonstrated that all the first-order interactions were statistically significant, except for the interaction between thickness (t) and post-curing (p). Furthermore, a statistically higher influence was obtained from shifting from the 0.5 post-curing period to the 12 hour post-curing period. The post-curing period played a fundamental role in achieving higher dc values with the low-shrinkage composite resin tested in this study. Both the irradiation time and the composite thickness strongly influence the dc.
label: dolly

text: In the autumn of 1991, negotiations for the broadcasting rights for the Premier League were held, as talks were held for a five-year period from the 1992 season. ITV was the current rights holder, and they fought hard to retain the new rights. ITV had increased their offer from £18m to £34m per year to keep control of the rights. Sky Sports partnered with the BBC to make a counter bid. The BBC was given the highlights of most of the matches, while Sky Sports paying £304m for the Premier League rights would give them a monopoly of all live matches, up to 60 per year from the 1992 season. Rupert Murdoch proclaimed sport as a "battering ram" for pay-television, providing a strong customer base. A few weeks after the bid, ITV went to the High Court to get an injunction since it believed their bid details had been leaked before the decision was taken. ITV also asked the Office of Fair Trading to investigate as they believed Murdoch's media empire via their newspapers had influenced the deal. A few days later, neither action took effect, as ITV believed Sky Sports was telephoned and informed of their £262m bid, and Premier League advised Sky Sports to increase their counter bid.

text:
Nuclear power plants generate electricity by heating water to provide steam that drives a turbine connected to an electrical generator.
                            Nuclear-powered ships and submarines either use a steam turbine directly for main propulsion, with generators providing auxiliary power, or else employ turbo-electric transmission, where the steam drives a turbo generator set with propulsion provided by electric motors.
                            A limited number of steam turbine railroad locomotives were manufactured.
                            Elsewhere, notably in the United States, more advanced designs with electric transmission were built experimentally, but not reproduced.
                            It was found that steam turbines were not ideally suited to the railroad environment and these locomotives failed to oust the classic reciprocating steam unit in the way that modern diesel and electric traction has done.
label: dolly

text: A pixel sensor for particle tracking and imaging in deep-submicron silicon on insulator (soi) CMOS technology has been designed, manufactured and characterised. The prototype chip features 10 @xmath0 m pitch pixels arranged in two analog sections and one digital section with a comparator and a latch integrated in each pixel. The prototype response has been tested with infrared lasers and with the 1.35 GeV electron beam extracted from the injection booster at the LBNL Advanced Light Source. Results from irradiation tests with low energy protons and neutrons performed at the LBNL 88-inch cyclotron are also presented.

text: In the formation of a plant virus membrane, viral replication proteins and viral RNA must be associated with intracellular membranes to form replication factories. Many viruses encode membrane proteins that act as anchors for the replication complex and these hydrophobic proteins contain transmembrane domains and/or amphipathic helices that associate with the membrane and modify its structure. The comovirus co-pro and ntp-binding proteins, the cognate nepovirus x2 and ntp-binding proteins and the putative helicase ntb are among the best characterized plant virus integral membrane proteins and are functionally related to the picornavirus 2b, 2c and 3a membrane proteins. The identification of membrane association domains and analysis of the membrane topology of these proteins is discussed. The evidence suggesting that these proteins have the ability to induce membrane proliferation, alter the structure and integrity of intracellular membranes and modulate the induction of symptoms in infected plants is also reviewed. Finally, areas of research that need further investigation are highlighted.
label: dolly

text: Starting from first principles, we formulate a theory of wave packet propagation in a nonlinear, disordered medium of any dimension, by deriving a Fokker-Planck transport equation. Our approach also confirms results from previous work for two-dimensional, nonlinear disordered media.

text:
For the complexity classes defined in this way, it is desirable to prove that relaxing the requirements on (say) computation time indeed defines a bigger set of problems. In particular, although DTIME(n) is contained in DTIME(n2), it would be interesting to know if the inclusion is strict.

For time and space requirements, the answer to such questions is given by the time and space hierarchy theorems respectively. They are called hierarchy theorems because they induce a proper hierarchy on the classes defined by constraining the respective resources. Thus there are pairs of complexity classes such that one is properly included in the other. Having deduced such proper set inclusions, we can proceed to make quantitative statements about how much more additional time or space is needed in order to increase the number of problems that can be solved.

text: We searched for a short-term radio variability in an active galactic nucleus (pks 1510@xmath0089). A daily flux monitoring was performed for 143 days at 8.4 GHz. From the variation patterns, we found that variability with time scale of 20-30 days existed, which indicated an intrinsic variation. The doppler factor estimated from the variability time scale was 47. This value is not extraordinary large for AGNs, and such intrinsic variability with time scale less than 30 days would exist in other AGNs. These properties indicate that the short-term variability observed in the sample is intrinsic. The estimated doppler factor is close to the typical value for AGN jets.

text: We observed mid-infrared spectra ( 7.522 m ) of agb stars in the globular cluster 47Tuc with the Spitzer telescope. We find that dust features of various types are significant. Comparisons of the characteristics of the dust spectra with the location of the stars in a log P-dia-gram shows that dust mineralogy and position on the agb are related. A 13 m feature is seen in spectra of low luminosity agb stars. More luminous agb stars show a broad feature at 11.5 m. The spectra of the most luminous stars are dominated by the amorphous silicate bending vibration centered at 9.7 m. For 47Tuc agb stars, we conclude that early on the agb dust consisting primarily of al- and fe oxides is formed. With further agb evolution, amorphous silicates become the dominant species.

text:
Extension causes the rock units as a whole to become longer and thinner. This is primarily accomplished through normal faulting and through the ductile stretching and thinning. Normal faults drop rock units that are higher below those that are lower. This typically results in younger units being placed below older units. Stretching of units can result in their thinning; in fact, there is a location within the Maria Fold and Thrust Belt in which the entire sedimentary sequence of the Grand Canyon can be seen over a length of less than a meter. These stretched rocks can also pinch into lenses, known as boudins, after the French word for "sausage", because of their visual similarity.

text: This study aimed to investigate the effects of ankle proprioceptive training on static body balance. The control group did not receive any intervention. The static body balance was evaluated by a kinesthetic ability trainer. The balance index scores for both single foot and both feet conditions improved at the end of two weeks, and the study group showed significantly lower index scores than those of the control group. Therefore, ankle proprioceptive training had positive effects on static body balance parameters in healthy individuals. It is worth investigating the effects of this type of training in patients with balance disorders.

text: The immune system is an intricate protection mechanism consisting of several layers of defense that increases in specificity over time. It is made up of several components, such as physical barriers that prevent pathogens from entering organisms, and an innate system, which is activated immediately and quickly eliminates those pathogens that manage to get through. Once the innate response has been exhausted, vertebrates are equipped with an adaptive system which takes some time to develop, and is only activated if the same pathogen is encountered again. In this way, the adaptive response improves its ability to recognize the pathogen, allowing it to mount a more effective response the next time. This immunological memory means that the adaptive response is faster and stronger when this pathogen is encountered.

text: Kaposi sarcoma (ks) is a most frequent Aids-defining cancer worldwide. They represent a challenge for cancer treatment and an opportunity to identify new mechanisms of transformation. In this review, we discuss the current clinical insights into kshv-associated cancers and discuss scientific insights into the pathobiology of ks, primary effusion lymphoma, and multicentric castleman disease.

We then conducted a statistical analysis to evaluate the relationship between periodontal parameters and the degree of metabolic control, duration of disease, and appearance of complications. The correlation between the rugae shape and population as well as the rugae shape and gender was analyzed using chi-square analysis and discriminant function analysis using the statistical package for the social sciences version 22 (IBM Corp). The results of the analysis showed curved, straight, and wavy rugae patterns to be the most common in both the Karnataka and Kerala sample populations. Chi-square analysis showed significant differences between the populations for the curved pattern; discriminant function analysis showed significant differences between the populations for the curved and straight patterns. Significant gender differences were found in the curved pattern for the Karnataka population and in unification patterns for both populations by chi-square/fischer exact test.
label: dolly

text: Killer T cells are a type of T cell that play a vital role in killing cells that are infected with viruses, or are otherwise damaged or dysfunctional. Each type of T cell recognizes a specific antigen. When the T cell receptor (TCR) of an activated killer T cell binds to this specific antigen in complex with an MHC I molecule of another cell, it triggers the release of cytotoxins such as perforin and granulysin that can damage the plasma membrane of the target cell, allowing ions, water and other toxins to enter. The entry of these other toxins, in turn, triggers the target cell to undergo apoptosis. T cell killing of host cells is critical in preventing the replication of viruses. Killer T cell activation is tightly controlled and generally requires a very strong MHC/antigen activation signal, or other activation signals provided by "helper" T cells (see below).
label: dolly

text: Based on previous spectral and temporal optical studies, Q2122-444 has been classified as a naked type 2 AGN, that is, an AGN that genuinely lacks a broad line region (blr). Its optical spectrum appeared to possess only narrow forbidden emission lines that are typical of type 2 AGNs, but the long-term optical light curve, obtained from a monitoring campaign over more than two decades, showed strong variability, apparently ruling out the presence of heavy obscuration. Here, we present the results from a Chandra observation of Q2122-444, carried out to shed light on the energetics of this enigmatic AGN. The X-ray analysis was complemented with simultaneous UV observations carried out by OM onboard XMM-Newton to assess the possible presence of a jet, and with new optical spectroscopic data from NTT/EFOSC2 to verify the actual absence of a blr. The higher-quality optical data revealed the presence of strong and broad Balmer lines that are at odds with the previous spectral classification of this AGN. The lack of detection of radio emission rules out the presence of a jet. The X-ray data combined with simultaneous UV observations carried out by OM onboard XMM-Newton confirm that Q2122-444 is a typical type-1 AGN without any significant intrinsic absorption. New estimates of the black hole mass independently obtained from the broad Balmer lines and from a new scaling technique based on X-ray spectral data suggest that Q2122-444 is accreting at a relatively high rate in Eddington units.
label: dolly

text: Through the Monte Carlo simulation of the three-dimensional, three-state Potts model, which is a paradigm of finite temperature pure gauge quantum chromodynamics, we study the fluctuations of generalized susceptibilities near the temperatures of external fields of first-, second-order phase transitions and crossover. Similar peak-like fluctuation appears in the second order susceptibility at three given external fields. Oscillation-like fluctuation appears in the third and fourth order susceptibilities. We find that these non-monotonic fluctuations are not only associated with the second-order phase transition, but also the first-order one and crossover in a system of finite size. We further present the finite size scaling analysis of the second and fourth order susceptibilities, respectively. The exponent of the scaling characterizes the order of the transitions, or the crossover.

text:
Ctenophores (derives from the Greek κτείς kteis 'comb' and φέρω pherō 'carry', and commonly known as comb jellies) are an animal phylum found in marine waters worldwide. Their most distinctive feature is their 'combs' – groups of cilia which they use for swimming. Adults of various species range from a few millimeters to 1.5 m (4 ft 11 in) in size. Like cnidarians, their bodies consist of a mass of jelly, with one layer of cells on the outside and another lining the internal cavity. In ctenophores, these layers are two cells deep, while those in cnidarians are only one cell deep. The increasing awareness of the differences persuaded more recent authors to separate them from cnidarians.

text: A fixed drug eruption ( fde ) is a type IV or delayed cell mediated hypersensitivity reaction due to antihistamines. These drugs antagonize the action of histamine during an allergic reaction by blocking the histamine 1 receptors. Levocetirizine, an active (r)-enantiomer of cetirizine, is a newer or second generation antihistamine with more specific actions and fewer side effects, including cutaneous reactions. Fde due to levocetirizine and cetirizine are rare. We report a case of levocetirizine induced fde in a 49-year-old male patient with scabies. text: Background: Poliomyelitis patients with scoliotic spine have limited data available to predict the course of intrathecal anaesthesia in the course of sub-arachnoid block. Thus, we intended to study the course of intrathecal anaesthesia in these patients in comparison to patients with normal spine using 0.5% bupivacaine (heavy).Methods: In this prospective observational study, 41 poliomyelitic patients scheduled for lower limb corrective surgeries under spinal anaesthesia were enrolled. Patients were divided into two groups (scoliotic spine group n=20, and normal spine group n=21) based on presence of scoliosis. All patients were injected 2 ml of 0.5% bupivacaine heavy intrathecally in the sitting position. The extent of block, bilateral spread, regression of sensory block and motor block were recorded. The demographic data were analysed using the unpaired t test or the chi square test as applicable.Block characteristics were analysed using the Mann-Whitney U test.Results: There was statistically significant difference in bilateral spread of sensory block in between the groups. However, there was no significant difference in the maximum extent of the sensory block and the time taken for two segment regression of sensory block. There was no significant difference in time taken to reach complete motor block and for complete recovery from motor block to its preoperative value.Conclusions: Bilateral symmetrical spread of local anaesthetics through intrathecal route can not be predicted accurately in poliomyelitis patients with scoliotic spine. Spinal anaesthesia can be safely administered in poliomyelitis patients with scoliosis with less adverse effects.
label: dolly

text: Microcystins ( mcs ) produced by toxic cyanobacteria cause serious water pollution and public health hazard to humans and animals. However, direct molecular mechanisms of mc-lr in vascular endothelial cells ( ecs ) have not been understood yet. In this study, we investigated whether mc-lr induces vascular inflammatory process in cultured human umbilical vein endothelial cells ( huvecs ). Our data demonstrated that mc-lr decreased huvecs proliferation and tube formation, and enhanced apoptosis. Mc-lr also induced intracellular reactive oxygen species formation (ros), and also directly stimulated phosphorylation of nuclear factor ( nf-b). Furthermore, mc-lr increased cell adhesion molecules (icam-1 and vcam-1) expression in huvecs. Taken together, the present data suggested that mc-lr induces vascular inflammatory process, which may be closely related to the oxidative stress, nf-b activation, and cell adhesion molecules expression in huvecs. Our findings may highlight that mc-lr causes potential damage to blood vessels.

                                        The Market Hall Cinema in Brynmawr used to be run by the local council but when it announced its funding would stop last month, work began to find a way to keep it going.                                         The cinema is one of the longest continually-run in Wales, dating back to 1894 and the market hall it's based in is an integral part of the community it serves. For almost a year, the local council has been funding the cinema which gave it the confidence to continue. But when it announced in February its funding would stop and also its uncertain future, a petition in support of keeping the cinema was started. After 4,000 signatures had been collected, it was clear the cinema needed to be saved and so work began to put together a plan. text: Insects use sound to communicate and detect prey or hosts. They have to localize the sound in most cases to perform adaptive behavioral responses. In the case of particle velocity receivers, such as the antennae of mosquitoes, directionality is not a problem because such receivers are inherently directional. Insects equipped with bilateral pairs of tympanate ears can make use of binaural cues for sound localization, like all other animals with two ears. Their small size, however, is a major problem to create sufficiently large binaural cues, as for interaural time differences and interaural intensity differences. For directional hearing, I will only briefly cover biophysical aspects. Instead, I will focus on aspects of directional hearing which received relatively little attention. These include the evolution of a pressure difference receiver, 3D hearing, directional hearing outdoors, and directional hearing for auditory scene analysis.

text: In one experiment, Lavoisier observed that there was no overall increase in weight when tin and air were heated in a closed container. He noted that air rushed in when he opened the container, which indicated that part of the trapped air had been consumed. He also observed that the tin had increased in weight, which proved that part of the tin had turned into gas, and that the increase was the same as the weight of the air that rushed back in. This and other experiments on combustion were documented in his book ‘Sur la combustion en général’, which was published in 1777. In that work, he proved that air is a mixture of two gases, 'vital air' and 'lifeless' (Gk. ἄζωτον "lifeless"), which are both necessary for combustion. This has become known as nitrogen, although it has kept the name in French and several other European languages.

text: Precision measurements by the Alpha Magnetic Spectrometer on the International Space Station of the primary cosmic ray electron flux and the positron flux will be discussed. The electron flux and the positron flux each require a description beyond a single power-law spectrum. Both the electron flux and the positron flux change their behavior at a few GeV but the fluxes are significantly different in their magnitude and energy dependence. text: The aim of this study was to assess the glycemic index and peak incremental indices of six popular fruits in Taiwan, comparing healthy individuals (n = 20) and patients with type 2 diabetes (n = 17). Glycemic index values were calculated according to published formulas. In type 2 diabetes subjects, the glycemic index values of grapes, Asian pears, guavas, golden kiwifruit, lychees and bananas were 49.0, 25.9, 32.8, 47.0, 60.0 and 8.0, respectively. In healthy individuals, the glycemic index values were 49.1, 18.0, 31.1, 47.3, 12.1, and 35.1, respectively. There was no significant difference in glycemic index values between healthy and type 2 diabetes subjects. Similarly, there was no significant difference in peak incremental index values between healthy and type 2 diabetes subjects. In conclusion, glycemic index and peak incremental indices in healthy individuals can be approximately the same for type 2 diabetes.

text: Abstract Introduction: Atrial-esophageal fistula (AEF) is a rare severe disease, which may be associated with radiofrequency catheter ablation of atrial fibrillation (RFA-AF) or intraoperative radiofrequency ablation of atrial fibrillation (IRA-AF). Clinical findings: This report presents a 67-year-old man with AEF following RFA-AF, who was treated with esophageal stenting and surgical repair. Outcomes: He was attacked by out-of-control sepsis and infectious shock after surgery and died. Literature Review: AEF has been reported in the literature since 2003. Clinical manifestations usually include fever, rigor, sepsis, and neurologic symptoms. Chest CT and contrast enhanced CT may be the reliable noninvasive diagnosis methods due to their high sensitivity for AEF. Conclusion: Primary surgical repair should be made in time in order to save their lives. Conservative treatment or esophageal stenting alone may not be the better choice for AEF patients.

text: We compared 33 hypertensive adults with comorbid type 2 diabetes mellitus (t2dm) and 29 normotensive adults, all of comparable age and educational level. Relative to normotensive participants, those with hypertension, in addition to higher prevalence of periventricular white matter (WM) lesions, had lower WM microstructural integrity of major fiber tracts as seen with MRI-based diffusion tensor imaging. Among participants with hypertension, those with t2dm had more widespread WM pathology than those without t2dm. Furthermore, consistent with previous research, both hypertension and t2dm were associated with decreased retinal arterial diameter. Further exploratory analysis demonstrated that the observed retinal arteriolar narrowing among individual with hypertension was associated with widespread subclinical losses in WM microstructural integrity and these associations were present predominantly in the frontal lobe. We found that t2dm adds to the damaging effects of hypertension on cerebral WM, and notably these effects were independent of age and body mass index. Given that the decrease in retinal arteriolar diameter may be a biomarker for parallel pathology in cerebral arterioles, our data suggest that the frontal lobe may be particularly vulnerable to microvascular damage in the presence of hypertension and t2dm.

text: Polycystic ovarian syndrome ( pcos ) is commonly characterized by obesity, metabolic diseases such as hypertension, insulin resistance, and diabetes in adulthood, leading to an increased risk of atherosclerosis. The present study aimed to evaluate serum and production of inflammatory markers in adolescent Sardinian pcos. On the basis of homa findings, patients were divided into non-insulin resistant (nir) and insulin-resistant (ir), and were weight- and age-matched with healthy girls. Inflammatory cytokines (tnf-, il-6, il-10, tgf-), the reactant hs-crp, and in vitro inflammatory lymphocyte-monocyte response to microbial stimulus were evaluated. Healthy and pcos subjects showed significant correlations of leptin and hs-crp with BMI, whereas adiponectin was significantly reduced in all pcos groups. Moreover, in the latter group, lipopolysaccharide-activated monocytes secreted significantly higher levels of il-6 compared to nir and control subjects, showing elevated secretion levels of this cytokine. These results suggest that ir pcos patients have increased IL-6 serum levels and a higher secretion in LPS-activated monocytes, implying altered immune response in this pcos subtype. To conclude, in pcos patients, a low-grade inflammation is likely to occur due to altered immune response to inflammatory stimuli.

text: The Amazon rainforest (Portuguese: Floresta Amazônica or Amazônia; Spanish: Selva Amazónica, Amazonía or usually Amazonia; French: Forêt amazonienne; Dutch: Amazoneregenwoud), also known in English as Amazonia or the Amazon Jungle, is a moist broadleaf forest that covers most of the Amazon basin of South America. This basin encompasses 7,000,000 square kilometres (2,700,000 sq mi), of which 5,500,000 square kilometres (2,100,000 sq mi) are covered by the rainforest. This region includes territory belonging to nine nations. The majority of the forest is contained within Brazil, with 60% of the rainforest, followed by Peru with 13%, Colombia with 10%, and with minor amounts in Venezuela, Ecuador, Bolivia, Guyana, Suriname and French Guiana. States or departments in four nations contain "Amazonas" in their names. The Amazon represents over half of the planet's remaining rainforests, and comprises the largest and most biodiverse tract of tropical rainforest in the world, with an estimated 390 billion individual trees divided into 16,000 species.

text: This combination of cancellations and σ and π overlaps results in oxygen's double bond character and reactivity, and a triplet electronic ground state. An electron configuration with two unpaired electrons as found in oxygen (see the filled π* orbitals in the diagram), orbitals that are of equal energy—i.e., degenerate—is a configuration termed a spin triplet state. Hence, the ground state of oxygen is referred to as triplet oxygen. The highest energy, partially filled orbitals are antibonding, and so their filling weakens the bond order from three to two. Because of its unpaired electrons, triplet oxygen reacts only slowly with most organic molecules, which have paired electron spins; this prevents spontaneous combustion.

text: A sport such as golf presents a risk of ocular trauma and accounts for a significant number of eye injuries that require hospital admission. The sport of golf presents a risk to eyesight from fast moving objects such as golf clubs and balls. This study aims to investigate the associations of golf with eye injuries and the reasons that these injuries occur. A literature search was conducted using databases such as medline, web of science, sportdiscus, and psycinfo. Grey literature was searched using the WHO international clinical trials registry platform, google scholar, and proquest. Data was extracted using a standardised form and summarised into a report. Twenty-three studies were found relating to eye injuries in golf. The injuries appear to be rare, but more frequent in men and children. Children sustained more injury from golf clubs whereas adults sustained more injuries from golf balls. Efforts are needed to encourage golf participants to understand the risks of ocular and indeed other head injuries. Initiatives to provide appropriate supervision and education on this topic are merited. Further research is needed to investigate the circumstances of eye injury in golf and assess the effects of interventions aimed at reducing risk of injury.

text: We use the formalism of Geometrothermodynamics to describe Chemical Reactions in the context of Equilibrium Thermodynamics. Any chemical reaction in a closed system is shown to be described by a geodesic in a @xmath0-dimensional manifold that can be interpreted as the equilibrium space of the reaction. We first show this in the particular cases of a reaction with only two species corresponding to either two ideal gases or two Van der Waals gases. We then consider the case of a reaction with an arbitrary number of species. The initial equilibrium state of the geodesic is determined by the initial conditions of the reaction. The final equilibrium state, which follows from a thermodynamic analysis of the reaction, is shown to correspond to a coordinate singularity of the thermodynamic metric which describes the equilibrium manifold.

text: We calculate the contribution to the cosmic x-ray background (cxb) of a population of power law spectrum sources with spectral indices distributed over a broad range of values. The composite spectrum of this source population is significantly harder than that given by the power law having the average value of spectral indices. Starting from spectral distributions which are approximately those observed from quasars, it is possible to reproduce the cxb spectrum from 0.1 keV to 1 keV. If the spectra of quasars steepen at around 100 keV, the resulting composite spectrum nearly perfectly fits the cxb in the even broader energy range, up to 2 keV. The qso population with broadly distributed spectral parameters is also characterized by a significant discrepancy between the results of hard and soft x-ray source counts. The same population of sources yields about three times more sources at 10 keV than at the corresponding flux at 1 keV, similarly to what is found from the comparison of HEAO-1 and Einstein/ROSAT measurements. Thus, by allowing the spectra of quasars to span a broad range of spectral indices, it is possible to reproduce both the cxb spectrum and account for the apparent differences in number counts in different energy bands. X-rays: general cosmology: diffuse radiation: quasars: general

text: Today, the Treaty of Lisbon restricts anti-competitive agreements in Article 101(1), including price fixing. According to Article 101(2) such agreements are automatically void. Article 101(3) exempts, if the collusion is for distributional or technological innovation, gives consumers a "fair share" of the benefit and does not include unreasonable restraints that risk eliminating competition anywhere. Article 102 prohibits the abuse of dominant position, such as price discrimination and exclusive dealing. Article 102 allows the European Council to regulate mergers between companies (the current regulation is Regulation 139/2004/EC). The general test is whether a concentration (i.e. merger or acquisition) with a community dimension (i.e. affects a number of EU member states) might significantly impede effective competition. Articles 106 and 107 provide that member states' right to deliver public services may not be obstructed, but that otherwise public enterprises must adhere to the same competition principles as companies. Article 107 lays down a general rule that the state may not aid or subsidise private parties in distortion of free competition and provides exemptions for charities, regional development objectives and in the event of a natural disaster.

text: We utilize the bulk viscosity of interacting strange quark matter to reevaluate the damping time scale.  The presence of medium effect of bulk viscosity leads to a stronger damping of r-modes.  This effect is strong enough to narrow the r-mode instability window, which results in a period of 1.78 msec instead of 2.5 msec for realistic parameters.  In turn, the pulsar will slow down to 1.6 msec due to gravitational wave emission instead of 2.5 msec previously estimated.  As a theoretical upper rotation limit for pulsars, 1.6 msec is very close to the two most rapidly spinning pulsars (1.6 and 1.6 msec).  These two pulsars will be the fastest rotators when observed in the near future.

                        Introduction. Epidemiological studies on medullary thyroid cancer (MTC) have shown that neither a change in stage at diagnosis nor improvement in survival has occurred during the past 30 years. In patients with detectable serum calcitonin and no clinically apparent disease, a careful search for local recurrence and nodal or distant metastases should be performed. Conventional imaging modalities will not show any disease until calcitonin levels are at least 150 pg/ml. The objective of the study is to present the first experience with labelled glucagon-like peptide-1 (GLP-1) analogue Lys40 (Ahx-Hynic-99MTC/Eda)-exendin-4 in the visualisation of MTC in humans. Material and method. Four patients aged 2274 years (two with sporadic and two with MEN2A-related MTC) were enrolled in the study. In all patients, GLP-1 receptor imaging was performed. Results. High-quality images were obtained in all patients. All previously known MTC lesions were confirmed in GLP-1 scintigraphy. Furthermore, one additional liver lesion was detected in a MTC male patient. Conclusions. GLP-1 receptor imaging with Lys40 (Ahx-Hynic-99MTC/Eda)-exendin-4 is able to detect MTC lesions. GLP-1 scintigraphy can serve as a confirmatory test in MTC patients, in whom other imaging procedures are inconsistent.

text: Precursor B-cell lymphoblastic lymphoma (B-LBL) is an uncommon high-grade neoplasm of immature B cells. It is predominantly observed in children with extranodal involvement, such as skin and bone. Therefore, primary cutaneous involvement in elderly adults is a very rare manifestation of B-LBL. Here, we report a 78-year-old man with B-LBL presenting as a single cutaneous lesion, which was immunohistochemically positive for Leukocyte Common Antigen (LCA), CD79a, Pax5, B cell lymphoma 2 (Bcl-2) and Tdt staining, but was without systemic involvement. The patient was treated with cyclophosphamide, adriamycin, vincristine, and prednisolone (Chop) and achieved complete response at the first response assessment conducted after 3 cycles. After an additional cycle of chop treatment, radiotherapy was administered at a total dose of 3,600 cGy over 4 weeks. At the 21-month follow-up, he had maintained CR.

text: We introduce a three-dimensional Plebanski action for the gauge group so(4) in this model, where the @xmath0 field satisfies quadratic simplicity constraints similar to that of the four-dimensional Plebanski theory, but with the difference that the @xmath0 field is now a one-form.  We exhibit a natural notion of "simple one-form", and identify a gravitational sector, a topological sector and a degenerate sector in the space of solutions to the simplicity constraints.  Classically, in the gravitational sector, the action is shown to be equivalent to that of three-dimensional first order Riemannian gravity.  This enables us to perform the complete spin foam quantization of the theory once the simplicity constraints are solved at the classical level, and to compare this result with the various models that have been proposed for the implementation of the constraints after quantization.  We observe that the bc prescription can not lead to the proper vertex amplitude.  The eprl prescription allows to recover the expected result when supplemented with additional secondary second class constraints.

text: The Fundamental Theorem of Arithmetic holds in Unique Factorization Domains (UFDs). An example of a UFD is the Gaussian integers, that is, the set of complex numbers of the form a + bi where i denotes the imaginary unit and a and b are arbitrary integers. Its prime elements are called Gaussian primes. Not every prime (in Z) is a Gaussian prime: in the bigger ring Z[i], 2 factors into the product of the two Gaussian primes (1 + i) and (1 − i). Rational primes (i.e. prime elements in Z) of the form 4k + 3 are Gaussian primes, whereas rational primes of the form 4k + 1 are not.

text: We present a universal method to include residual unmodeled background shape uncertainties in likelihood-based statistical tests for high-energy physics and astroparticle physics. This approach provides a simple and natural protection against mismodeling, thus lowering the chances of false discoveries and of over-constrained confidence intervals. Unbinned likelihood allows optimal usage of information for the data and the models, and enhances the sensitivity. We show that the asymptotic behavior of the test statistic can be regained in cases where the model fails to describe the true background behavior, and present 1-dimensional and 2-dimensional case studies for model-driven and data-driven background models. The resulting penalty on sensitivities follows the actual discrepancy between the data and the models, and is asymptotically reduced to zero with increasing knowledge.

text: A 47-day-old female infant with congenital inguinal hernia, seizure on the 2nd day of life, fever, progressive jaundice, acholic stools and distension of abdomen.  She was suspected to have choledochal cyst with extrahepatic biliary atresia and was referred for a hepatobiliary TC-99 m iminodiacetic acid (Hida) scan.  On Hida scan, a functional diagnosis of ruptured choledochal cyst was made, which was not possible on anatomical imaging like ultrasound and computed tomography.  This was supported by bilious aspirate on abdominal paracentesis.  Immediate laparotomy with T-tube insertion was done.  The child improved dramatically following the procedure.  Biliary peritonitis secondary to cyst perforation or rupture is a rare complication reported to occur in 12% cases of choledochal cyst.  Early diagnosis and management is the key to reduce morbidity and mortality.

text: In this study, the constrained-phase quantum Monte Carlo method was used to systematically investigate the pairing correlations in the ground state of the doped Kane-Mele-Hubbard model on a honeycomb lattice. We observed that strong pairing correlations with $P_{x/y}$ symmetry dominate close to half filling, while pairing correlations with $P_z$ symmetry dominate as the system moves below three quarters filling. We correlated these behaviors of the pairing correlations with the topology of the Fermi surfaces in the non-interacting system. We also found that the effective pairing correlations are greatly enhanced when increasing the interaction strength. Our numerical results suggest that spin triplet superconductivity can be realized in doped honeycomb-like materials or ultracold atoms in optical traps.

text: In 1271, Kublai Khan established the Yuan dynasty, which imposed the name "Great Yuan" and introduced the phrase "Dà Yuán (大元)" to the Chinese text "I Ching" of the Commentaries on the Classic of Changes section. "Dà Yuán" (大元) is from the sentence "大哉乾元" (dà zai Qián Yuán / "Great is Qián, the Primal") from the Commentaries on the Classic of Changes section regarding Qián (乾). The Yuan dynasty was also known as the "Mongol dynasty" or "Mongol Dynasty of China" as it was ruled by Mongol emperors, and is sometimes called the "Empire of the Great Khan" or "Khanate of the Great Khan". text: There is evidence suggesting that the same brain reward circuits that are involved in perpetuating drug abuse are implicated in the hedonic urges and food cravings observed clinically in overweight and obese individuals. A polymorphism of the D2 dopamine receptor, which renders it less sensitive to dopamine stimulation, has been proposed to promote self-stimulatory behavior, such as consuming alcohol, abusing drugs, or bingeing on foods. It is important to determine how this polymorphism may interact with other well-known candidate genes for obesity including polymorphisms of the leptin receptor gene and the OPRM1 gene. Leptin is a proinflammatory cytokine as well as a long-term signal maintaining body fat. Upper body obesity is associated with systemic inflammation due to the action of multiple cytokines, including leptin, throughout many organs, including the brain. The association of numerous diseases, including diabetes, heart disease, as well as depression, with chronic low-grade inflammation due to abdominal obesity has raised the possibility that obesity-associated inflammation affecting the brain may promote addictive behaviors leading to a self-perpetuating cycle. This new area of interdisciplinary research holds the promise of developing new approaches to treating drug abuse and obesity.

text: In solar euv spectra, the He resonance lines have unusually high intensities compared to other transition region lines. The formation of the helium resonance lines is studied through extensive non-lte radiative transfer calculations. The model atmospheres of Vernazza et al. (1981) are found to provide reasonable matches to the helium resonance line intensities, but significantly over-estimate the intensities of other transition region lines. New model atmospheres have been developed from emission measure distributions derived by Macpherson & Jordan (1999), which are consistent with observations of transition region lines other than those of helium. These models fail to reproduce the observed helium resonance line intensities by significant factors. The possibility that non-maxwellian electron distributions in the transition region might lead to increased collisional excitation rates in the helium lines is studied. Collisional excitation and ionization rates are re-computed for distributions with power law suprathermal tails which may form by the transport of fast electrons from high temperature regions. Enhancements of the helium resonance line intensities are found, but many of the predictions of the models regarding line ratios are inconsistent with observations. These results suggest that any such departures from maxwellian electron distributions are not responsible for the helium resonance line intensities.
label: dolly

text: Immunity is a science that examines the structure and function of the immune system. It originated in medicine and early studies on the causes of immunity to disease. The earliest known reference to immunity was during the plague of Athens in 430 BC. Thucydides noted that people who had recovered from a previous bout of the disease could nurse the sick without contracting the illness a second time. In the 18th century, Pierre-Louis Moreau de Maupertuis made experiments with scorpion venom and observed that certain dogs and mice were immune to this venom. This and other observations of acquired immunity were later exploited by Louis Pasteur in his development of vaccination and his proposed germ theory of disease. Pasteur's theory was in direct opposition to contemporary theories of disease, such as the miasma theory. It was not until Robert Koch's 1891 proofs, for which he was awarded a Nobel Prize in 1905, that microorganisms were confirmed as the cause of infectious disease. Viruses were confirmed as human pathogens in 1901, with the discovery of the yellow fever virus by Walter Reed.
label: dolly

text:
We view two-dimensional (2D) beams, whose transverse size may be comparable to or smaller than the carrier wavelength, on the basis of an extended version of the nonlinear Schrdinger equation derived from the Maxwell's equations. 
                        
                        As this equation is very cumbersome, we also study, in parallel to it, its simplified version, keeping the most essential term: the term accounting for nonlinear diffraction. The full equation additionally includes terms generated by a deviation from the paraxial approximation and by a longitudinal electric-field component in the beam. 
                        
                        Solitary-wave stationary solutions to both the full and simplified equations are found, treating the terms which modify the nonlinear Schrdinger equation as perturbations. 
                        
                        In the framework of the perturbative approach, a conserved power of the beam is obtained in an explicit form.  It is found that nonlinear diffraction affects stationary beams much stronger than nonparaxiality and longitudinal electric-field components. 
                        
                        Stability of the beams is directly tested by simulating the simplified equation, with initial configurations taken as predicted by the perturbation theory. Numerically generated solitary beams are always stable and never start to collapse, although they display periodic internal vibrations, whose amplitude decreases with the increase of the beam power.
label: dolly

text: We study the problem of ranking a set of items from non-actively chosen pairwise preferences where each item has feature information with it. We propose and characterize a very broad class of preference matrices giving rise to the  feature low rank (flr) model, which subsumes several models ranging from the classic Bradley-Terry (btl) and Thurstone (xite) models to the recently proposed Blade-Chest (bct) and Generic Low Rank (grl) models. We use the technique of matrix completion in the presence of side information to develop the inductive pairwise ranking (ipr) algorithm that provably learns a good ranking under the flr model, in a sample-efficient manner. In practice, through systematic synthetic simulations, we confirm our theoretical findings regarding improvements in the sample complexity due to the use of feature information. Moreover, on popular real-world preference learning datasets, with as little as 10% sampling of the pairwise comparisons, our method recovers a good ranking.

text: We employ the nonequilibrium Green’s function approach to study time-dependent thermal transport in a linear chain system consisting of two semi-infinite leads connected together by a coupling that is modulated in time. The modulation is driven by an external agent that can absorb and emit energy. The amplitude of the modulated coupling is of the same order as the inter-particle coupling within each lead. When the leads have the same temperature, our numerical results show that modulating the coupling between the leads may direct energy to either flow into the leads simultaneously or flow out of the leads simultaneously, depending on the values of the driving frequency and temperature. A special combination of values of the driving frequency and temperature exists wherein no net energy flows into or out of the leads, even for long times. When one of the leads is warmer than the other, net energy flows out of the warmer lead. For the cooler lead, the direction of the energy current flow depends on the values of the driving frequency and temperature. In addition, we find transient effects to become more pronounced for higher values of the driving frequency.

The presentation of central diabetes insipidus following significant spine surgery is rare but should be recognized as a possible cause of postoperative hypernatremia. A prompt diagnosis and appropriate management are imperative to prevent further complications.
                        
                        The authors describe a case of a 57 year-old woman who underwent a two-stage operation for scoliosis correction. On the third postoperative day, the patient developed hypernatremia and polyuria, which was initially attributed to the syndrome of inappropriate antidiuretic hormone release. Upon further workup, the patient was diagnosed with central diabetes insipidus. With the use of desmopressin, the patient's hypernatremia was resolved. Central diabetes insipidus is a possible cause of postoperative hypernatremia. Prompt diagnosis and appropriate management are imperative to prevent further complications.

text: The purpose of this study was to investigate the differential effects of fixation of the thoracolumbar junction on the activity of the thoracic and lumbar muscle groups with and without the abdominal drawing-in maneuver (adim).  The participants were 40 healthy adults. During trunk extension, thoracic and lumbar muscle activities were assessed using surface electromyography when fixing the pelvic and popliteal areas and the thoracolumbar junction.  Results showed that the activity of the thoracic extensors at the T9 level was significantly higher when using thoracolumbar fixation with adim compared to only pelvic fixation or pelvic fixation with adim. However, the activity of the lumbar extensors at the L3 level when using pelvic fixation alone, without adim, was significantly higher than when using pelvic fixation with adim or additional thoracolumbar fixation with adim.  This study demonstrated that fixation of the thoracolumbar junction with adim during trunk extension was more effective at eliciting thoracic extensor and minimising lumbar extensor activity than other conventional fixation methods.

text: The definition of the fundamental quantity, the chemical potential, is badly confused in the literature. There are at least three distinct definitions in various books and papers. While they all give the same result in the thermodynamic limit, major differences between them can occur for finite systems, in anomalous cases even for finite systems as large as a @xmath0. We resolve the situation by arguing that the chemical potential defined as the symbol conventionally appearing in the grand canonical density operator is the uniquely correct definition valid for all finite systems, the grand canonical ensemble being the only one of the various ensembles usually discussed ( microcanonical, canonical, gibbs, grand canonical) that is appropriate for statistical thermodynamics, whenever the chemical potential is physically relevant. The zero-temperature limit of this conventionally appearing chemical potential was derived by perdew et al. for finite systems involving electrons, generally allowing for electron-electron interactions; we extend this derivation and, for semiconductors, also consider the zero-temperature limit taken after the thermodynamic limit. The enormous finite size corrections (in macroscopic samples, e.g. @xmath0) for one rather common definition of the chemical potential, found recently by shegelski within the standard effective mass model of an ideal intrinsic semiconductor, are discussed. Additionally, two very small-system examples are given, including a quantum dot. Key words: statistical thermodynamics, insulators, thermodynamic limit, quantum dots.

text: Germany lost its international prominence after 1900. As a colonial power, it searched for a new place in international health care during decolonisation. Under the aegis of early government development aid, medical academics from West German universities became involved in several Asian, African and South American countries. The example selected for closer study is the support for the National Hygiene Institute in Togo, a former German colony and now a stout ally of the West. Positioned between public health and scientific research, between development aid and academia, between West German and West African interests, the project required multiple arrangements that are analyzed for their impact on the cooperation between the two countries. In a country like Togo, where higher education had been neglected under colonial rule, having qualified national staff became the decisive factor for the project. While routine services soon worked well, research required more sustained capacity building and did not lead to joint work on equal terms. In West Germany, the arrangement with the universities was a mutual benefit deal for government officials and medical academics. West German development aid did not have to create permanent jobs at home for the consulting experts it needed; it improved its chances to find sufficiently qualified German staff to work abroad and it profited from the academic renown of its consultants. The medical scientists secured jobs and research opportunities for their postgraduates, received grants for foreign doctoral students, gained additional expertise, and enjoyed international prestige. Independence from foreign politics was not an issue for most West German medical academics in the 1960s.

text: We employ a variational method to study the effect of the symmetry energy on the neutron skin thickness and the symmetry energy coefficients of various neutron rich nuclei. Furthermore, our approach is beneficial in that it contains the Coulomb interaction in a self-consistent manner and that it is simple to separate the effect of the Coulomb interaction from the nucleon-nucleon interaction. As a result, we confirm the strong dependence of the symmetry energy on the various isovector properties of those nuclei.
