text: Introductory paragraph.  Posttraumatic psychopathology (ptp) describes the spectrum of conditions that can complicate the recovery from commonly occurring musculoskeletal trauma.  There is a clear association with the activation of the hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenal axis (hpaa) and we wished to examine the predictive value of proinflammatory markers of the hpaa and of the gamma-aminobutyric acid (gaba), which acts as an inhibitory regulator.  Methods.  Levels of proinflammatory markers and gaba were measured in 84 patients who had suffered musculoskeletal injuries requiring hospitalisation.  Ptp was assessed by the use of the general health questionnaire (ghq) at presentation and again at two- and six-month reviews.  Results.  Significant psychological disturbance was noted in 39% of patients at two months and falling back to 18% by six months.  There was no correlation between any of the markers tested at presentation and ptp at follow up.  Discussion.  The hpaa response to trauma and the development of ptp are extremely complex.  It is unlikely that a simple blood assay will provide significant predictive information, while incident specific information and patient perception are of more practical use.

text: We propose a simple method for incorporating correlations into the impact parameter space description of multiple (semi-)hard partonic collisions in high energy hadron-hadron scattering. The perturbative QCD input is the standard factorization theorem for inclusive dijet production with a lower cutoff on transverse momentum. The width of the transverse distribution of hard partons is fixed by parameterizations of the two-gluon form factor. We then reconstruct the hard contribution to the total inelastic profile function and obtain corrections due to correlations to the more commonly used eikonal description. Estimates of the size of double correlation corrections are based on the rate of double collisions measured at the Tevatron. We find that, if typical values for the lower transverse momentum cutoff are used in the calculation of the inclusive hard dijet cross section, then the correlation corrections are necessary for maintaining consistency with expectations for the total inelastic proton-proton cross section at the LHC.

text: IMDB, owned by Amazon, said it believes the law is unfairly tailored to only apply to them and that it infringes on its free speech rights. text: Our lab has examined the effect of particle shape on the electrorotation (ER) spectrum of living cells. In particular, we have examined coated oblate spheroidal particles and have presented a theoretical study of ER based on the spectral representation theory. We have analytically derived expressions for the characteristic frequency and dispersion strength, thus simplifying the fitting of experimental data on oblate spheroidal cells which abound in the literature. From the theoretical analysis, we find that the cell shape, coating as well as material parameters can change the ER spectrum. We show good agreement between our theoretical predictions and experimental data on human erythrocyte suspensions.

text: Oxygen storage methods include high pressure oxygen tanks, cryogenics and chemical compounds. For reasons of economy, oxygen is often transported in bulk as a liquid in specially insulated tankers, since one liter of liquefied oxygen is equivalent to 840 liters of gaseous oxygen at atmospheric pressure and 20 °C (68 °F). Liquid oxygen is passed through heat exchangers, which convert the cryogenic liquid into gas before it enters the building. Oxygen is also stored and shipped in smaller cylinders containing the compressed gas; a form that is useful in certain portable medical applications and oxy-fuel welding and cutting.

text: A deterministic Turing machine is the most basic Turing machine, which uses a fixed set of rules to determine its future actions. A probabilistic Turing machine is a deterministic Turing machine with an extra supply of random bits. The ability to make probabilistic decisions often helps algorithms solve problems more efficiently. Algorithms that use random bits are called randomized algorithms. A non-deterministic Turing machine is a deterministic Turing machine with an added feature of non-determinism, which allows a Turing machine to have multiple possible future actions from a given state. One way to view non-determinism is that the Turing machine branches into many possible computational paths at each step, and if it solves the problem in any of these branches, it is said to have solved the problem. Clearly, this model is not meant to be a physically realizable model, it is just a theoretically interesting abstract machine that gives rise to particularly interesting complexity classes. For examples, see non-deterministic algorithm.
label: dolly

text: Glucose homeostasis is regulated by both insulin and leptin, the central hormones regulating food intake and adiposity.  Both of these hormones act centrally, regulating food intake and adiposity.  Leptin has several effects on the glucose - insulin metabolism, some of which are independent of body weight and adiposity.  Those effects of leptin are determined centrally in the hypothalamus and peripherally in the pancreas, muscles, and liver.  Leptin has beneficial effects on the glucose - insulin metabolism, by decreasing glycemia, insulinemia, and insulin resistance.  The understanding of the effects of leptin on the glucose - insulin homeostasis will lead to the development of leptin-based therapies against diabetes and other insulin resistance syndromes.  In this review, we summarize the interactions between leptin and insulin, and their effects on the glucose metabolism.
label: dolly

text:
Gyrokinetic validation studies are crucial in developing confidence in the model incorporated in numerical simulations and thus improving their predictive capabilities.
                        
                        As one step in this direction, we simulate an ASDEX upgrade discharge with the code, and analyze various fluctuating quantities and compare them to experimental measurements. The approach taken is the following. First, linear simulations are performed in order to determine the turbulence regime. Second, the heat fluxes in nonlinear simulations are matched to experimental fluxes by varying the ion temperature gradient within the expected experimental error bars. Finally, the dependence of various quantities with respect to the ion temperature gradient is analyzed in detail. It is found that density and temperature fluctuations can vary significantly with small changes in the ion temperature gradient, thus making comparisons with experiments very sensitive to uncertainties in the experimental profiles. However, cross-phases are more robust, indicating that they are better observables for comparisons between gyrokinetic simulations and experimental measurements.
label: dolly

Since 1983, it has been operating the University of Chicago Press, the largest university press in the United States. text: In the triplet form, O2 molecules are paramagnetic. That is, they impart magnetic character to oxygen when it is in the presence of a magnetic field, due to the spin magnetic moment of the unpaired electrons in the molecule, and the negative exchange energy between neighboring O2 molecules. Liquid oxygen is attracted to a magnet enough that, in laboratory demonstrations, a bridge of liquid oxygen may be supported against its own weight between the poles of a powerful magnet.

text: Tory Pigott was out with friends when she spotted the injured pigeon off Devon's south coast at Ladram Bay. The bird had originally set off from Dorset a month before, but was found injured in Plymouth and nursed back to health and released again. Tory was able to trace the pigeon's original owner in Hertfordshire, who had sent a courier to collect the bird. Tory said: "We suddenly heard a flapping sound in the water and saw this pigeon desperately trying to crawl up the side of the rocks." Tory jumped into the water to rescue the pigeon which was "completely sodden" and "distressed" with a cut to its neck. Tory used the pigeon's identification number to trace the bird's owners, Ray and Brendan from Baldock, near Stevenage in Hertfordshire. Brendan Eccles said the pigeon was released in a race from Blandford, Dorset, on 01 August and should have been home "in a few hours". He said the four-month-old pigeon could have become disoriented and headed in the wrong direction. Racing pigeon enthusiast Terry Luscombe, from Plymouth, looked after the bird for three weeks and "got him back to fitness" before releasing him on Monday to return to Hertfordshire. Mr Luscombe said it appeared from the cut to the pigeon's neck he had been the victim of a second hawk attack that resulted in him landing in the water.

text: In the Jupiter - Io system, moon-induced currents in the magnetic field lines can create radio emissions that modulate along the paths of the currents. Extrapolating from a model in the Jupiter - Io system, criteria for exomoon detection can be defined. A cautiously optimistic scenario for possible detection of exomoons around Epsilon Eridani b and Gliese 876 b is provided.

text: The India-based Neutrino Observatory (INO) proposal for a magnetized iron calorimeter (ICAL) detector has been to locate a Geant4-based simulation of the detector in the India-based Neutrino Observatory. The main goal is to investigate the response of the detector to hadrons, specifically pions and kaons, interacting with the target nuclei. The simulated detector response is presented through a series of Monte Carlo (MC) simulations. The MC results show that the response of the detector to hadrons of different energies follows a vavilov distribution, as compared to a gaussian distribution at high energies. We also present the calibration of hadron energy as a function of the hit multiplicity and the energy resolution of the hadrons as a function of their energy. These two parameters are discussed in detail. Overall, the hadron energy response of the detector has been presented in detail, as well as its calibration and the hadron energy resolution.

text: The role of disorder in the field of three-dimensional time-reversal-invariant topological insulators has become an active field of research recently. Nevertheless, the computation of topological invariants for large, disordered systems still poses a considerable challenge. In this paper, we apply and extend a recently proposed method based on the scattering matrix approach, which allows the study of large systems at reasonable computational effort with few-channel leads. By computing the topological invariant directly for disordered topological anderson insulators, we unambiguously identify the topological nature of this phase without resorting to its connection with the clean case. We are able to efficiently compute the topological phase diagram in the mass-disorder plane. The topological phase boundaries are found to be well described by the self-consistent Born approximation, both for vanishing and finite chemical potential. Our method can be applied to arbitrary three-dimensional topological insulators.

text: Singlet oxygen is a term used to describe a specific form of molecular oxygen in which all of the electrons are paired up. After the Mongol conquest of Central Asia by Genghis Khan, foreigners were chosen as administrators and co-management with Chinese and Qara-Khitays (Khitans) of gardens and fields in Samarqand was put upon the Muslims as a requirement since Muslims were not allowed to manage without them. Again, the UK was exempt from legislation arising from the Protocol. The Protocol was called the "Social Chapter" despite not actually being a chapter of the Maastricht Treaty. text: Many analyses of time-dependent Ginzburg-Landau models are not consistent with statistical mechanics, as thermal fluctuations are not taken into account. We use the fluctuation-dissipation theorem in order to establish the appropriate size of Langevin terms, and thus ensure the required consistency. Fluctuations of the electromagnetic potential are essential even when we evaluate quantities that do not depend directly on it. Our method can be cast in gauge-invariant form. We perform numerous tests, and all the results are in agreement with statistical mechanics. We apply our method to evaluate paraconductivity of a superconducting wire. The aslamazov-larkin result is recovered as a limiting situation. Our method is numerically stable and the nonlinear term is easily included. We attempt a comparison between our numerical results and the available experimental data. Within an appropriate range of currents, phase slips occur but we found no evidence for thermally activated phase slips. We studied the behavior of a moderate constriction. text: The earliest recorded incidents of collective civil disobedience took place during the Roman Empire. Unarmed Jews gathered in the streets to prevent the installation of pagan images in the Temple in Jerusalem. In modern times, some activists who commit civil disobedience as a group refuse to sign bail until certain demands are met, such as favorable bail conditions, or the release of all the activists. This is a form of jail solidarity. There have also been many instances of solitary civil disobedience, such as that committed by Thoreau, but these sometimes go unnoticed. At the time of his arrest, Thoreau was not yet a well-known author, and his arrest was not covered in any newspapers in the days, weeks and months after it happened. The tax collector who arrested him rose to higher political office, and Thoreau's essay was not published until after the end of the Mexican War.

text: The Norman dynasty had a major political, cultural and military influence on medieval Europe and even the Near East. They were renowned for their martial spirit and eventually for their Christian piety, becoming exponents of the Catholic orthodoxy into which they assimilated. They adopted the Gallo-Romance language of the Frankish land they settled, their dialect becoming known as Norman French, an important literary language. The Duchy of Normandy, which they formed by treaty with the French crown, was a great fief of medieval France, and under Richard I of Normandy was forged into a cohesive and formidable principality in feudal tenure. The Normans are noted for both their culture, such as their unique Romanesque architecture and musical traditions, and for their significant military accomplishments and innovations. Norman adventurers founded the Kingdom of Sicily under Roger II after conquering southern Italy on the Saracens and Byzantines, and an expedition on behalf of their duke, William the Conqueror, led to the Norman conquest of England at the Battle of Hastings in 1066. Norman cultural and military influence spread from these new European centres to the Crusader states of the Near East, where their prince Bohemond I founded the Principality of Antioch in the Levant, to Scotland and Wales in Great Britain, to Ireland, and to the coasts of north Africa and the Canary Islands.

text: We consider the dynamical atom-wall Casimir-Polder force in the non-equilibrium configuration of an atom near a perfectly conducting wall, initially prepared in an excited state with the field in its vacuum state. We evaluate the time-dependent Casimir-Polder force on the atom and find that it exhibits an oscillatory behavior from attractive to repulsive both in time and in space. We also investigate the asymptotic behavior in time of the dynamical force and of related local field quantities, showing that the static value of the force, as obtained by a time-independent approach, is recovered for times much larger than the timescale of the atomic self-dressing, but smaller than the atomic decay time. We also discuss the evolution of global quantities such as atomic and field energies, and their asymptotic behavior. We show that new relevant features are obtained in the case of an initially excited atom, for example much larger values of the dynamical force with respect to the static one, allowing for an easier way to single-out and observe the dynamical Casimir-Polder effect. We compare our results for the dynamical force on the excited atom with analogous results recently obtained for an initially bare ground-state atom, showing that new relevant features are obtained in the case of an initially excited atom, for example much larger values of the dynamical force with respect to the static one. We also discuss the evolution of global quantities such as atomic and field energies, and their asymptotic behavior. We show that new relevant features are obtained in the case of an initially excited atom, for example much larger values of the dynamical force with respect to the static one, allowing for an easier way to single-out and observe the dynamical Casimir-Polder effect.

text: Dolphins have developed sophisticated behaviours to turn larger prey into bite-sized pieces, according to marine biologists in Australia. The technique is one way dolphins have managed to thrive in waters around Australia. They can bite off the head of the octopus first, and then shake the remainder, releasing their grip. This also prevents the octopus tentacles from latching onto dolphins, as they won't be able to use them for leverage. This complex behaviour is part of an ecosystem, with the octopuses providing a staple food source for the dolphins, who have learned to exploit it. Especially, through the analysis of the spin structure factor, ground state fidelity susceptibility and the Binder moment ratio, a continuous transition from the antiferromagnetic ordered state to the quantum disordered state is found at the critical coupling of @xmath1, in good agreement with the result of quantum Monte Carlo simulation. text: We propose a scalable approach to building cluster states of matter qubits using coherent states of light. Recent work on the subject relies on the use of single photonic qubits in the measurement process. These schemes can be made robust to detector loss, spontaneous emission and cavity mismatching, but as a consequence the overhead costs grow rapidly, in particular when considering single photon loss. In contrast, our approach uses continuous variables and highly efficient homodyne measurements. We present a two-qubit scheme, with a simple bucket measurement system yielding an entangling operation with probability 1/2. Then we extend this to a three-qubit interaction, increasing this probability to 3/4. We discuss the important issues of the overhead cost and the time scaling. This leads to a no-measurement approach to building cluster states, making use of geometric phases in phase space.

text: The emergence and magnetic evolution of solar active regions has been studied and analyzed using soho and mdi data from Cycle 23. We found that the writhed and top-to-top types of emerging ARs were more likely to produce higher flares. As the signs of twist and writhe agreed with each other for most cases of the writhed type, we propose a unified model in which the emerging flux regions in a AR are not separated but united as one single structure below the solar surface. This model explains how more complex ARs are more likely to be associated with higher flare activity. text: Unimodular gravity is classically equivalent to standard Einstein gravity, but differs when it comes to the quantum theory: The conformal factor is not dynamical and the gauge symmetry consists of transverse diffeomorphisms only. Furthermore, the cosmological constant is not renormalized. Thus, the quantum theory is distinct from a quantization of standard Einstein gravity. Here we show that, within a truncation of the full renormalization group flow of unimodular quantum gravity, there is a non-trivial ultraviolet attractive fixed point, yielding a UV completion for unimodular gravity. We discuss important differences to the standard asymptotic safety scenario for gravity, and provide further evidence for this scenario by investigating a new form of the gauge-fixing and ghost sector.

text: However, this definition is disputed by Thoreau's political philosophy of individual conscience versus collective, which would pit conscience against collective. The individual is the ultimate judge of right and wrong. More than this, since only individuals act, only individuals can act unjustly. When the government knocks on the door, it is an individual in the form of a postman or tax collector whose hand hits the wood. Before Thoreau's imprisonment, when a confused taxman had wondered aloud about how to handle his refusal to pay, Thoreau had advised, "Resign." If a man chose to be an agent of injustice, then Thoreau insisted on confronting him with the fact that he was making a choice. But if government is "the voice of the people", as it is often called, shouldn't that voice be heeded? Thoreau admits that government may express the will of the majority but it may also express nothing more than the will of elite politicians. Even a good form of government is "liable to be abused and perverted before the people can act through it". Moreover, even if a government did express the voice of the people, this fact would not compel the obedience of individuals who disagree with what is being said. The majority may be powerful but it is not necessarily right. What, then, is the proper relationship between the individual and the government?

text: Infrared ( ir ) light is vital for short-range wireless communication, thermal sensing, spectroscopy, material processing, medical surgery, astronomy, and more. However, it is much more difficult to transport than optical light or microwave radiation. Existing hollow-core infrared (ir) waveguides typically use a layer of metallic coating on the inner wall of the waveguide. Such a metallic layer, though reflective, still absorbs guided light significantly due to its finite ohmic loss, especially for transverse-magnetic ( tm ) light. In this paper, we show that metal wire based metamaterials may serve as an efficient tm reflector, reducing propagation loss of the tm mode by two orders of magnitude. By further imposing a conventional metal cladding layer, which reflects specifically transverse-electric ( te ) light, we can potentially obtain a low-loss hollow-core fiber. Simulations confirm that loss values for several low-order modes are comparable to the best results reported so far.

text: Collective atomic vibrations ( phonons ) in solids are more effective at transporting heat than photons. This is why the conduction mode of heat transport ( mediated by phonons ) is dominant compared to the radiation mode ( mediated by photons ) in non-metals ( mediated by phonons can not traverse a vacuum gap ). However, since phonons are unable to traverse a vacuum gap, it is commonly believed that two bodies separated by a gap can not exchange heat via phonons. Recently, a mechanism was proposed by Citex which explains how phonons can transmit heat across a vacuum gap. This heat transfer mechanism is relevant for heating and cooling nanostructures; the heating of flying heads in magnetic storage disks is an example. In this work, the theoretical derivation for modeling phonon transmission is revisited and extended to the case of two bodies made of different materials separated by a vacuum gap. Magnitudes of phonon transmission and hence heat transfer, for commonly used materials in the micro and nano-electromechanical industry are calculated and compared with the calculation of conduction heat transfer through air for small gaps.

text: Trioxygen (O 3) is known as ozone and is a very reactive allotrope of oxygen that is damaging to lung tissue. Ozone is produced in the upper atmosphere when O 2 combines with atomic oxygen made by the splitting of O 2 by ultraviolet (UV) radiation. Since ozone absorbs strongly in the UV region of the spectrum, the ozone layer of the upper atmosphere functions as a protective radiation shield for the planet. Near the Earth's surface, it is a pollutant formed as a by-product of automobile exhaust. The metastable molecule tetraoxygen (O 4) was discovered in 2001, and was assumed to exist in one of the six phases of solid oxygen. It was proven in 2006 that this phase, created by pressurizing O 2 to 20 GPa, is in fact a rhombohedral O 8 cluster. This cluster has the potential to be a much more powerful oxidizer than either O 2 or O 3 and may therefore be used in rocket fuel. A metallic phase was discovered in 1990 when solid oxygen is subjected to a pressure of above 96 GPa and it was shown in 1998 that at very low temperatures, this phase becomes superconducting.

text: Constant temperature molecular dynamics simulations were used to study solutions of flexible polyelectrolyte chains at nonzero concentrations with explicit counterions and unscreened coulombic interactions. Counterion condensation, measured via the self-diffusion coefficient of the counterions, is found to increase with polymer concentration, but contrary to the prediction of Manning's theory, the renormalized charge fraction on the chains decreases with increasing Bjerrum length, without showing any saturation. Scaling analysis of the radius of gyration shows that the chains are extended at low polymer concentrations and small Bjerrum lengths, while at sufficiently large Bjerrum lengths, the chains shrink to produce compact structures with exponents smaller than a Gaussian chain, suggesting the presence of attractive intrachain interactions. A careful study of the radial distribution function of the center-of-mass of the polyelectrolyte chains shows clear evidence that effective interchain attractive interactions also exist in solutions of flexible polyelectrolytes, similar to what has been found for rodlike polyelectrolytes. Our results suggest that the broad maximum observed in scattering experiments is due to clustering of chains.

text: A complete method is proposed to compute a certified, or ambient isotopic, meshing for an implicit algebraic surface with singularities. By certified, we mean a meshing with correct topology and any given geometric precision. We propose a symbolic - numeric method to compute a certified meshing for the surface inside a box containing singularities and use a modified plantinga - vegter marching cube method to compute a certified meshing for the surface inside a box without singularities. Nontrivial examples are given to show the effectiveness of the algorithm. ( See Fig. [fig - first].) To our knowledge, this is the first method to compute a certified meshing for surfaces with singularities. Keywords: surface, curve, topology, ambient isotopic meshing, marching cube, symbolic computation, interval arithmetic.

text: In the present study, the quids from la cueva de los muertos chiquitos (cmc) were subjected to an elisa test for two protozoan parasites: Toxoplasma gondii (n=45) and Trypanosoma cruzi (n=43). Human antibodies created in response to these parasites can be detected in modern saliva using elisa kits intended for use with human serum. For these reasons, quids were reconstituted and subjected to elisa testing. All test wells yielded negative results. These results could be a factor of improper methods because there is no precedence for this work in the existing literature. The results could equally be a simple matter of parasite absence among those people who occupied cmc. A final consideration is the taphonomy of human antibodies and whether or not elisa is a sufficient method for recovering antibodies from archaeological contexts. An additional elisa test targeting secretory IgA (siga) was conducted to further examine the failure to detect parasite-induced antibodies from quids. text: Recent discoveries of carbon-enhanced metal-poor stars like SSS J0313-670839.3 provide increasing observational insights into the formation conditions of the first second generation stars in the universe. Here, we present the first cosmological simulations with a detailed chemical network including primordial species as well as C, C@xmath0, O, O@xmath0, Si, Si@xmath0, and Si@xmath1 following the formation of carbon-enhanced metal-poor stars. The presence of background UV flux delays the collapse from C to C@xmath2 and cools the gas down to the CMB temperature for a metalicity of Z/Z@xmath4=10@xmath5. This can potentially lead to the formation of lower mass stars. Overall, we find that metals have a stronger effect on the collapse than radiation, yielding a comparable thermal structure for large variations in the radiative background. text: The processes that determine the strength, duration and variability of protostellar mass growth in a dense star-forming cluster environment is a fundamental ingredient for any theory of star formation. In a cluster, the accretion rates of high-mass protostars are found to be strongly time varying and influenced by the mutual interaction of protostellar cores and the competition for accretion from the common cluster gas reservoir. Even for protostars with similar final masses, the accretion histories can differ significantly. High-mass stars are concentrated in the central parts of dense cluster-forming cloud regions and begin to form early on during the turbulent fragmentation process of the cloud. They continue to grow at a high rate until the available gas is exhausted or expelled by feedback. Lower-mass stars are found to decline rapidly after a short initial growth phase. I present a simple fit formula for the time evolution of the average accretion rate for protostars of different masses in a dense cluster environment.

text: We propose a mechanism for the origin of the galactic ridge x - ray background that naturally explains the properties of the Fe K line, specifically the detection of the centroid line energy below 6.7 kev and the apparent broadness of the line. Motivated by recent evidence of nonthermal components in the spectrum of the galactic x-ray background, we consider a model that is a mixture of thermal plasma components of possibly supernova origin and nonthermal emission from the interaction of low energy cosmic ray electrons (lecre) with the interstellar medium. The lecre may be accelerated in supernova explosions or by ambient interstellar plasma turbulence. Atomic collisions of fast electrons produce characteristic nonthermal, narrow x-ray emission lines that can explain the complex galactic background spectrum. Using the ASCA GIS archival data from the Scutum arm region, we show that a two-temperature thermal plasma model with temperatures of @xmath1 and @xmath2 keV, plus a lecre component models the data satisfactorily. Our analysis rules out a purely nonthermal origin for the emission. It also rules out a significant contribution from low energy cosmic ray ions because their nonthermal x-ray production would be accompanied by a nuclear line diffuse emission exceeding the upper limits obtained using OSSE and by an excessive galaxy-wide Be production rate. The proposed model naturally explains the observed complex line features and removes the difficulties associated with previous interpretations of the data which evoked a very hot thermal component (of 3 keV) and a low-energy cosmic-ray ion component, which is not required to explain the complex line features. The proposed model naturally explains the observed complex line features and rules out previous interpretations of the data which evoked a very hot thermal component.

text: The Alice experiment at the Large Hadron Collider (LHC) proposes major detector upgrades to fully exploit the increase of the LHC’s luminosity in run 3 and to extend the physics reach for rare probes at low transverse momentum. text:
The main use for steam turbines is to generate electricity, as steam turbines have a high matching speed with electric generators and were dominant in this market until the 1990s, when gas turbines and combined cycle power plants came into more widespread use.
                        In power generation, the high speed of the steam turbines matches the speed of modern electric generators and results in a higher efficiency and lower maintenance than reciprocating steam engines. In marine applications, steam turbines have seen great success in the late 20th century, being more efficient and requiring far less maintenance than reciprocating steam engines. Now, gas turbines and combined cycle power plants dominate marine applications, with gas turbines being most common.
                        In the 20th century, steam turbines have seen success in electrical generation and high speed marine applications, where reciprocating steam engines had found great success. In recent decades, gas turbines and combined cycle power plants have nearly replaced steam propulsion for marine applications.

text: The objective of this study was to examine the tracking of high-sensitivity C-reactive protein (hscrp) in young adults over time, and to determine the factors associated with it. The study period lasted 10 years, from age 16 to 26. We found that hscrp levels did not differ by race, and that oral contraceptive use did not affect it. We found hscrp to track from age 16 to 26, with waist circumference, body mass index (bmi), and cholesterol levels as major determinants. Changes in bmi and triglyceride levels were associated with change in hscrp from age 24 to 26. Changes in bmi and cholesterol were associated with change in hscrp from age 25 to 26. All these findings indicate that hscrp tracking is present, and that it is associated with changes in waist circumference, body mass index, and lipid levels.

text: Miller Fisher Syndrome is a triad of total external ophthalmoplegia, ataxia, and areflexia, while botulism has the usual clinical presentation of involvement of cranial muscles and palsies with blurred vision, diplopia, ptosis, dilated pupils, and facial paralysis caused by a bacterial neurotoxin which attacks proteins involved in presynaptic vesicle release. In this report, we needed to differentiate between Miller Fisher Syndrome and botulism in a patient who presented with acute ophthalmoparesis and a history of diarrhea three days before, which started two days after consuming tinned food. Routine laboratory, neurophysiologic, and imaging investigations were normal. A clinical diagnosis of Miller Fisher Syndrome was reached by anti-ganglioside GQ1b and GM1 IgG and IgM antibody investigations which proved positive. The patient was treated with intravenous immunoglobulin two weeks after (in the late period) the symptoms started and he has recovered completely. Background: Subgroup of MS patients typically present with euphoria.  
                        
                        Objective: This study aimed to investigate the contributions made by varying operational definitions and measurement instruments. 
                        
                        Methods: One hundred MS patients and 100 matched controls completed a classical interview of Cottrell and Wilson and a modern neuropsychiatric inventory in a once-off interview.
                        
                        Results: The MS group demonstrated high frequencies of euphoria using the classical measure but low frequencies using the contemporary measure and definition. The matched control group demonstrated significantly higher rates than the MS group using the classical measure and lower rates than the MS group using the contemporary measure.
                        
                        Conclusion: The discrepancies in incidence rates of euphoria in the literature do not reflect a change in the incidence of euphoria in MS, but rather in the definition and operationalisation of euphoria. Moreover, these results highlight the importance of characterising what represents pathological euphoria as well as the need for better definitions and instruments of measure.

text: Renal pelvis squamous cell carcinoma is a rare neoplasm, often unsuspected clinically due to its rarity and ambiguous clinical and radiological features. As a result, patients often present at advanced stages of the disease, which lead to poor prognosis. Here, we report on four cases of incidentally diagnosed primary renal squamous cell carcinoma, which were treated at our hospital over a period of one year. The mean age of the patients was 60 years. All patients presented with staghorn stones. Interestingly, renal carcinoma was unsuspected clinically in all cases. In one case, a computerised tomography scan showed a suspicious nodule. All patients underwent nephrectomy for nonfunctioning kidneys. In two cases, tumor was identified on gross examination, while the other two only showed thickened pelvicalyceal biopsy. Our series emphasizes the need for pelvicalyceal biopsy during the treatment of long-standing nephrolithiasis, and thorough sampling of the renal pelvis in nephrectomy specimens of such patients.

text:
In a purely capitalist mode of production, professional and labor organizations cannot limit the number of workers, nor are workers' wages controlled by the employer but rather by the market. Wages are the same as prices for any other good, and thus the gap between the wage and the price of labor is driven by the race between the demand for the skilled worker and the supply of the skilled worker. Therefore, inequality is driven by this price. 
                             On the other hand, markets can also concentrate wealth, pass environmental costs on to society, and abuse workers and consumers. Additionally, markets, by themselves, even when they are stable, can often lead to high levels of inequality, outcomes that are widely viewed as unfair. Employers who offer a below market wage will find that their businesses are chronically understaffed, resulting in a competitive disadvantage. Competitors will take advantage of this situation by offering higher wages, with the best of their labor. For a businessman who has the profit motive as the prime interest, offering below or above market wages is a losing proposition.
label: dolly

text: The temperature of the intergalactic medium (igm) can provide a powerful constraint on the reionisation history. However, the temperature has been measured to a redshift of @xmath0. We use recent temperature measurements of the near-zones of seven quasars at @xmath2 to constrain the redshift by which hydrogen reionisation completed. We calibrate the model to reproduce observational constraints on the electron scattering optical depth and photo-ionisation rate. We then calculate the resulting spatially inhomogeneous temperature distribution at different reionisation scenarios. Under standard assumptions for the ionising spectra of population II sources, the temperature measurements constrain the redshift by which hydrogen reionisation was completed to be @xmath4 @xmath5 at 68 (95%) confidence. The measurements provide a powerful constraint on the redshift by which hydrogen reionisation completed, and are an important stepping stone in extending the power of temperature measurements of the igm. These measurements can be tightened and generalised in the future with measurements around other high redshift quasars.

text: Parkinson s disease (PD) is a neurodegenerative disease with heterogeneous pathological and clinical features. Cognitive dysfunction is a frequent non-motor complication, with varying degrees of severity. Cognitive dysfunction is a risk factor for poor prognosis and shows inter-individual variation in its progression. A variety of studies have tried to identify biomarkers of PD progression. The Parkinson's Progression Markers Initiative (PPMI) study is the largest study to date, enrolling drug-naïve and very early stage PD patients. The baseline characteristics of the PPMI cohort have recently been published. The diagnostic utility of cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) biomarkers, including alpha-synuclein (ASyn), total tau, phosphorylated tau at Thr181 (ptau), and amyloid 1-42 (A1-42), has been shown to be poor. However, the PPMI data suggested that the measurement of CSF biomarkers can be used to predict cognitive decline in PD patients. To further elucidate the relationship between Alzheimer's pathology and -synuclein pathology, longitudinal observational studies must be followed. We briefly discussed the pathological nature of heterogeneous cognitive decline in PD, followed by a summarized interpretation of the baseline CSF biomarkers from the PPMI data. The combination of clinical, biochemical, genetic, and imaging biomarkers of PD constitutes a feasible strategy to predict the heterogeneous progression of PD.

The general method for compressing the modulation time - bandwidth product of analog signals is introduced. This method is applied to signal processing, where it is demonstrated to offer performance improvements in the areas of feature-selective sampling and digital data compression. The advantage of this method is its ability to capture and compress fast temporal features that are beyond the bandwidth of conventional digitizers.  This physics-based signal grooming, performed in the analog domain before digitization, results in compression of the digital data size. The proposed transform is inspired by operation of the fovea centralis in the human eye and by anamorphic transformations in the visual arts. As such, the proposed transform can also be applied in the digital domain, where it can be used as a digital data compression algorithm for alleviating storage and transmission bottlenecks associated with ‘big data’.

text: Microtubules have been the focus of biophysical research for decades. Yet the conflicting results regarding their elasticity and fluctuations have cast some doubts on the present understanding. In this paper, we expose the empirical evidence for discrete GDP-tubulin fluctuations between a curved and a straight configuration at room temperature, as well as for conformational tubulin cooperativity. Guided by a number of experimental findings, we build the case for a novel microtubule model, with the principal result that microtubules can spontaneously form micron-sized cooperative helical states. The polymorphic dynamics of the microtubule lattice resulting from the tubulin bistability quantitatively explains several experimental puzzles, including anomalous scaling of dynamic fluctuations of grafted microtubules, their apparent length-stiffness relation, and their remarkably curved helical appearance in general. We point out that tubulin dimers' multistability and its cooperative switching could participate in important cellular processes, and could in particular lead to efficient mechanochemical signalling along single microtubules.

The Malaysian government had previously said it believed that the flaperon belonged to MH370. French investigators had until now been more cautious on the provenance of the debris.                         With that explanation, investigators said they had reached the conclusion that the flaperon belonged to the Malaysian Airlines plane that vanished on March 8. text: Production of B(0) bosons in association with jets is an important background to new physics at the LHC. The leptonic decays of B(4) bosons translates the common left-handed polarization into an effective experimental handle on separating B(0)+jets from top quark production, which exhibits very little asymmetry due to C invariance, and from various types of new physics. Cyclotides are plant-derived small proteins with a knotted structure.
                        They are genetically encoded as precursor proteins and then post-translationally modified to yield a circular cysteine-knotted structure.
                        The circular topology and resistance to enzymatic degradation make cyclotides potential lead molecules for pharmaceutical applications.
                        Despite ongoing efforts to discover novel cyclotides and analyze their biodiversity, it is not clear how many individual peptides are possible in a single plant specimen.  Therefore, we investigated the transcriptome and cyclotide peptidome of Viola tricolor, which enabled the characterization of cyclotide precursor architecture and processing sites important for the biosynthesis of mature peptides.
                        Transcriptome mining enabled the identification of cyclotides with as many as 164 sequences.
                        Our investigation of the cyclotide peptidome was done by mass spectrometry and bottom-up proteomics.
                        In total, 164 cyclotides were discovered in Viola tricolor, suggesting that violaceous plants may be a source of 150,000 individual cyclotides.

text: We are reporting on a study of the isophotal shapes of early-type galaxies, up to very faint levels of the sky brightness. The shapes of isophotes of early-type galaxies are important as they are correlated with the physical properties of the galaxies and are influenced by galaxy formation processes. In this paper, we report on a sample of 132 e and s galaxies in one LFC field. We have redshifts for 53 of these, obtained using AAomega on the Anglo-Australian Telescope. The shapes of early-type galaxies often vary with radius. We derive average values of isophotal shape parameters in four different radial bins along the semi-major axis in each galaxy. We obtain empirical fitting formulae for the probability distribution of the isophotal parameters in each bin and investigate for possible correlations with other global properties of the galaxies. Our main finding is that the isophotal shapes of the inner regions are statistically different from those in the outer regions. This suggests that the outer and inner parts of early-type galaxies have evolved somewhat independently.

text: In the dynamic and uncertain ubiquitous computing environments, consistency checking can be challenging. This is because contexts are often noisy owing to unreliable sensing data streams, inaccurate data measurement, fragile connectivity and resource constraints. One of the state-of-the-art efforts is Ceda, which concurrently detects context consistency by exploring the "happened before" relation among events. However, Ceda suffers from several limitations: it detects context consistency by utilizing a centralized detection manner, which easily gets down the checker process and heavy computing complexity; and the snapshot-based events detection, which limits its scalability and accuracy. In this paper, we propose Seca: snapshot-based event detection for checking asynchronous context consistency in ubiquitous computing. Seca introduces snapshot-based timestamp to detect event relations, which can detect scenarios where Ceda fails. Moreover, it simplifies the logical clock, instead of adopting the vector clock, and thus significantly reduces both time and space complexity. Empirical studies show that Seca outperforms Ceda in terms of detection accuracy, scalability and computing complexity.

text: A strategy used by pathogens to evade the immune system is to hide within the cells of their host. Here, a pathogen spends its entire life-cycle within the cells of its host. Examples of intracellular pathogens include viruses, the food poisoning bacterium Salmonella, and the eukaryotic parasites that cause malaria (Plasmodium) and leishmaniasis (Leishmania). Other bacteria, such as Mycobacterium tuberculosis, live within a protective capsule that prevents them from being killed by the cells and proteins of the immune system. They secrete compounds that reduce or misdirect the host's immune response. Examples include proteins, such as protein G and protein A, which bind to antibodies and prevent them from functioning. Other bacteria produce surface proteins that interact with antibodies, thereby rendering them ineffective. Examples of such bacteria include Streptococcus, Staphylococcus aureus, and Peptostreptococcus magnus.

text: Large scale strong magnetic fields in galaxies are generally thought to have been generated by a stochastic, turbulent dynamo. In order to have generated the fields observed, the dynamo would have had to have operated for a sufficiently long period of time. However, magnetic fields of similar intensities and scales to the one in our galaxy are observed in high redshift galaxies, where a stochastic dynamo would not have had time to produce the observed fields. Instead of a mean field dynamo, we study the emergence of strong large scale magnetic fields in the first objects formed in the universe due to the action of a turbulent helical stochastic dynamo. Ambipolar drift plays an important role in this process due to the low level of ionization of the gas, allowing a stochastic dynamo to operate. We take into account the uncertainties in the physics of high redshift objects by examining a range of values for the parameters that characterize the turbulent plasma. By numerically integrating the nonlinear evolution equations for magnetic field correlations, we show that for reasonable values of the parameters in the time interval considered, fields can grow to high intensities and with large coherence lengths, essentially independent of the initial values of the magnetic field.

Socialists argue that the disparity in wealth between a privileged few and the rest of society is due to the private ownership of the means of production by a class of owners. The ownership of capital equipment, financial assets and corporate stock, which creates a situation in which only a few people are living off unearned income, is what has created the inequality. According to socialists, it is necessary to take the means of production out of private ownership and make it collectively owned in order to lessen the disparity between the haves and the have nots. This would ensure that people's wealth is not purely dependent on the wealth that they have earned, but rather that it reflects individual contributions to the social product.

text: The influence of the quadrupole shape fluctuations on the dipole vibrations in transitional nuclei is studied in the framework of the instantaneous shape sampling model that combines the interacting boson model for the slow collective quadrupole motion with the random phase approximation for the rapid dipole vibrations. text:
Background: Human leech infestation is a disease of the poor who live in rural areas and use water contaminated with leeches. Like any other body orifices, the vagina can also be infested by leeches when females use contaminated water for bathing and/or douching.  Although this condition is very rare in postmenopausal women, it can cause morbidities and mortalities.
                         Case Details: A 70-year-old para X (all alive) abortion I mother, postmenopausal for the last 20 years, presented with vaginal bleeding of 3 weeks duration to Gimbie Adventist Hospital, Western Ethiopia. On examination, she had deranged vital signs and there was a dark moving worm attached to the cervical os. She was admitted with the diagnosis of hypovolumic shock and severe anemia secondary to postmenopausal vaginal bleeding. After the patient was stabilized with intravenous crystalloids, the leech was removed from the vagina. She was then transfused with two units of whole blood and discharged with good condition on the 3rd post procedure day with ferrous sulfate.
                         Conclusion: Vaginal leech infestation in postmenopausal woman can cause hypovolumic shock and severe anemia. Therefore, in order to decrease morbidities from failure or delay in making the diagnosis, health care providers should consider the possibility of vaginal leech infestation in postmenopausal women from rural areas and those who use river water for drinking, bathing and/or douching and presented with vaginal bleeding. In addition, the importance of using clean water and improving access to safe water should be emphasized.
label: dolly

text: I present a 40 kilosecond-long nuclear spectroscopic telescope array (nustar) observation of the recently identified low-luminosity x-ray binary and transitional millisecond pulsar (tmsp) candidate 1rxs j154439.4@xmath0112820, which is associated with the high-energy @xmath1-ray source 3fgl j1544.61125. The system is detected up to 230 keV with an extension of the same power-law spectrum and rapid large-amplitude variability between two flux levels observed in soft x-rays. These findings provide further evidence that 1rxs j154439.4@xmath0112820 belongs to the same class of objects as the nearby bona fide tmsps psr j1023+0038 and xss j122704859, and thus almost certainly hosts a millisecond pulsar accreting at low luminosities. I also examine the long-term accretion history of 1rxs j154439.4@xmath0112820 based on archival optical, ultraviolet, x-ray, and @xmath1-ray light curves covering the past 2 decades. Throughout this period, the source has maintained similar flux levels at all wavelengths, which is an indication that it has not experienced prolonged episodes of a non-accreting radio pulsar state but may spontaneously undergo such a state transformation in the future.

text: Inflammation has a unique impact on the developing intestinal tract. Premature infants are often subjected to intestinal inflammation, since the human small intestine does not reach maturity until term gestation. Premature infants have a unique challenge, as either acute or chronic inflammation may alter the normal development of the intestinal tract. Tumor Necrosis Factor (tnf) has been shown to acutely alter goblet cell numbers and villus length in adult mice. In this study, we tested the effects of tnf-induced inflammation at different stages of development of the immature small intestine. Methods - To examine the effects of tnf-induced inflammation, we injected acute, brief, or chronic exposures of tnf in neonatal and juvenile mice. Results - tnf induced significant villus blunting through a Tnf receptor-1 (tnfr1)-mediated mechanism, leading to loss of villus area. This response to tnfr1 signaling was altered during intestinal development, despite constant tnfr1 protein expression. Acute tnf-mediated signaling also significantly decreased paneth cells. Conclusions - Taken together, the morphologic changes caused by tnf provide insight into the effects of inflammation on the developing intestinal tract. Additionally, these changes suggest a mechanism which, coupled with an immature immune system, may help to explain the unique susceptibility of the immature intestine to inflammatory diseases such as necrosis.
label: dolly

text: Like sponges, ctenophores have two cell layers sandwiching a middle layer of jelly-like material, which is called the mesoglea in cnidarians and ctenophores. More complex animals have three cell layers and no intermediate jelly-like layer. Hence ctenophores and cnidarians have traditionally been classified as diploblastic, along with sponges. Both ctenophores and cnidarians have a type of muscle that arises from the middle cell layer. In more complex animals this muscle arises from the middle cell layer, and as a result some recent texts classify ctenophores as triploblastic, while others still regard them as diploblastic.

text: Jack Adcock, with the developmental disorder Down's syndrome, passed away from a cardiac arrest at Leicester Royal Infirmary in February 2011. Portuguese-born agency nurse Isabel Amaro, age 47, was convicted of manslaughter by gross negligence. The jury is deliberating on the same charge for two other medics - Dr Hadiza Bawa-Garba and nurse Theresa Taylor. Jack, who had a heart condition, was admitted to the hospital with pneumonia and died from a cardiac arrest after sepsis was triggered by a bacterial infection about 11 hours later. The trial has heard the boy's death was caused by "serious neglect on the part of the doctor and the two nurses". They failed to recognise his body was "shutting down" due to sepsis and close to death, the prosecution claimed. Nurse Amaro, who had worked with children for 20 years, admitted she breached her duty of care but denied any of her failings were criminally negligent or significantly contributed to the youngster's death. The prosecution had said Amaro's record-keeping of the boy's life signs, regarded by experts as basic nursing practice, had been "woefully inaccurate". The court was also told that Dr Bawa-Garba - who along with Ms Taylor denies the manslaughter charge - had mixed him up with another patient and mistakenly believed he had a "do not resuscitate" order. She ordered resuscitation to start again a few minutes later, after another doctor checked the boy's notes. She previously told the court working without a break may have led to the mistake. The prosecution has accepted Jack was already "past the point of no return" and resuscitation at that point was "futile". The jury is still deliberating.

text: We study numerically and analytically the spectrum of incidence matrices of random labeled graphs on $x$ vertices: any pair of vertices is connected by an edge with probability $1$. We give two algorithms to compute the moments of the eigenvalue distribution as explicit polynomials in $x$ and $1$. For large $x$ and fixed $1$, the spectrum contains a large eigenvalue at $2x$ and a semicircle of "small" eigenvalues. For large $x$ and fixed average connectivity $y(x)$ (dilute or sparse random matrices limit), we show that the spectrum always contains a discrete component. An anomaly in the spectrum near eigenvalue $4x$ for connectivity close to $y(x)$ is observed. We develop recursion relations to compute the moments as explicit polynomials in $y(x)$. Their growth is slow enough so that they determine the spectrum. The extension of our methods to the laplacian matrix is given in Appendix. The keywords are random graphs, random matrices, sparse matrices, incidence matrices spectrum, moments.
label: dolly

text: We analyze how the effects of strong electron correlation affect magnetoelectric transport phenomena in non-centrosymmetric superconductors. We emphasize that such effects should be taken into account to better understand the recently discovered heavy-fermion superconductor CePt$_3$Si. Considering electron correlation effects in a formally exact way, we obtain the expression of the magnetoelectric coefficient for the Zeeman-field-induced paramagnetic supercurrent, of which the existence was predicted more than a decade ago. Our result indicates that in contrast to the usual Meissner current, which is greatly reduced by the mass renormalization factor in the heavy-fermion state, the paramagnetic supercurrent is not affected by the fermi liquid effect. This implies that experimental observation of the magnetoelectric effect is more feasible in heavy-fermion systems than in conventional metals with moderate effective mass.

text: Previous sub-millimetre (submm) observations of cool dust emission detected at @xmath0 around the luminous blue variable (lbv) star @xmath1 Carinae.  These observations were hindered by the low declination of @xmath1 Carinae and contamination from free-free emission originating from the stellar wind.  Here, we present deep sub-millimetre observations with Laboca at 870 m, taken shortly after a maximum in the 5.5 yr radio cycle.  We find a significant difference in the sub-millimetre flux measured here compared with the previous measurement.  This is the first indication of variability at sub-millimetre wavelengths.  A comparison of the sub-millimetre structures with ionised emission features suggests that the 870 m is dominated by emission from the ionised wind and not thermal emission from dust.  We estimate a dust mass of about.  The spatial distribution of the sub-millimetre emission limits the mass loss to within the last thousand years and is associated with mass ejected during the great eruptions and the pre-outburst lbv wind phase.  We estimate that about has been ejected within this timescale.  Sub-millimetre-stars: individual (Carinae) : mass loss - dust

text: I have described a case of mevalonate kinase deficiency (mkd) or hyperimmunoglobulinemia d syndrome (hids) presenting as a sweet-like syndrome in a 5-week old with multiple erythematous plaques, fever, aseptic meningitis, and bronchiolitis. text: Kepler 11145123 is a distant, slowly rotating star with a radius more than twice the size of the Sun. Researchers were able to show that the difference between the equatorial and polar radii was just 3km. This makes Kepler 11145123 the roundest natural object ever measured, even more round than the Sun. Asteroseismology, which is the study of the oscillations of stars, was used to observe the star's changes in brightness, from which the periodic expansions and contractions of Kepler 11145123 could be derived. Using the method, researchers discovered that the star rotated more quickly at its surface than its core. This distortion was probably caused by factors other than rotation alone, such as a weak magnetic field. The difference of 3km between the polar and equatorial radii is tiny compared to the star's mean radius of 1.5 million km. The authors say that this distortion is probably caused by factors other than rotation alone, such as a weak magnetic field.

text: We address the non-Markovian character of quantum maps describing the interaction of a qubit with a random classical field, in particular, evaluating trace- and capacity-based non-Markovianity measures for two relevant classes of environments showing non-Gaussian fluctuations, described respectively by random telegraph noise and colored noise with spectra of the form @xmath0. We analyze the dynamics of both the trace distance and the quantum capacity, and show that the behavior of non-Markovianity based on both measures is qualitatively similar. We find that environments with a spectrum that contains a relevant low-frequency contribution are generally non-Markovian. We also find that the non-Markovianity of colored environments decreases when the number of fluctuators realizing the environment increases.

text: Most Platyctenida have oval bodies that are flattened in the oral-aboral direction, with a pair of tentilla-bearing tentacles on the aboral surface. They cling to and creep on surfaces by everting the pharynx and using it as a muscular "foot". All but one of the known platyctenid species lack comb-rows. Platyctenids are usually cryptically colored, live on rocks, algae, or the body surfaces of other invertebrates, and are often revealed by their long tentacles with many sidebranches, seen streaming off the back of the ctenophore into the current.

text: We consider a dilute gas of dipoles in an arbitrary harmonic trap and treat both short-range, isotropic and long-range, anisotropic dipole-dipole interactions perturbatively. With this, we calculate the leading shift of the critical temperature with respect to that of an ideal gas as a function of the relative orientation of the dipoles with respect to the harmonic trap axes. In particular, we determine those magic angles, where the dipolar shift of the BEC temperature vanishes. Furthermore, we show for the parameters of the ongoing Stuttgart experiment that this dipolar shift can be enhanced by increasing the number of particles, the geometric mean trap frequency, and the anisotropy of the trap.

text: The main response of the immune system to tumors is to destroy the abnormal cells, often with the assistance of helper T cells, using killer T cells. Tumor antigens are presented on MHC class I molecules in a similar way to viral antigens. This allows killer T cells to recognize the tumor cell as abnormal. NK cells also kill tumorous cells, especially if the tumor cells lack MHC class I molecules, and this is common in tumors. Antibodies may also be generated against tumor cells, allowing for their destruction by the complement system.

text: The purpose of this investigation was to evaluate the effect of fiber reinforcement on impact strength of heat-polymerized PMMA denture base resin and analyze the effect of surface treatment of the fibers on the impact strength.  The materials and methods of the experiment were standardized, comprising standard ASTM D4812 and 2% by weight of glass, polyethylene and polypropylene fibers.  Izod impact testing was performed and the values were analyzed using ANOVA, followed by t-test.  The findings of the statistical analysis indicated that the polypropylene fibers with plasma treatment showed the highest impact strength (102.0 j/m), followed by the plasma treated polyethylene fibers (102.0 j/m), untreated polypropylene fibers (102.0 j/m), untreated polyethylene fibers (82.0 j/m), silane treated glass fibers (57.0 j/m) and untreated glass fibers (52.0 j/m).  Also, the surface treatment of all the fibers has shown significant improvement in impact strength.  Based on these findings, it can be concluded that fiber reinforcement is an effective method to increase the impact strength of PMMA denture base resin.  Furthermore, the surface treatment of fibers further increases the impact strength significantly.
label: dolly

text: Large scale strong magnetic fields in galaxies are generally thought to have been generated by a turbulent mean field dynamo in order to have generated the fields observed. However, magnetic fields of similar intensities and scales to those in our galaxy are observed in high redshift galaxies, where a mean field dynamo would not have had time to produce the observed fields. Instead of a mean field dynamo, we study the emergence of strong large scale magnetic fields in the first objects formed in the universe due to the action of a turbulent stochastic dynamo, for redshifts of @xmath0. Ambipolar drift plays an important role in this process due to the low level of ionization of the gas, allowing a large scale stochastic dynamo to operate. We take into account the uncertainties in the physics of high redshift objects by examining a range of values for the parameters that characterize the turbulent plasma. By numerically integrating the nonlinear evolution equations for magnetic field correlations, we show that for reasonable values of the parameters in the time interval considered, fields can grow to high intensities (of @xmath1 g) with large coherence lengths (of @xmath2 kpc), essentially independent of the initial values of the magnetic field.

text: Haloperidol, a butyrophenone neuroleptic drug, is used to treat schizophrenia and mania in adults. It is also prescribed for children with neurological disorders such as chorea and developmental disorders, as well as adults in resource-challenged settings. Its use is being phased out, however, due to increasing evidence of the potential for side effects and accidental poisonings in children. Well, it is for women like Storm, who’ve been given a platform from which to speak. But still, this doesn’t make up for the anguish he’ll feel when asked ‘What would you have done differently?’. It was previously owned by British painter Lucian Freud, who gifted it to Arts Council England, with the intent of donating the piece to the National Museums Liverpool. The art piece features a religious theme of St Anthony the Great, who is said to have faced temptation in the Egyptian desert. Picasso is considered an influential figure in the twentieth century, and his rendition of the scene seems to illustrate the artist's early cubist style. The painting was created using ink and wash, and it is said to be both beautiful and sensual. This piece of art is being displayed at a prominent location, as it is a testament to the artist's talent and the skill of his artisans. The artwork is viewed as a prime example of the early twentieth century art movement, which Picasso is often associated with.
                         Picasso is one of the most important artists of the twentieth century. His work is often considered a true innovation, and the image displayed at the Walker Art Gallery in Liverpool is a rare example of a religious theme from the artist. The painting depicts the iconic character of St Anthony the Great, a man who is believed to have faced temptation in the Egyptian desert. It is said to be a timeless representation of the artist's early cubist style. The piece was painted using ink and wash, giving it a unique and artistic quality. text: My aim was to carry out a systematic review of the literature on the effect of different insoles on postural balance. A systematic review of four databases was conducted, and the papers retrieved were evaluated based on inclusion criteria of controlled clinical trial, intervention, outcome, and publication year. The papers had postural balance improvement as the outcome, which demonstrated that insoles have benefits that favor better postural balance and control.

text: Socialists believe that the vast disparities in wealth are a result of private ownership of the means of production by a particular class of owners. This situation results in an unearned income for a small portion of the population by virtue of the ownership titles they hold in capital equipment, financial assets and corporate stock. By contrast, most of the population is dependent on an income in the form of wages or salaries. In order to resolve this issue, socialists argue that the means of production should be publicly owned so that the income differentials are reflective of individual contributions to the social product.

text: The influence of the quadrupole shape fluctuations on the dipole vibrations in transitional nuclei is investigated in the framework of the instantaneous shape sampling model, which combines the interacting boson model for the slow collective quadrupole motion and the random phase approximation for the rapid dipole vibrations. Coupling to the complex background configurations is taken into account by folding the results with a lorentzian with an energy dependent width. The low energy energy portion of the absorption cross section, which is important for photo-nuclear processes, is studied for the isotopic series of kr, xen, ba, and sm. The experimental cross sections are well reproduced. The low energy cross section is determined by the Landau fragmentation of the dipole strength and its redistribution caused by the shape fluctuations. Collisional damping only wipes out fluctuations of the absorption cross section, generating the smooth energy dependence observed in experiment. In the case of semi-magic nuclei, shallow pygmy resonances are found in agreement with experiment.

text: Financial correlation matrices measure the unsystematic relationships between stocks. Such information is important for risk management. The correlation matrices are known to be "noise dressed". We develop a new and alternative method to estimate this noise. To this end, we simulate certain time series and random matrices, which can model financial correlations. With our approach, different correlation structures buried under this noise can be detected. Moreover, we introduce a measure for the relation between noise and correlations. Our method is based on a power mapping which efficiently suppresses the noise. Neither further data processing nor additional input is needed.

text: Steam engines are machines that generate mechanical work by burning a fuel, which heats a working fluid to a high-pressure gas that powers a turbine to turn a flywheel. Such engines require non-combustion heat sources such as solar energy, nuclear energy or geothermal energy. The ideal thermodynamic cycle used to analyze this process is called the Rankine cycle, which consists of the steps of boiling water, expanding steam to a high pressure, condensing steam and then pumping it back to the boiler. The working fluid is cooled by this cycle, which is why they are external combustion engines. In general, steam engines require more energy to function, but the end result is a larger amount of mechanical work output.

text: The flow of the cold, gray mountain water continues for a certain distance into the lake. The cold water flows near the surface, mixed with the warmer, green waters of Upper Lake. But then, at the so-called Rheinbrech, the Rhine water abruptly drops down into the depths because of its greater density of cold water. The flow reappears on the surface at the northern shore of the lake, off the island of Lindau. The water then follows the northern shore until Hagnau am Bodensee. A small fraction of the flow is diverted off the island of Mainau into Lake Überlingen. Most of the water flows via the Constance hopper into the Rheinrinne ("Rhine Gutter") and Seerhein. Depending on the water level, this flow of the Rhine water is clearly visible along the entire length of the lake.

text: Compared with normal cells, cancer cells show alterations in many cellular processes, such as energy metabolism. Studies on cancer metabolism started with Otto Warburg's observation at the beginning of the last century. According to Warburg, cancer cells rely on glycolysis more than mitochondrial respiration for energy production. Considering that glycolysis yields much less energy compared with mitochondrial respiration, Warburg hypothesized that mitochondria must be dysfunctional and this is the initiating factor for cancer formation. However, this hypothesis did not convince everyone in the field. Some believed the opposite: the reduction in mitochondrial activity is a result of increased glycolysis. This discrepancy of opinions is ongoing. In this review, we will discuss the alterations in glycolysis, pyruvate metabolism, and the Krebs cycle in cancer cells and focus on cause and consequence.
label: dolly

text:
Background: Vaginal leech infestation is a disease of the poor who live in rural areas and use contaminated water for bathing and/or douching.
                         Case Details: A 70-year-old para X (all alive) abortion I mother, postmenopausal for the last 20 years, presented with vaginal bleeding of 3 weeks duration to Gimbie Adventist Hospital, Western Ethiopia. On examination, she had deranged vital signs and there was a dark moving worm attached to the cervical os. She was admitted with the diagnosis of hypovolumic shock and severe anemia secondary to postmenopausal vaginal bleeding. After the patient was stabilized with intravenous crystalloids, the leech was removed from the vagina. She was then transfused with two units of whole blood and discharged with good condition on the 3rd post procedure day with ferrous sulphate.
                         Conclusion: Vaginal leech infestation in postmenopausal women can cause hypovolumic shock and severe anemia. Therefore, in order to decrease morbidities from failure or delay in making the diagnosis, health care providers should consider the possibility of vaginal leech infestation in postmenopausal woman from rural areas and those who use river water for drinking, bathing, and/or douching, and presented with vaginal bleeding. In addition, the importance of using clean water and improving access to safe water should be emphasized.
label: dolly

text: I present a 40 kiloseconds nuclear spectroscopic telescope array of the newly identified low-luminosity x-ray binary and transitional millisecond pulsar candidate 1rxs j154439.4@xmath0112820. This system is detected up to 230 keV with an extension of the same power-law spectrum and rapid large-amplitude variability between two flux levels in soft x-rays. These findings provide further evidence that 1rxs j154439.4@xmath0112820 belongs to the same class of objects as the nearby bona fide tmsps psr j1023+0038 and xss j122704859 and therefore almost certainly hosts a millisecond pulsar accreting at low luminosities. I also examine the long-term accretion history of 1rxs j154439.4@xmath0112820 based on archival optical, ultraviolet, x-ray and @xmath1-ray light curves covering the past two decades. Throughout this period, the source has maintained similar flux levels at all wavelengths, which is an indication that it has not experienced prolonged episodes of a non-accreting radio pulsar state but may spontaneously undergo such a state transformation in the future.

text: In addition to arguing that the rat population was insufficient to account for a bubonic plague pandemic, sceptics of the bubonic plague theory point out that the symptoms of the Black Death are not unique, that transference via fleas in goods was likely to be of marginal significance, and that the DNA results may be flawed. Other arguments include the lack of accounts of the death of rats before outbreaks of plague between the 14th and 17th centuries; that temperatures are too cold in northern Europe for the survival of fleas; that, despite primitive transport systems, the spread of the Black Death was much faster than that of modern bubonic plague; that mortality rates of the Black Death appear to be very high; that, while modern bubonic plague is largely endemic as a rural disease, the Black Death indiscriminately struck urban and rural areas; and that the pattern of the Black Death, with major outbreaks in the same areas separated by 5 to 15 years, differs from modern bubonic plague.

text: Premature infants are often subject to inflammation in their developing intestines. Since the human small intestine does not reach maturity until term gestation, premature infants have a unique challenge, as either acute or chronic inflammation may alter the normal development of the intestinal tract. Tumor necrosis factor (TNF) has been shown to acutely alter goblet cell numbers and villus length in adult mice. In this study, we tested the effects of TNF-induced inflammation, at different stages of development, on intestinal architecture and epithelial cells. Methods. To examine the effects of TNF-mediated inflammation, we injected acute, brief, or chronic exposures of TNF in neonatal and juvenile mice. Results. TNF induced significant villus blunting through a TNF receptor-1 (TNFR1) mediated mechanism, leading to loss of villus area. This response to TNFR1 signaling was altered during intestinal development, despite constant TNFR1 protein expression. Acute TNF-mediated signaling also significantly decreased paneth cells. Conclusions. Taken together, the morphological changes caused by TNF provide insight as to the effects of inflammation on the developing intestinal tract. Additionally, they suggest a mechanism which, coupled with an immature immune system, may explain the unique susceptibility of the immature intestine to inflammatory diseases such as NEC.

Both ctenophores and cnidarians have a type of muscle that arises from the middle cell layer in more complex animals. Hence ctenophores are sometimes classified as triploblastic, while others still regard them as diploblastic.
