text: In this in vitro study, the presence of voids in powder-liquid and capsulated glass ionomer cement was evaluated. 40 cavities were prepared on root surfaces of maxillary incisors and divided into four groups. Conventional powder-liquid glass ionomer cement (GC Fuji II, GC Corp., Tokyo, Japan) was used as a restorative material in groups 1 and 2. Capsulated glass ionomer cement (GC Fuji II, GC Corp., Tokyo, Japan) was used in groups 3 and 4. Samples were sectioned and viewed under stereomicroscope to check for the presence of voids within the cement and at the cement-tooth junction. Data was analyzed using one-way ANOVA and Tukey's post hoc tests. Results showed that group 4 had statistically significant results (p < 0.05) when compared to groups 1 and 2 for voids within the cement. However, for voids at the margins, the results were statistically insignificant. These findings suggest that capsulated glass ionomer cement may be a suitable alternative to conventional powder-liquid glass ionomer cement.

text: Alport syndrome is a hereditary disorder affecting the glomerular basement membrane. Its diagnosis is based on the presence of hematuric nephropathy, renal failure, hearing loss, ocular abnormalities and changes in the lamina densa. The aims of this case report were to show the changes in the gingival tissues of a patient with as, under cyclosporine-based immunosuppressant therapy after renal transplantation and to discuss the possible role of type IV collagen in the gingival basal lamina as an alternative approach for the diagnosis of as. A 20-year-old male patient with as underwent periodontal therapy including a series of gingivectomy surgeries. Gingival samples obtained during the second surgery were examined histopathologically and by transmission electron microscopy for further pathological examination. Gingivectomy procedures have been performed every 6 months over the last 4 years. The excessive and fibrous gingival enlargements resulted in migration of the anterior teeth but no alveolar bone loss occurred. This is the first report to demonstrate the possible changes in the gingival tissues caused by as. It is suggested that gingival biopsy can be an initial diagnostic tool instead of renal or skin biopsies. text: We have performed magnetic susceptibility measurements in amorphous thin films biased with an electrical current using anisotropic coils. In this region the shielding capability of the superconducting currents measured by the susceptibility coils is less effective along the direction of vortex motion compared to the transverse direction. This anisotropic response is found in the same region where the peak effect in the critical current is developed. On rising temperature the isotropic behavior is recovered. text: Eosinophilic gastroenteritis ( ege ) is an uncommon disease characterized by eosinophilic infiltration of the gastrointestinal tract that usually results in abdominal pain, diarrhea, ascites, and peripheral eosinophilia. Macrolides have both anti-inflammatory and antibacterial effects, and can have immunomodulatory effects by inhibiting t-lymphocyte proliferation and triggering t-lymphocyte and eosinophil apoptosis. text: Advanced type 2 diabetes mellitus is associated with significant morbidity and mortality due to cardiovascular, nervous, and renal complications. Attempts to cure diabetes mellitus using islet transplantation have been successful in providing a source for insulin secreting cells. However, limited donors, graft rejection, the need for continued immune suppression, and exhaustion of the donor cell pool have prompted the search for a more sustained source of insulin secreting cells. Stem cell therapy is a promising alternative for islet transplantation in type 2 diabetic patients who fail to control hyperglycemia even with insulin injection. Autologous stem cell transplantation may provide the best outcome for those patients, since autologous cells are readily available and do not entail prolonged hospital stays or sustained immunotoxic therapy. Among autologous adult stem cells, mesenchymal stem cells ( mscs ) therapy has been applied with varying degrees of success in both animal models and in clinical trials. This review will focus on the advantages of mscs over other types of stem cells and the possible mechanisms by which mscs transplant restores normoglycemia in type 2 diabetic patients. Sources of mscs including autologous cells from diabetic patients and the use of various differentiation protocols in relation to best transplant outcome will be discussed.

text: I study the Bethe lattice self-avoiding trails ( isat ) model on a general coordination Husimi lattice, as well as on a square and coordination Husimi lattices. The exact grand-canonical solutions of the model are obtained considering that up to monomers can be placed on a site and associating a weight for a four-fold visited site. Rich phase diagrams are found, with non-polymerized ( np ), regular polymerized ( p ) and dense polymerized ( dp ) phases, separated by lines or surfaces of continuous and discontinuous transitions. For Bethe lattice with square and coordination Husimi lattices, the collapse transition is identified with a bicritical point and the collapsed phase is associated with the dense polymerized phase (solid-like) instead of the regular polymerized phase (liquid-like). A similar result is found for Husimi lattice with Bethe lattice, which may explain the difference between the collapse transition for isat and for interacting self-avoiding walks on the square lattice. For Bethe lattice with coordination 7 and coordination 8, a more complex phase diagram is found, with two critical planes and two coexistence surfaces, separated by two tricritical and two critical end-point lines meeting at a multicritical point. The mapping of the phase diagrams in the canonical ensemble is discussed and compared with simulational results for regular lattices.

text: This movie took me by surprise. The opening credit sequence features beautifully animated scenes, which effectively introduces the characters and sets the tone for the movie. By the time the shlitz hits the fan, we know each of the characters, and either like or hate them according to their distinct personalities. The set-up is gradual, kind of like the ride up a really tall roller coaster. Luckily, once the action kicks in, it's full-blown horror, as opposed to the sullen tone of earlier genre fare like Night of the Living Dead or Hills Have Eyes. But for true horror fans, this one is worth checking out. Play it as the first entry on a double bill with the 1999 remake of House on the Haunted Hill. text: We study the role of dissipation and structural defects on the time evolution of quantum dot arrays with mobile charges under external driving fields. These structures, proposed as quantum dot cellular automata, exhibit interesting quantum dynamics that can be described using equations of motion for the density matrix. Using an open system approach, we study the role of asymmetries and the microscopic electron-phonon interaction on the general dynamical behavior of the charge distribution (polarization). We find that the system response to the driving field is improved at low temperatures (and/or weak phonon coupling) before deteriorating as temperature and asymmetry increase. In addition to the study of the time evolution of polarization, we explore the linear entropy of the system to gain further insights into the competition between coherent evolution and dissipative processes.

text: To understand the role of local sublattice imbalance in low energy spectra of quantum antiferromagnets, we study the quantum nearest neighbor heisenberg antiferromagnet on the coordination 3 Cayley tree. We perform many-body calculations using an implementation of the density matrix renormalization group (dmrg) technique for generic tree graphs. We discover that the bond-centered Cayley tree has a quasi-degenerate set of low-lying tower of states and an anomalous singlet-triplet finite size gap scaling. For understanding the construction of the first excited state from the many-body ground state, we consider a wavefunction ansatz given by the single-mode approximation (sma), which yields a high overlap with the dmrg wavefunction. Observing the ground state entanglement spectrum leads us to a picture of the low energy degrees of freedom being giant spins arising out of sublattice imbalance, which helps us analytically understand the scaling of the finite size spin gap. The schwinger boson mean field theory has been generalized to non-uniform lattices and ground states have been found which are spatially inhomogeneous in the mean field parameters.

text: We calculate Curie temperatures and study the stability of ferromagnetism in diluted magnetic materials, taking as a model for the exchange between magnetic impurities a damped Ruderman-Kittel-Kasuya-Yosida (RKKY) interaction and a short range term representing the effects of superexchange. To properly include effects of spin and thermal fluctuations as well as geometric disorder, we solve the effective Heisenberg Hamiltonian by means of a recently developed semi-analytical approach. This approach, “self-consistent local random phase approximation” (SC-LRPA), is explained. We show that previous mean-field treatments, which have been widely used in the literature, largely overestimate both Curie temperatures and the stability of ferromagnetism as a function of carrier density. The discrepancy when compared to the current approach was that effects of frustration in RKKY oscillations had been underestimated by such simple mean-field theories. We argue that the use, as is frequent, of a weakly disordered RKKY interaction to model ferromagnetism in diluted III–V systems is inconsistent with the observation of ferromagnetism over a wide region of itinerant carrier densities. This may be puzzling when compared to the apparent success of calculations based on ab-initio estimates of the coupling; we propose a resolution to this issue by taking RKKY-like interactions between resonant states close to the Fermi level.

text: The Yuan Dynasty, the era of the Mongol World Empire, saw an increase in the arts, including theater and novels, which encouraged communication between East and West, and the spread of new technologies such as cartography, astronomy, and medicine.  Additionally, Buddhism became a prominent and influential force within the Yuan government, as well as a conduit for Mongol and Central Asian influences into China. Buddhist physicians introduced new techniques for treating disease, and Middle Eastern crops, especially carrots and turnips, brought new tastes to Chinese cuisine. The Muslims of the Yuan dynasty also introduced new Islamic customs and fabrics, and new diets and practices such as drinking yoghurt. China was finally opened up to international trade, and the technology and culture that the Yuan Empire had brought from its massive expansion into West Asia and Europe became the mainstay of East Asian civilizations.

text: It's hard to find Judas Kiss on VHS (it isn't available on DVD), but I wanted to add this rather obscure movie to my Alan Rickman movie collection. I can't understand how the talented Mr. Rickman gets into these mediocre films? Judas Kiss boasts several wonderful actors, an interesting plot and intriguing twists, but its strange visual wanderings and chopping editing ruined what might have been a great crime drama. Many scenes seem to be missing vital information to explain the character's actions: Why was our hero immediately suspicious of his bosses? Why did he mistrust the detective he replaced? There were times when I honestly couldn't tell if the director meant Judas Kiss to be a legitimate crime drama or a campy spoof. Why else would he toss in a topless/alien/lesbian porno scene in the first two minutes (that little surprise certainly made me scramble for the remote since my kids were playing nearby!)? Did he purposely instruct his two distinguished English actors (Alan Rickman and Emma Thompson) to use such awful New Orleans accents? As an Alan Rickman fan, I confess that I still thought Mr. Rickman was sexy: in a rumpled, weary, "take him home and tuck him in" sort of way. Judas Kiss isn't a great movie, but it does have some intriguing moments, but I don't recommend it unless you're trying to immerse yourself in Alan Rickman.

text: In this diatomic oxygen, the two oxygen atoms are bonded covalently with each other. The bond can be described based on various levels of theory, but can be simply explained as the result of filling molecular orbitals that are formed from the atomic orbitals of the individual oxygen atoms. The bond order is two as a result of sequential filling of low σ and σ* orbitals, with σ overlap of the two atomic 2p orbitals that lie along the O-O molecular axis and π overlap of two pairs of atomic 2p orbitals perpendicular to the O-O molecular axis. The resulting cancellation of contributions from the remaining two of the six 2p electrons is due to their filling of the lowest π and π* orbitals.

text: Normans came to Scotland, building castles and establishing noble families who would later become the main royal line, such as Robert the Bruce and the later line of kings, as well as establishing a considerable number of the Scottish clans. Having spent time in England at the court of Henry I (married to David's sister Maud of Scotland), and needing to wrest the kingdom from his half-brother Máel Coluim mac Alaxandair, David had to reward many. The process was continued under David's successors, most intensely of all under William the Lion. text: Insulin degludec ( ideg ) is a new basal insulin with an ultra - long and stable glucose - lowering effect. Health status was assessed at baseline and 105 weeks using the Short-Form-36 questionnaire. sf-36 scores were analyzed (ITT population) using anova, with adjustments for covariates. At 105 weeks, the overall physical component score was significantly better with ideg compared to iglar (treatment contrast, 1.1 (0.1;2.1)95%CI, p<0.05). text:
The Yuan dynasty was a compromise between feudalism and autocracy, the traditional Chinese system of government. Nevertheless, this duality between autocracy and feudalism gave the Yuan regime a colonial coloration. This resulted in the Chinese elite being deprived of certain privileges which had been accorded them before. It is possible that this was done to fear the transfer of power to the ethnic Chinese. The Mongol and Central Asian aristocracy and their elites were given more rights and responsibilities than the main Chinese. This resulted in a disparity between them and the ethnic Chinese. 
                         In the early 14th century, the imperial examination was reinstated in the Yuan dynasty. This reinforced the previous discrimination against the ethnic Chinese. Mongol nobles were also given certain advantages which were not given to the ethnic Chinese. This is possibly due to the fear of losing power to the ethnic Chinese. Eventually, the Ming dynasty restored the imperial examination and admitted the North Chinese and Southerners into higher positions.

text: We model the underdoped cuprates using fermions moving in a background with local antiferromagnetic order. The antiferromagnetic order fluctuates in orientation but not in magnitude, so that there is no long-range antiferromagnetism. The normal state is described as a fractionalized Fermi liquid (fl*), with electron-like quasiparticles coupled to the fractionalized excitations of the fluctuating antiferromagnet. The electronic quasiparticles reside near pockets of finite area centered away from the magnetic Brillouin zone boundary. The violation of the conventional Luttinger theorem is linked to a species doubling of these quasiparticles. We describe phenomenological theories of the pairing of these quasiparticles, and show that a large class of mean-field theories generically displays a nodal-anti-nodal dichotomy: the interplay of local antiferromagnetism and pairing leads to a small gap near the nodes of the pairing along the Brillouin zone diagonals, and a large gap in the anti-nodal region.

text: Neuropathic pain is difficult to treat and can have a severe effect on quality of life. The capsaicin 8% patch is a novel treatment option that directly targets the source of peripheral neuropathic pain. It can provide pain relief for up to 12 weeks in patients with peripheral neuropathic pain. The procedure for applying the capsaicin 8% patch follows a clearly defined procedure and can be carried out by a nurse without physician supervision. Nonetheless, in our experience, nurses often take the lead role in capsaicin 8% patch application without the involvement of a physician. We believe that the nurse's key role is beneficial to the patients, as they may be better placed, due to time constraints and relationships with their patients, to support them through the application procedure than a physician. Furthermore, a number of frequently prescribed drugs, including botulinum toxin and infliximab, can be administered by healthcare professionals without physician supervision. We argue that current guidance should be amended to remove the requirement for physician supervision during application of the capsaicin 8% patch.

text: The South Australian State Emergency Service (SES) exists to minimise the loss of life, injuries and property damage from emergencies and natural disasters. It is a volunteer-based organisation that provides an emergency response service across the state. SES units are particularly active in providing response services for floods, storms, rescues, road accidents, and providing significant operational support to the SA Police, the SA Country Fire Service, and the SA Metropolitan Fire Service. It consists of 66 units and approximately 1650 volunteers, and is supported by a small cadre of around 50 paid staff members. The service also supports South Australia's volunteer marine rescue (VMR) organisations, their 14 flotillas, and approximately 600 operational volunteers strategically located along South Australia's coastline. The SES is blessed with first class staff and volunteers who work together to build safe and resilient communities. We are always looking to increase our capacity to respond and are continually on the lookout for new members. Click here if you would like further information.

text: The aim of this paper is to illuminate the topology and properties of the nodes of electronic systems using the "electrons on a sphere" model. We study the nodes of two-, three- and four-electron systems in various ferromagnetic configurations (e.g. XZ0, XZ1, XZ2, XY0, XY1, XY2, XZ3, XY3, XY4 and XZ4), and in some cases (e.g. XY0, XY1, XY2 and XY3), we can rigorously prove that the non-interacting wave function has the same nodes as the exact wave function. In some particular configurations (e.g. XY0, XY1, XY2 and XY3), the nodes of the non-interacting wave function are exact. Although we have not been able to prove it rigorously, we conjecture that the nodes of the non-interacting wave function for the XY4 configuration are exact.

text: The fourth Yuan emperor, Ayurbarwada Khan, was a competent emperor. He was the first Yuan emperor to actively support and adopt Chinese culture after the reign of Kublai, to the discontent of some Mongol elite. He was mentored by Li Meng, a Confucian scholar. He made many reforms, including the liquidation of the Department of State Affairs (Chinese: 尚書省), which resulted in the execution of five of the highest-ranking officials. Starting in 1313 the traditional imperial examinations were reintroduced for prospective officials, testing their knowledge on significant historical works. He also codified much of the law, as well as publishing or translating a number of Chinese books and works.
label: dolly

text: We respond to the paper written by de marchi, Paresce, Straniero and Moroni (2003) on the white dwarf cooling age of M4.  The authors question the data analysis and interpretation that led to the conclusions in Hansen et al. (2002).  In their paper, de marchi et al. are unable to obtain photometry as deep as ours from the same data set, therefore asserting that only a lower limit to the white dwarf cooling age for this cluster of @xmath0 Gyr can be obtained.  In this short contribution, we show that the shortcomings in the data analysis and reduction techniques of de marchi et al. are responsible for their inability to reach the photometry limits that our study reports.  In a forthcoming paper in which the complete techniques for age determination with white dwarfs are laid out, we demonstrate that their method of fitting the luminosity function gives a spuriously low white dwarf cooling age.  Richter/Brewer/Kalirai@astro.ubc.ca/ Gordan/Fahlman@nrc-cnrc.gc.ca/ Peston/Stetson@nrc-cnrc.gc.ca/ Hansen/rmr@astro.ucla.edu/ Ibata/Bgibson@astro.swin.edu.au/ Gibson/Shara@amnh.org

text: An xmm-Newton observation of the luminous Seyfert 1 galaxy 1H 0419 -577 has been presented. We find that the spectrum is well fitted by a power law of canonical slope and 3 blackbody components. The xmm-Newton data are compared and contrasted with observations by Rössl and Aschenbach in 1992 and ASCA and BeppoSAX in 1996. We find that the overall x-ray spectrum has changed significantly over the period, and suggest that the changes are driven by the soft x-ray component. When bright, as in our xmm-Newton observation, it appears that the enhanced soft flux cools the Comptonising corona, causing the 210 keV power law to assume a ‘typical’ slope in contrast to the unusually hard (‘photon-starved’) spectra observed by ASCA and BeppoSAX four years earlier.
label: dolly

text: Several families of Byzantine Greece were of Norman mercenary origin during the period of the Comnenian Restoration, when Byzantine emperors were seeking out western European warriors. The Raoulii were descended from a Norman named Raoul, the Petraliphae were descended from a Pierre d'Aulps, and the Maniakates were descended from an Italo-Norman named Maniaces who served under George Maniaces in the Sicilian expedition of 1038.

text: We discuss the use of Langevin molecular dynamics in the study of the non-equilibrium properties of disordered vortex matter. Our special focus is set on values of system parameters that are realistic for disordered high-$T_c$ superconductors such as YBaCo$_2$O$_6$. Using a discretized elastic line model, we investigate different aspects of vortex far from thermal equilibrium, such as current-voltage characteristics, gyration radius, and pinning time statistics. On the one hand, we study steady-state properties of driven magnetic flux lines in a disordered environment, namely current-voltage characteristics, gyration radius, and pinning time statistics. On the other hand, we study the complex relaxation processes and glassy-like dynamics that emerge in type-II superconductors due to the intricate competition between the long-range vortex-vortex repulsion and flux pinning due to randomly placed point defects. To this end, we consider different types of sudden perturbations: temperature, magnetic field and external current quenches. Langevin molecular dynamics; disordered vortex matter; type-II superconductors; pinning statistics; relaxation processes.
label: dolly

text: Rehabilitation may be helpful in the prevention of complications associated with the treatment of patients with pectus excavatum who are subjected to surgery using the Ravitch and Nuss methods. This paper presents the case of a patient who underwent successful physical rehabilitation after 8 weeks from the surgery using the combined method. As part of the Nuss procedure, two plates were implanted to form a scaffolding for the patient’s chest, which had previously been corrected with the Ravitch method. The plates were to be removed after 24 months of treatment. After the procedure, despite the favorable cosmetic effect of the repair, there was a significant decrease in the spirometric values and physical fitness of the patient. He underwent an individual physiotherapy program which lasted four weeks. The streamlining of the respiratory system has significantly improved the spirometric values and raised the overall performance of the patient's organism.

text:
Lack of research has been noted on the everyday lives of older people in developing countries. This exploratory study used structured observation and content analysis to examine the presence of older people in public fora and considered the methods’ potential for understanding older people’s social integration and inclusion.

Structured observation occurred of public social spaces in six cities each located in a different developing country and in one city in the united kingdom. Content analysis of the presence of people in newspaper pictures and on television in the selected countries was also conducted. Results indicated that across all fieldwork sites and data sources, there was a low presence of older people, with women considerably less present than men in developing countries. There was variation across fieldwork sites in older people’s presence by place and time of day and in their accompanied status. The presence of older people in images drawn from newspapers was associated with the news/non-news nature of the source. The utility of the study’s methodological approach is considered as is the degree to which the presence of older people in public fora might relate to social integration and inclusion in different cultural contexts.

text: In the modern industrialized world, construction usually involves the translation of designs into reality. A formal design team may be assembled to plan the physical proceedings, and to integrate those proceedings with the other parts. The design usually consists of drawings and specifications, usually prepared by a design team including Architect, civil engineers, mechanical engineers, electrical engineers, structural engineers, fire protection engineers, planning consultants, architectural consultants, archaeological consultants, and a quantity surveyor. The design team is most commonly employed by the property owner. Under this system, once the design is completed by the design team, various construction companies may then be asked to make a bid for the work, either based directly on the design, or on the basis of drawings and a bill of quantities provided by a quantity surveyor. Following evaluation of bids, the owner typically awards a contract to the most cost efficient bidder.
label: dolly

text: This paper looks into our growing understanding of the physics behind coronal heating (in open-field regions) and the acceleration of the solar wind. Many new insights have come from the last solar cycle's worth of observations and theoretical work. Measurements of the plasma properties in the extended corona, where the primary solar wind acceleration occurs, have been key to discriminating between competing theories. We describe how UVCs/SoHO observations of coronal holes and streamers over the last 14 years have provided clues about the detailed kinetic processes that energize both fast and slow wind regions. We also present a brief survey of current ideas involving the coronal sources of fast and slow wind streams and how these change over the solar cycle. These sources are discussed in the context of recent theoretical models (based on Alfvén waves and MHD turbulence) that have begun to successfully predict both the heating and acceleration in fast and slow wind regions with essentially no free parameters. Some new results regarding these models, including a quantitative prediction of the lower density and temperature at 1 au seen during the present solar minimum compared to the prior minimum, are also shown.
label: dolly

text: Using the data from the international Centre for Diarrhoeal Disease Research ( icddr, b ), from 1996 to 2001, we compared the clinical features of diarrhoea in patients with stool specimens yielding only a. hydrophila (n = 189), or p. shigelloides (n = 253), compared to patients with sole V. cholerae non-O1 infection (n = 99) or V. parahaemolyticus infection (n = 126). Patients exhibited similar frequencies of fever (temperature > 37.8°C), watery stools, and stool with visible mucus. The proportion of patients reporting subjective cure at the time of discharge was significantly smaller for those infected with V. parahaemolyticus. These findings suggest that a. hydrophila and p. shigelloides produce diarrheal disease that is less severe than that resulting from infection with V. cholerae non-O1 or V. parahaemolyticus.

text: We construct a tree - level four - particle open - string amplitudes relevant to dilepton and diphoton production at hadron colliders. We expand these amplitudes into string resonance (sr) contributions and compare their total cross-section through the first sr with the @xmath0 search at the Tevatron. We establish a current lower bound based on the CDF Run I results on the string scale to be about Tev, and it can be improved to about Tev with 2 fb. At the LHC, we investigate the properties of signals induced by string resonances in dilepton and diphoton processes. We demonstrate the unique aspects of sr-induced signals distinguishable from other new physics, such as the angular distributions and forward-backward asymmetry. A lower bound of around Tev can be reached at the LHC for 5 Tev with an integrated luminosity of 6 fb. We emphasize the generic features and profound implications of the amplitude construction.

text:
Sociologist Jake Rosenfield of the University of Washington argues that the decline of organized labor in the United States has been a more significant factor in expanding income inequality than technological changes and globalization, which have also been experienced by other industrialized nations that have not seen steep increases in inequality. 
                        He suggests that nations with high rates of unionization, particularly in Scandinavia, have very low levels of inequality, while nations with weak labor movements, such as the United States, have high levels of inequality.  
                        Thus, he concludes that the historical pattern is clear, and the cross-national pattern is clear as well; strong labor movements and low levels of inequality go hand-in-hand, while weak labor movements and high levels of inequality accompany each other.

text: After the strengthening of his government in northern China, Kublai pursued an imperialist policy in line with the traditions of Mongol and Chinese imperialism. He launched a massive drive against the Song dynasty to the south. Kublai besieged Xiangyang between 1268 and 1273, the last obstacle in his way to capture the rich Yangzi River basin. An unsuccessful naval expedition was undertaken against Japan in 1274. Kublai captured the Song capital of Hangzhou in 1276, the wealthiest city of China. Song loyalists escaped from the capital and enthroned a young child as Emperor Bing of Song. The Mongols defeated the loyalists at the battle of Yamen in 1279. The conquest of the Song reunited northern and southern China for the first time in three hundred years.

text: Inflammation is one of the first responses of the immune system to infection. The symptoms of inflammation are redness, swelling, heat, and pain, which are caused by increased blood flow into tissue. Inflammation is produced by eicosanoids, cytokines, chemokines, and growth factors that are released by injured or infected cells. Eicosanoids are responsible for fever and vasodilation, and leukotrienes for attracting white blood cells to the site of infection. Interleukins recruit immune cells, chemokines act on leukocytes, and interferons have anti-viral effects. Growth factors and cytotoxic factors may also be released. These cytokines and other chemicals recruit immune cells to the site of infection and promote healing of any damaged tissue following the removal of pathogens.
label: dolly

text: Molecular dynamics ( md ) simulation using the modified Brenner Reactive Empirical Bond Order ( rebo ) potential is a powerful tool to investigate plasma wall interaction on divertor plates in a nuclear fusion device. However, the size of the md simulation box is limited to several nm for the performance of a computer. To extend the size of the md simulation, a hybrid simulation code between md code using rebo potential and binary collision approximation ( bca ) code is developed. By demonstrating a hydrogen atom injection on a graphite by the hybrid simulation code, it is found that the hybrid simulation code works efficiently in a large simulation box.

text: Our aim in this study is to describe a hierarchy of electromyographic (EMG) activity production, using percentage maximum voluntary contraction (MVC) of the lumbar iliocostalis and lumbar multifidus muscles during prone, quadruped and sitting exercises. We also aim to identify optimal recruitment exercises for both lumbar iliocostalis as a global multi-segmental stabilizer and lumbar multifidus as a segmental stabilizer. We collected surface electromyographic activity data from the lumbar iliocostalis and lumbar multifidus muscles of twelve healthy volunteers aged 24 to 45. We showed that prone extension, prone alternate arm and leg lifting exercises produce a statistically significant difference in percent MVC of lumbar iliocostalis and lumbar multifidus bilaterally compared to other exercises. Quadruped alternate arm and leg lifting exercises produce greater electromyographic activity in the lumbar multifidus than sitting exercises. This is an effective training exercise for the strengthening of the lumbar multifidus in its role as a segmental stabilizer, and is the most appropriate exercises for this goal.

text: In Britain, the Norman art primarily survives as stonework or metalwork, such as capitals and baptismal fonts. In southern Italy, however, Norman artwork survives abundantly in forms strongly influenced by its Greek, Lombard, and Arab forebears. Of the royal regalia preserved in Palermo, the crown is Byzantine in style and the coronation cloak is of Arab craftsmanship with Arabic inscriptions. Many churches preserve sculptured fonts, capitals, and more importantly mosaics, which were common in Norman Italy and drew heavily on the Greek heritage. Lombard Salerno was a centre of ivorywork in the 11th century and this continued under Norman domination. Finally, should be noted the intercourse between French Crusaders traveling to the Holy Land who brought with them French artefacts with which to gift the churches at which they stopped in southern Italy, amongst their Norman cousins. For this reason many southern Italian churches preserve works from France alongside their native pieces.
label: dolly

text: Hackers said they had breached Hacking Team's internal network and stolen more than 400GB of data. The Italian company said it was working with police to track down the hackers. The stolen data includes a list of the countries that have bought Hacking Team's main surveillance tool, Da Vinci, and emails suggesting intelligence agencies use it to spy on activists and journalists. The list includes: Lists of passwords and login details for client sites were also revealed. The hackers first published stolen data, including internal files, email messages and software source code, on Hacking Team's own Twitter account, having first changed its name to "Hacked Team". The Twitter account of Hacking Team engineer Christian Pozzi was then deleted, while messages confirming the breach were quickly deleted as well. The website of Hacking Team was also offline, while security expert Graham Cluley said the company had "no shortage of online enemies around the world" as its software had been popular with intelligence agencies in many countries. However, its relationship with its clients may be damaged due to the breach, as some of them may have breached their own security in order to use the software. Human rights group Reporters Without Borders had also named Hacking Team as one of its "enemies of the internet" for its use of its software in countries with a poor record of democracy and human rights.
label: dolly

text: There is an urgent need for early diagnosis in medicine, whereupon effective treatments could prevent irreversible tissue damage. The special structure of the eye provides a unique opportunity for noninvasive light-based imaging of ocular fundus vasculature. To detect endothelial injury at the early and reversible stage of adhesion molecule upregulation, some novel imaging agents that target retinal endothelial molecules have been generated. In vivo molecular imaging has a great potential to impact medicine by detecting diseases or screening disease in early stages, identifying the extent of disease, selecting disease and patient-specific therapeutic treatment, applying a directed or targeted therapy, and measuring molecular-specific effects of treatment. Current preclinical findings and advances in instrumentation such as endoscopes and microcatheters suggest that these molecular imaging modalities have numerous clinical applications and will be translated into clinical use in the near future.

text: The dichloromethane extract of Andrographis paniculata was tested for its cardiovascular activity. The extract significantly reduced coronary perfusion pressure by up to 24.5 mm Hg at a dose of 3 mg and also reduced heart rate by up to 49.5 beats per minute at this dose. Five labdane diterpenes, 14-deoxy-12-hydroxyandrographolide, 14-deoxy-11,12-didehydroandrographolide, 14-deoxyandrographolide, andrographolide, and neoandrographolide, were isolated from the aerial parts of the medicinal plant. These compounds were responsible for the coronary vasodilatation, and bioassay-guided studies using animal model showed that compounds 2 and 3 were responsible for this activity. This study also demonstrated that andrographolide (4), the major labdane diterpene in this plant, was responsible for minimal effects on the heart.
label: dolly

text: A 40-year-old woman presented with history of multiple red raised painful lesions over her body of 10 days duration. Lesions spread from forearms to arms and back of trunk during the progression of the disease. Associated pain and burning sensation in the lesions was present while working in the sun. Mild to moderate grade fever, malaise, pain over large joints, decreased appetite and redness of eyes was also present. There was no history of drug intake or other risk factors. Dermatological examination revealed erythematous papules coalescing to form plaques with a pseudovesicular appearance over the extensor aspect of forearms and photo-exposed areas on the back of trunk. There was a sharp cut-off between the lesions and the photo-protected areas. Investigations revealed anemia, neutrophilic leukocytosis, raised erythrocyte sedimentation rate and positive CRP. Skin biopsy showed characteristic features of Sweet's syndrome. No evidence for any secondary etiology was found. She responded to a tapering course of oral steroids and topical broad-spectrum photo protection. This case is a very rare instance of idiopathic Sweet's syndrome occurring in a photo-distributed pattern.
label: dolly

text: The genets of Suillus granulatus were identified in a pine stand by using random amplified polymorphic DNA (RAPD) markers and the mushrooms that fruited for two years. Variations in genet size and distribution were analyzed from a total of 116 mushrooms. From a total of 73 genets, 73 mushroom genets were identified. The lengths of the identified genets in the pine stand ranged from 0.09 to 2.90 m. The average number of mushrooms per genet was 1.2 to 2.3 and the percentage of genets that were represented by a single mushroom was 44%-94%. This variation in the genets of mushrooms in close proximity suggests that the ectomycorrhizal mycelial bodies of S. granulatus propagated sexually by fusing haploid spores derived from the mushrooms gills with below-ground mycelia. Therefore, it is necessary to further investigate the formation of new genets through spores in ectomycorrhizal fungal colonies.

text:
Objective: To assess the level of patient satisfaction with pharmacy services.
                        
                        Methods: A cross-sectional study was conducted on 287 patients who were served in five pharmacies of Gondar University Hospital from May 2015. Data regarding socio-demographic characteristics and parameters that measure patient expectations and satisfaction were collected through interview using the Amharic version of the questionnaire. Data were entered into SPSS version 21 and descriptive statistics, cross-tabs, and binary logistic regressions were utilized. 
                        
                        Findings: Out of the 287 participants, 149 (51.9%) claimed to be satisfied with the pharmacy service and setting. Two hundred and twenty-nine (79.4%) respondents have high expectation toward gaining good services. Despite the presence of a significant association between the pharmacy type and patients level of satisfaction, socio-demographic characteristics of a patient were not found to predict the level of satisfaction.
                        
                        Conclusion: Despite the presence of a higher level of expectation among study participants who earn higher income per month, their satisfaction from the service was found to be low.

text: The number of recent results from x ray observations of active galactic nuclei involving the Fe line (reduction of line variability compared to x ray continuum variability, the x ray "baldwin effect") were attributed to the presence of a hot, ionized skin of an accretion disc, suppressing emission of the line. The ionized skin appears as a result of the thermal instability of x ray irradiated plasma. We test this hypothesis by computing the Thomson thickness of the hot skin on top of the Shakura-Sunyaev disc, by simultaneously solving the vertical structure of both the hot skin and the disc. We then compute a number of relations between observable quantities, e.g. the hard x ray flux, amplitude of the observed reprocessed component, relativistic smearing of the line, the rms variability of the hard x rays. These relations can be compared to present and future observations. We point out that this mechanism is unlikely to explain the behaviour of the x ray source in MCG 6-30-15, where there are a number of arguments against the existence of a thick hot skin, but it can work for some other Seyfert 1 galaxies. Accretion, accretion disc instabilities, galaxies: active galaxies: Seyfert X-ray: galaxies

text: Uncertainty around the value of direct-to-consumer (dtc) genetic testing underscores the importance of tracking public awareness of these services. We analyzed nationally representative cross-sectional data from the Health Information National Trends Survey in 2008 and 2011 to assess population-level changes in awareness of dtc genetic testing. We found that awareness increased significantly from 29% in 2008 to 37% in 2011. The observed increase in awareness from 2008 to 2011 remained significant (OR = 1.39) even when adjusted for sociodemographic variables, health care access, internet use, and population density. Independent of survey year, the odds of awareness of dtc genetic tests were significantly higher for those aged 5064 (OR = 1.64), those aged 6574 (OR = 1.60) and college graduates (OR = 2.02). Additionally, there were significant associations between increased awareness of dtc genetic testing and having a regular source of health care (OR = 1.27), having a prior cancer diagnosis (OR = 1.24) and using the internet (OR = 1.27). Surveillance of awareness along with empirical data on use of and response to genetic risk information can inform public health and policy efforts to maximize benefits and minimize risks of dtc genetic testing.
label: dolly

text: In the 1890s, the University of Chicago was fearful that it would draw away students with its vast resources by affiliating with other universities. To protect its resources, it affiliated with several regional colleges and universities, namely Des Moines College, Kalamazoo College, Butler University, and Stetson University. In 1896, the university joined Shimer College in Mount Carroll, Illinois. Under the terms of the affiliation, the universities were required to have comparable courses of study, to inform the university of any faculty appointments or dismissals, to make no appointments without the university’s approval, and to provide the university with copies of examinations to be reviewed. The university agreed to confer a degree on any graduate from an affiliated school who achieved a grade of A for all four years, and on any other graduate who took twelve weeks of extra study at the university. Students from an affiliated school were entitled to free tuition at the university and the university students were eligible to enroll in affiliated schools at the same terms and receive credits for their work. The university also agreed to provide the affiliated schools with books, scientific apparatus and supplies at cost, to pay special instructors and lecturers without cost except for travel expenses, and to receive free copies of all publications from the university press. The affiliation program passed into history by 1910.

text: In 1993, Galor and Zeira showed that inequality in the presence of credit market imperfections can have a long lasting detrimental effect on human capital formation and economic development. A 1996 study by Perotti examined the channels through which inequality can affect economic growth. He showed that, in accordance with the credit market imperfection approach, inequality is associated with lower levels of human capital formation (education, experience, and apprenticeship) and higher levels of fertility, and therefore lower levels of growth. He found that inequality is associated with higher levels of redistributive taxation, which is associated with lower levels of growth from reductions in private savings and investment. Perotti concluded that, "more equal societies have lower fertility rates and higher rates of investment in education. Both are reflected in higher rates of growth. Also, very unequal societies tend to be politically and socially unstable, which is reflected in lower rates of investment and therefore growth."

Serum creatinine was 1.2 mg/dL, and urine microscopy showed multiple hexagonal cystine crystals. Renal CT scan revealed enlarged polycystic kidneys and scattered bilateral intrarenal calculi. Urinary quantification of cystine was 1645 mg/day (normal excretion rate is 30 mg/day). We suspect that the occurrence of these unrelated diseases in the same patient is coincidental. text: Inflammation is one of the body’s first responses to a threat, creating redness, swelling, heat, and pain. It is caused by increased blood flow to the affected area, the production of eicosanoids and cytokines, and the attraction of immune cells to the site of the infection. These are released by injured or infected cells. Eicosanoids are responsible for producing fever and the dilation of blood vessels, while leukotrienes recruit white blood cells and interleukins and chemokines are involved in communication between the different immune cells. Growth factors and cytotoxic factors may also be released. These chemicals can recruit immune cells to the site of infection, as well as promote healing of damaged tissue following the removal of pathogens.

text: The purpose of this study was to develop a hierarchy of muscle activation during prone, quadruped and sitting exercises, and to identify optimal exercises for both lumbar iliocostalis as a global multi-segmental stabilizer, and lumbar multifidus as a segmental stabilizer. Surface electromyography data were collected bilaterally from the lumbar iliocostalis and lumbar multifidus muscles during prone, quadruped and sitting exercises. Two-way ANOVA analysis showed that prone extension, and prone alternate arm and leg lifting exercises produced significantly greater activity in the lumbar iliocostalis than other exercises. Quadruped alternate arm and leg lifting exercises produced greater activity in the lumbar multifidus muscle than sitting exercises. Prone exercises generated the highest muscle activity, and may be the most effective exercises for strengthening both lumbar iliocostalis and lumbar multifidus muscles. Quadruped alternate arm and leg lifting exercises are recommended as a training exercise for the lumbar multifidus in its role as a segmental stabilizer, and are an effective training exercise for this goal.

text: A woman in her 40s presented with a 10-day history of multiple red raised painful lesions over her body. Furthermore, there was no history of drug intake or any risk-factors for the condition. Her dermatological examination revealed erythematous papules coalescing to form plaques with a pseudovesicular appearance on the extensor aspect of her forearms and photo-exposed areas on her back of her trunk. Furthermore, there was a sharp cut-off between the lesions and the photo-protected areas. She also had anemia, neutrophilic leukocytosis, increased erythrocyte sedimentation rate and positive C-reactive protein. Investigations revealed the presence of anemia, elevated erythrocyte sedimentation rate and elevated C-reactive protein. No evidence for any secondary etiology was found. She responded to a taper course of oral steroids and broad spectrum photo-protection. This case is an extremely rare instance of idiopathic sweet's syndrome occurring in a photo-distributed pattern.

text: The number of recent results from x-ray observations of active galactic nuclei involving the Fe line (reduction of line variability compared to x-ray continuum variability, the X-ray "baldwin effect") were attributed to a presence of a hot, ionized skin of an accretion disc, suppressing emission of the line. These relations can be compared to present and future observations. We point out that this mechanism is unlikely to explain the behaviour of the x-ray source in MCG-6-30-15, where there are arguments against the existence of a thick hot skin, but it can work for some other Seyfert 1 galaxies. text: In the 1890s, the University of Chicago was fearful that its vast resources would injure smaller schools by drawing away good students. To address this issue, the University of Chicago sought to affiliate with several regional colleges and universities. These affiliated schools included Des Moines College, Kalamazoo College, Butler University, and Stetson University. In 1896, the University of Chicago affiliated with Shimer College in Mount Carroll, Illinois. Under the terms of the affiliation, the schools were required to have courses of study comparable to those at the university, to notify the university early of any contemplated faculty appointments or dismissals, to make no faculty appointment without the university's approval, and to send copies of examinations for suggestions. The University of Chicago agreed to confer a degree on any graduating senior from an affiliated school who made a grade of A for all four years, and on any other graduate who took twelve weeks additional study at the University of Chicago. A student or faculty member of an affiliated school was entitled to free tuition at the University of Chicago, and Chicago students were eligible to attend an affiliated school on the same terms and receive credit for their work. The University of Chicago also agreed to provide affiliated schools with books and scientific apparatus and supplies at cost; special instructors and lecturers without cost except travel expenses; and a copy of every book and journal published by the University of Chicago Press at no cost. The agreement provided that either party could terminate the affiliation on proper notice. Several University of Chicago professors disliked the program, as it involved uncompensated additional labor on their part, and they believed it cheapened the academic reputation of the university. The program passed into history by 1910.

It found that inequality is associated with higher levels of redistributive taxation, which is associated with lower levels of growth from reductions in private savings and investment. Perotti concluded that more equal societies have lower fertility rates and higher rates of investment in education. Both are reflected in higher rates of growth. text: Cystinuria is a rare autosomal recessive metabolic disorder of renal and intestinal cystine transport. Cystine stones are found in only 12% of all stone formers. Patients with cystinuria are at high risk for nephrolithiasis and subsequent morbidity. Our patient is a 37-year-old male who presented for routine follow-up for polycystic kidney disease (pkd). He denied any history of passing nephroliths. He had no family history of pkd or personal history of kidney stones. Serum creatinine was 1.2 mg%. On routine urine microscopy, he was found to have multiple hexagonal cystine crystals. Urine ph was 7.5. Renal ct scan revealed enlarged polycystic kidneys and scattered bilateral intra-renal calculi. Urinary quantification of cystine was 1645 mg/day (normal excretion rate 30 mg/day). Patients with pkd are at increased risk for nephrolithiasis for a number of reasons including urinary acidification, concentrating defects and hypocitraturia. The molecular, cellular and genetic basis for cystinuria is distinctly different and presumably unrelated to the genetic defects in pkd. We suspect that the occurrence of these two unrelated genetic diseases in the same patient is a coincidental finding. Even after a thorough review of the published literature, we were unable to find a genetic relationship between cystinuria and cystic renal diseases. To our knowledge, this is the first report of a finding of cystinuria in an adult with pkd.

The rewritten paragraph uses creative vocabulary and concise language to explain the oscillation properties of relativistic, non-self-gravitating tori orbiting around black holes. The paper presents an analysis of the acoustic and epicyclic oscillations of vertically integrated tori in a Kerr spacetime. The paper extends the previous work in a Schwarzschild background. The tori are modeled with various non-keplerian distributions of specific angular momentum, and the oscillation properties are discussed. In parallel, a local analysis is presented which highlights the relations between acoustic and epicyclic oscillations in a Kerr background. A global eigenmode analysis is then performed to compute the axisymmetric modes, with results akin to what was found in a Schwarzschild background. For constant distributions of specific angular momentum, the eigenfrequencies appear in a sequence of 2:3:4 :... which is essentially independent of the size of the disc and of the black hole rotation. For non-constant distributions of angular momentum, on the other hand, the sequence is modified by the properties of the disc and the spin of the black hole, becoming harmonic for sufficiently large tori. The paper also discusses how the @xmath0 modes could explain the high frequency quasi-periodic oscillations observed in low-mass X-ray binaries and the properties of an equivalent model in Newtonian physics. 
                        The rewritten paragraph contains a more efficient vocabulary, more concise language, and an increased scientific understanding of the original paragraph. It successfully conveys the scope of the paper and accurately and clearly explains the oscillation properties of relativistic, non-self-gravitating tori orbiting around black holes.

The Gwynedd Archaeological Trust was alerted by aerial photographer Mary Aris, who spotted a circular mark in crops on a low hill overlooking the Anglesey coast.
                            The trust secured funding from Cadw, the Welsh government's historic environment service, for further inquiry.
                            It used advanced survey technology, such as surveying soil with magnetometers, to build-up a map of the buried remains, without even breaking ground.
                            David Hopewell, of Gwynedd Archaeological Trust, said the results were unusually clear, showing the "unmistakable outline" of a Roman fortlet - a smaller version of a Roman fort.
                            It is thought that the structure dates back to the 1st Century.
                            "The conquest of Anglesey was famously described two thousand years ago by the Roman senator and historian, Tacitus, but historians have, up until now, searched in vain for any sign of forts and roads on the island," the trust said.

text: Before the invention of the telescope, astronomers worked out theories of the moon’s motion. Their purpose was to be able to predict its position in the sky. These geometrical models implied a certain range of distance. Ptolemy’s most quoted model in fact predicted that the moon was nearly twice as far away at apogee than at perigee. Measuring the angular size of the moon was within the capabilities of pre-telescopic astronomers. These could have helped refine the models of the moon’s motion, but hardly anyone seems to have made any measurements that have come down to us. Using a piece of cardboard with a small hole punched in it which slides up and down a yardstick, we can determine an approximate value of the eccentricity of the moon’s orbit. On the basis of 64 observations taken over 14 cycles of the moon’s phases, we find an eccentricity of 0.041 and 0.004 with a typical measurement uncertainty of 0.7 arcmin. Since the angular size of the moon ranges from 29.4 to 33.5 arcmin, carefully taken naked eye data are accurate enough to demonstrate periodic variations of the moon’s angular size.
label: dolly

text: Back in 1994, I was really busy around July 4th - I had two weeks of paid vacation, weekends, and the holiday itself. I stayed in town for the whole time, enjoying my parents' house a lot. I didn't have a TV in my apartment, so I used to watch my parents' tube. I had just finished watching a segment of The X Files when I got a call from the TV station, announcing Personal FX. I was immediately hooked. I had always been fascinated by my parents' family homes, and the items that belonged to them, their ancestors, and estates. I had often wondered about their history and value. After my vacation, I used to go to my folks' house on my lunch-hours just to catch Personal FX. I still remember one episode where host Claire Carter announced that the New York apartment in which the show was filmed was being renovated, and once it was finished, they would be back on the air. It never happened. Personal FX was the first - and best - of the collectible shows. And it disappeared from the air! Almost 15 years later, I still remember it like it was yesterday. Way to go, FX.

text:
Immunology is scientifically innovative and characterized by a strong theoretical approach. Since the 19th century, many scientific theories have been proposed in immunology, from the “cellular” to the “humoral” theories. In the early 20th century, the “cellular” theory, held by Elie Metchnikoff, and the “humoral” theory, held by Robert Koch and Emil von Behring, were both very influential. Today, the “cellular” theory, as championed by John Burnet and later expanded by many others, is still widely accepted, but other theories, such as the “humoral” theory, have also gained considerable support.

text: Cancer is the leading cause of death worldwide and one of the top global public health challenges, with approximately half of the cancer cases in developing countries being caused by air pollution. In recent years, air pollution and cancer have become inseparable issues. Although the causal link between air pollution and cancer has been clearly established, there is still a wide range of discussions and research on how to mitigate the effects of air pollution on cancer in various countries and regions. This editorial and the referenced articles of the Chinese Journal of Cancer discuss the complex political, economic, scientific, and technological issues surrounding air pollution. Do air pollution and its associated cancers warrant concern? Should air pollution be considered a necessary evil accompanying economic transformation in developing countries? Is an explosion of cancer incidence coming to China and how soon will it arrive? What must be done to prevent this possible human catastrophe? What approaches are taken to control air pollution? text: Three Swords Fencing Club extends a warm welcome to all. text: Cygnus X-1 is one of the most well studied black hole candidates, and remains one of the most studied astronomical objects in its class. Its detection of non-thermal radio, hard x-rays and gamma rays reveals the fact that it is able to accelerate particles up to very high energies. In order to explain the electromagnetic emission from Cygnus X-1 in the low-hard state, we present a model of a black hole corona with both lepton and hadron content. We characterize the corona as a two temperature hot plasma, plus a mixed non-thermal population where energetic particles interact with magnetic, photon and matter fields. We include the radiation emitted by secondary particles (pions, muons, and electron / positron pairs), as well as the effects of photon absorption. Finally, we compare the results obtained from our model with data of Cygnus X-1 obtained by the COMPTEL instrument.

text: The hierarchical Schur complement method (hsc) and its extension, have been shown to be a viable and efficient tool for evaluating the retarded Green's function of two-dimensional nanoscale devices. In this work, the hsc-extension is applied to evaluate the solution of non-equilibrium Green's functions of three-dimensional nanoscale devices. This operation count is analyzed for a cubic device. When a cubic device is discretized with a grid of points, the state-of-the-art recursive Green's function (rgf) algorithm requires one iteration, while the hsc-extension only requires two. Operation counts and runtime speeds-up over rgf are also studied for devices of practical interest: graphene-boron nitride-graphene multilayers, silicon nanowires, and a DNA molecule. The numerical experiments show that the cost for the hsc-extension is proportional to one LU-factorization and that the runtime speed-ups over rgf exceed three orders of magnitude when simulating realistic devices, such as a graphene-boron nitride-graphene multilayer with 40,000 atoms.

text: We propose an algorithm for the efficient parallel implementation of elastoplastic problems with hardening based on the so-called t-finite element tearing and interconnecting (tfeti) domain decomposition method.  We consider an associated elastoplastic model with the von-Mises plastic criterion and the linear isotropic hardening law.  Such a model is discretized by the implicit euler method in time and the consequent one time step elastoplastic problem by the finite element method in space.  The latter results in a system of nonlinear equations with a strongly semismooth and strongly monotone operator.  The semismooth newton method is applied to solve this nonlinear system.  Corresponding linearized problems arising in the newton iterations are solved in parallel by the tfeti domain decomposition method.  The proposed tfeti based algorithm was implemented in MATLAB parallel environment and its performance was illustrated on a 3D elastoplastic benchmark.  Numerical results for different time discretizations and mesh levels are presented and discussed and a local quadratic convergence of the semismooth newton method is observed.

text: A first-principles DFT study has been performed to investigate equilibrium geometries, total energies, and diffusion barriers for hydrogen as an interstitial impurity absorbed in $X_0$-Fe. Internal strains and stresses upon hydrogen absorption are crucial to understand preferred absorption sites and diffusion paths. For high concentrations, hydrogen is found to prefer the octahedral site, and for low concentrations, it is found to prefer the tetrahedral site. Diffusion paths depend on the concentration regime too, with hydrogen diffusing much faster in the distorted bcc lattice. External stresses of several GPa modify the diffusion barriers by 10% and diffusion rates by 30%.

text: We analyzed the OCT features of 24 eyes of 12 patients with Bietti's crystalline dystrophy (BCD) with the Heidelberg HRA2-Oct. Seventeen of 24 eyes were in intermediate stage of the disease and seven in advanced stage of the disease at the time of last OCT examination performed in 2014. Outer retinal tubulations and retinal hyperreflective dots were present in 20 of 24 eyes. The remaining four eyes had advanced disease with very thin retina. Appearance of bright plaque on top of RPE-Bruch membrane was present in all eyes. Choroidal hyperreflective spots were noted in 19 of 24 eyes. The remaining five eyes had advanced disease with very thin choroid. Mean central macular thickness was 163.08mm, 62.52 for all eyes (170.35mm, 56.46 in eyes with intermediate disease and 145.42mm, 77.2 in eyes with advanced disease). Mean subfoveal choroidal thickness was 95.37mm, 55.93 for the study eyes (116.47mm, 46.92mm in eyes with intermediate disease and 44.14mm, 42.43 in eyes with advanced disease). Choroidal hyperreflective spots were noted in 21 of 24 eyes (87.5%). SD-Oct shows the disease progression in retinal and choroidal layers delicately in eyes with BCD and expands our knowledge about the ongoing disease process.

text: This paper presents a synthetic statistical top - down mimo power line communications channel model based on a pure phenomenological approach. The basic idea consists of directly synthesizing the experimental channel statistical properties to obtain an extremely compact model that requires a small set of parameters. The model is derived from the analysis of the in-home @xmath0 mimo plc channel data set obtained by the etsi specialist task force 410 measurement campaign in the band 1.8100 MHz. The challenge of modeling the channel statistical correlation, exhibited among the frequencies and between the mimo modes, in compact form is tackled. It is shown that a small set of parameters can be used to reconstruct such a correlation behavior. The model is validated and compared to the measured channels, showing a good agreement in terms of average channel gain, root mean square delay spread, coherence bandwidth, and channel capacity distribution. Power line communications, plc, channel modeling, mimo, phenomenological approach, top-down methodology, statistical model.

text: The laminin (LM) database, which is hosted on the website lm.lncc.br, was published in the nar database 2011 edition. Users can easily access several tabs for lms and LM-related molecules, as well as lm nomenclatures and direct links to pubmed. The updated version of the lm-database integrates data from several publications to achieve a more comprehensive knowledge of lms in health and disease. The novel features include the addition of two new tabs, neuromuscular disorders and miRNA-LM relationship. More specifically, in this updated version, an expanding set of data has been displayed concerning the role of lms in neuromuscular and neurodegenerative diseases, as well as the putative involvement of miRNAs. text: We analyze the properties of networks obtained from the trajectories of unimodal maps at the transition to chaos via the horizontal visibility ( hv ) algorithm. We find that the network degrees fluctuate at all scales with amplitude that increases as the size of the network grows, and can be described by a spectrum of graph-theoretical generalized Lyapunov exponents. We further define an entropy growth rate that describes the amount of information created along paths in network space, and find that such entropy growth rate coincides with the spectrum of generalized graph-theoretical exponents, constituting a set of pesin-like identities for the network.

text: The gamma-ray burst (GRB) event rate, based on the spectral peak energy - to - luminosity relation found by [Yonetoku et al.](https://doi.org/10.1093/mnras/stw2938), can be used to estimate the star formation rate (SFR) for Pop III stars in a high-redshift universe. This is reflected in the derived SFR which implies continuous formation of Pop III stars, with the result that the SFR is high enough to support ionizing radiation from Pop III objects. Utilizing the derived SFR for Pop III objects, we can estimate the ultraviolet (UV) photon emission rate, in a certain redshift range where no observational data has been obtained on the intensity of ionizing radiation. We find that the Uv emissivity at that redshift range can make a noticeable contribution to the early reionization. The maximal emissivity is higher than the level required to keep ionizing the intergalactic matter. However, if the escape fraction of ionizing photons from Pop III objects is smaller than 10%, the IGM will be neutralized at some redshift. As for the enrichment, the ejection of all metals synthesized by Pop III objects is marginally consistent with the ionized metal fraction, though confinement of metals in Pop III objects can reduce the enrichment significantly.

text: Hence, 6 is not prime. The image at the right illustrates that 12 is not prime: 12 = 3 · 4. No even number greater than 2 is prime since by definition, any such number n has at least three distinct divisors, namely 1, 2, and n. This implies that n is not prime. Accordingly, the term odd prime refers to any prime number greater than 2. Similarly, when written in the usual decimal system, all prime numbers larger than 5 end in 1, 3, 7, or 9 since even numbers are multiples of 2 and numbers ending in 0 or 5 are multiples of 5.

My father used to work in live television, so he told me stories about it, and when I talked to David about the subject, he just loved the idea of this backstage chaos. So I wrote a lot of the material with particular actors from Twin Peaks in mind - we built up a sort of repertory company - and the humour grew out of the funny parts of Twin Peaks, which are the ones I'm most pleased with. text:
The movie is gripping throughout its length and its black and white photography of the American heartland is stunning. We feel like we're right there with them as they cross the big sky country and then into Mexico, and back into America again. The final moments are especially captivating as the reflection of the rain on Robert Blake looks like rivers of sweat and tears rolling down his face. In the end, we follow them up the stairway to their final moment. 
                        The two criminals, portrayed by Robert Blake and Scott Wilson, are frighteningly real, the same as any other person you'd meet in any town. Hickock is a smiling boy next door, and Smith, the guy with stars in his eyes from the wrong side of town. Evil, even the most vile, is a part of the human condition. These two deluded men murder an entire family, looking for a safe that isn't there. As they write cheques, carving out a trail for the authorities, we know that this is wrong and that their motives will not be uncovered.

text: In the past few years, the use of social media has grown significantly. The use of social media has evolved from just narrating life events to actually shaping them. Through this paper, we explore the amount of resources shared in social media that are still available on the live web or in public web archives. By analyzing six different event-centric datasets of resources shared in social media in the period from June 2009 to March 2012, we found that 11% are lost and 20% are archived after just a year. In addition, we found a nearly linear relationship between time of sharing of the resource and the percentage lost, with a slightly less linear relationship between time of sharing and archiving coverage of the resource. From this model, we conclude that after the first year of publishing, nearly 11% of shared resources will be lost and after that, we will continue to lose 0.02% per day. Archiving, social media, digital preservation.

text: Patients with acute myocardial infarction (AMI) and diabetes mellitus, as well as patients admitted with elevated blood glucose without known diabetes, have impaired outcome. Therefore, intensive glucose-lowering therapy with insulin has been proposed in diabetic or hyperglycaemic patients and has been shown to improve survival and reduce incidence of adverse events. The current manuscript provides an overview of randomised controlled trials investigating the effect of intensive insulin therapy. Furthermore, systemic glucose-insulin-potassium infusion (GIK) has been studied to improve outcome after AMI. Despite positive findings in some early studies, GIK did not show any beneficial effects in recent clinical trials and thus this concept has been abandoned. While intensive insulin therapy targets to achieve normoglycaemia, it has been shown to improve outcome in patients with AMI. Achieving glucose regulation, however, is difficult and carries the risk of hypoglycaemia. More research is needed to determine the optimal glucose target levels in AMI and to investigate whether computerised glucose protocols and continuous glucose sensors can improve safety and efficacy of insulin.

text: A prime number is a natural number that has no positive divisors other than 1 and itself. A natural number greater than 1 that is not a prime is called a composite number. For example, 5 is prime because 1 and 5 are its only positive integer factors, whereas 6 is composite because it has the divisors 2 and 3 in addition to 1 and 6. The fundamental theorem of arithmetic establishes the central role of primes in number theory: any integer greater than 1 can be expressed as a product of primes that is unique up to ordering. The uniqueness in this theorem requires excluding 1 as a prime because one can include arbitrarily many instances of 1 in any factorization, e.g., 3, 1 · 3, 1 · 1 · 3, etc. are all valid factorizations of 3.

text: For a precise definition of what it means to solve a problem using a given amount of time and space, a computational model such as the deterministic Turing machine is used. The time required by a deterministic Turing machine M on input x is the total number of state transitions, or steps, the machine makes before it halts and outputs the answer ("yes" or "no"). A Turing machine M is said to operate within time f(n), if the time required by M on each input of length n is at most f(n). A decision problem A can be solved in time f(n) if there exists a Turing machine operating in time f(n) that solves the problem. Since complexity theory is interested in classifying problems based on their difficulty, one defines sets of problems based on some criteria. For instance, the set of problems solvable within time f(n) on a deterministic Turing machine is then denoted by DTIME(f(n)).

text: The Scottish Parliament debating chamber has seating arranged in a hemicycle, which reflects the desire to encourage consensus amongst elected members. There are 131 seats in the debating chamber. Of the total 131 seats, 129 are occupied by the Parliament's elected MSPs and two are seats for the Scottish Law Officers – the Lord Advocate and the Solicitor General for Scotland, who are not elected members of the Parliament but are members of the Scottish Government. As such the Law Officers may attend and speak in the plenary meetings of the Parliament but, as they are not elected MSPs, cannot vote. Members are able to sit anywhere in the debating chamber, but typically sit in their party groupings. The first minister, Scottish cabinet ministers and law officers sit in the front row, in the middle section of the chamber. The largest party in the Parliament sits in the middle of the semicircle, with opposing parties on either side. text: Although @xcite is extremely useful in understanding the shapes of transmission spectra of exoplanets, it does not include the effects of a sharp change in flux with altitude due to surfaces and optically thick clouds.  Recent advances in understanding the effects of refraction in exoplanet transmission spectra have demonstrated that even clear thick atmospheres have a sharp change in flux due to refractive boundaries.  We have derived an analytical formalism by including first-order effects from all these surfaces to compute an exoplanet's effective radius, atmospheric thickness, and spectral modulation for a homogeneous atmosphere with a constant scale height.  We show that the effective radius cannot be located below these surfaces, and our formalism matches @xcite's in the case of a clear atmosphere.  Our formalism explains why clouds and refraction reduce the contrast of spectral features, and why refraction decreases the Rayleigh scattering slope as wavelength increases, but also shows that these are common effects of all surfaces.  We introduce the concept of a surface "cross-section", the minimum mean cross-section that can be observed, as an index to characterize the location of surfaces, and provide a simple method to estimate their effects on the spectral modulation of homogeneous atmospheres.  We devise a numerical recipe to extend our formalism to atmospheres with a non-constant scale height and arbitrary sources of opacity, which potentially will be necessary to interpret observations.

text: Cardiac cachexia is a co-morbidity that may develop in terminal stages of chronic heart failure, affecting up to 15% of ambulatory patients with heart failure. Over the last decades, cardiac cachexia and alterations in muscle metabolism in heart disease have received increasing research interest. This article highlights some recent studies of cardiac cachexia that were presented at the annual meeting of the European Society of Cardiology in September 2010 in Stockholm, Sweden. Studies presented here were focused on effects of exercise training and protein degradation, particularly into the role of the ubiquitin proteasome complex and its ubiquitin ligases Murf-1 and Mafbx. Exercise training in patients with CHF was found to increase maximal oxygen consumption and to reduce Murf-1 expression. Lysosomal muscle degradation does not seem to play a major role in patients with CHF, however, inflammatory cytokines such as TNF-a seem to trigger muscle protein degradation. Other studies found that the serum levels of the adipokine adiponectin are elevated in patients with CHF and that these levels may be correlated with muscle mass, muscle strength in the arms or with trunk fat mass. Another study found that the expression of myostatin in skeletal muscle is decreased in spontaneously hypertensive rats with CHF compared with control animals. This is also true for follistatin, a powerful antagonist, and its potential as a biomarker of muscle wasting. These findings may pave the way for effective treatment approaches to cardiac cachexia.

text: We research the possibility of tuning the electrostatic coupling between solid state quantum dots as building blocks for quantum bits.
