text: Oxygen was discovered independently by Carl Wilhelm Scheele in Uppsala, Sweden in 1773 or earlier and Joseph Priestley in Wiltshire, England in 1774, but Priestley is usually given priority because his work was published first. The name oxygen was coined by Antoine Lavoisier in 1777 when he studied oxygen and its relation to combustion and corrosion, discrediting the then popular phlogiston theory of combustion and corrosion. Its name comes from the Greek words "oxys" meaning "acid" and "genes" meaning "producer" as oxygen was mistakenly thought to be an acid and to produce something. Oxygen is used for producing steel, plastics and textiles, brazing, welding and cutting of steel and other metals, rocket propellant, in oxygen therapy and life support systems in aircraft, submarines, spaceflight and diving.
label: dolly

text: Robert Nozick argued that government redistribution is the practice of stealing in the form of taxation, and that the ideal moral society would be one where all individuals are free from coercion. However, Nozick recognized that certain modern economic inequalities are the result of forceful stealing of property, and the need for some redistribution to compensate for this force but not because of the inequalities themselves. John Rawls argued in A Theory of Justice that inequalities in the distribution of wealth are justified when they improve society as a whole, including the poorest members of society. Rawls does not discuss the full implications of his theory of justice. Some see Rawls's argument as a justification for capitalism since even the poorest members of society theoretically benefit from increased innovations under capitalism; others believe only a strong welfare state can satisfy Rawls's theory of justice.
label: dolly

text: Objective: To assess the mean reduction in the closest tumor-free margin in millimeters following formalin fixation of breast tumour surgical specimens. Materials and Methods: A cross-sectional study was conducted at the Aga Khan University Hospital from March 30, 2010 to January 20, 2011. One hundred consecutive breast tumour surgical specimens which had macroscopically visible tumour were included. Patients were excluded if they had a previous history of surgery or radiation therapy. The closest tumor-free margin was recorded and compared with the margin after formalin fixation. P-value of < 0.05 was considered significant. Results: The mean age of our 100 patients was 53 years with the majority of the patients having undergone mastectomy for predominantly invasive ductal carcinoma. Following formalin fixation, the mean reduction of the closest tumor-free margin was noted as 2.14 mm which was found statistically significant. Conclusion: Significant shrinkage of tumor-free surgical margins of breast cancer specimen was noted after formalin fixation. This inference can have implications on the postoperative management plan.
label: dolly

text: We scrutinize the evolution of a single unbounded interface between ordered phases in two-dimensional Ising ferromagnets that are endowed with single-spin-flip zero-temperature Glauber dynamics. Specifically, we examine the cases where the interface initially has either one or two corners. In both examples, the interface evolves to a limiting self-similar form. We apply the continuum-time-dependent Ginzburg-Landau equation and a microscopic approach to calculate the interface shape. For the single corner system, we also discuss a correspondence between the interface and the young diagram that represents the partition of the integers.

text: Improved awareness of the signs and symptoms of sepsis and the importance of early treatment have aided in improved survival rates in recent years. No specific, effective anti-sepsis therapies are available, so management focuses on early source control, adequate and appropriate antibiotics, and removal of any source of infection, rapid resuscitation, hemodynamic stabilization, and organ support. text: The homes from the early 20th century line this boulevard in the heart of the historic Alta Vista Tract. The area of Huntington Boulevard between First Street on the west and Cedar Avenue on the east is the home to many large, stately houses. The original development of this area began circa 1910, on 190 acres of an alfalfa field. The Alta Vista Tract, as it would become known, was mapped by William Stranahan for the Pacific Improvement Corporation in 1911. The tract was officially platted in the same year, with its boundaries being the rear of Balch Avenue (south), Cedar Avenue (east), the rear property line of Platt Avenue (east of Sixth Street) and Platt Avenue (west of Sixth Street) (north), and First Street (west). The subdivision was annexed to the City in January 1912, in an election that was the first in which women voted in the community. At the time of its admission to the City, the Alta Vista Tract was uninhabited but landscaped, with the trees having to be watered by a tank wagon. In 1914 developers Billings and Meyering acquired the tract, completed the street development, provided the last of the necessary municipal improvements including water service, and began marketing the property with fervor. The rapid development of the tract was no doubt hastened by the Fresno Traction Company’s right-of-way along Huntington Boulevard, which provided streetcar connections between downtown and the County Hospital.

text: The United States was the first nation to start a public network to make ARPANET technology accessible to the public. The idea was put forth by former ARPA Director Larry Roberts and was first proposed to AT&T who declined as they would not allow it to be transferred to a different company. Luckily, Bolt, Beranek and Newman (BBN) offered the necessary funds for the project. The network used ARPANET technology but had different host and terminal interfaces (X.25 and X.29) and designed the protocols to make them as standard as possible. In addition, Telenet implemented these protocols and helped define them in the CCITT. The network was incorporated in 1973 and started operations in 1975. In 1979, the network went public and was then sold to GTE.

text: The dynamic range of visual coding is extended by having separate ganglion cell types that respond to light increments and decrements. While the primordial color vision system in mammals contains a well characterized subset of s-on ganglion cells, less is known about s-off counterparts. We identified a regular mosaic of s-off ganglion cells in the ground squirrel. Contrary to convention, s-off center responses come from an s-on bipolar and inverting amacrine cell.

text: In this paper, we investigate the competition between finite-size effects (i.e. discernibility of particles) and dipole-dipole interactions in few-atom systems coupled to the electromagnetic field in vacuum. We consider two hallmarks of cooperative effects, superradiance and subradiance, and compute for each the rate of energy radiated by the atoms and the coherence of the atomic state during the time evolution. We adopt a statistical approach in order to extract the typical behavior of the atomic dynamics and average over random atomic distributions in spherical containers with prescribed values of the radiation wavenumber and average interatomic distance. Our approach allows us to highlight the tradeoff between finite-size effects and dipole-dipole interactions in superradiance / subradiance. In particular, we show the existence of an optimal value of the radiation wavenumber for which the superradiant intensity and coherence pulses are the less affected by dephasing effects induced by dipole-dipole interactions and finite-size effects.
label: dolly

text: The tropical form of endomyocardial fibrosis (EMF) is a very common medical problem in the coastal districts of south India, especially the Kerala state. Clinical and autopsy studies have shown left and right ventricular apical fibrosis, with varying degree of atrioventricular valve regurgitation. Left ventricular endomyocardial fibrosis presents with severe pulmonary hypertension and right ventricular endomyocardial fibrosis presents very high systemic venous pressure and congestive cardiac failure. Surgical management improved the natural history of the disease to some extent. Various infectious and toxic factors have been postulated regarding its aetiology. During the last few years, incidence of the disease has decreased considerably. The only explanation identified is the significant improvement in the living standards of the people with the corresponding decline in the childhood malnutrition, infections, worm infestation and associated eosinophilia.
label: dolly

text: In this paper, we have presented an analysis of temporal and spectral properties of three anomalous x-ray pulsars (axps) and soft gamma repeaters (sgrs) including AX J1622.1-4950, AX J1845.0-0258, and SGR J1550-5418. We focused on analyzing the short bursts from the three sources and studied their temporal and spectral properties. We employed the Bayesian Block algorithm to detect and locate the short bursts. The duration distributions of short bursts were fitted with two lognormal functions. We found that the burst spectrum could be well described with two blackbody components or optically thin thermal bremsstrahlung model for AX J1622.1-4950 and AX J1845.0-0258, and that there is a positive correlation between burst luminosity and persistent luminosity for SGR J1550-5418. We also estimated that the energy ratio of persistent emission to short bursts is in the range of three sources, being comparable to the case of type-x ray bursts.
label: dolly

text: Sentential decision diagrams ( sdds ) are essentially as tractable as ordered binary decision diagrams ( obdds ), but tend to be more succinct in practice.  This makes them a prominent representation language, with many applications in artificial intelligence and knowledge compilation.  We prove that they are more succinct than obdds, by constructing a family of boolean functions where each member has polynomial size sdds but exponential size obdds.  This improves a quasipolynomial separation recently established by Razgon, and settles an open problem in knowledge compilation.
label: dolly

text: The graph isomorphism problem is the computational problem of determining whether two finite graphs are isomorphic. An important unsolved problem in complexity theory is whether the graph isomorphism problem is in P, NP-complete, or NP-intermediate. The answer is not known, but it is believed that the problem is at least not NP-complete. If graph isomorphism is NP-complete, the polynomial time hierarchy collapses to its second level. Since it is widely believed that the polynomial hierarchy does not collapse to any finite level, it is believed that graph isomorphism is not NP-complete. The best algorithm for this problem, due to Laszlo Babai and Eugene Luks has run time 2O(√(n log(n))) for graphs with n vertices.
label: dolly

text: Groups who use the hall in Llanwinio said they will hand in their keys after the rent tripled and they were asked to sign up to a 25-year lease. Peter Walton, from the association that runs the hall, described the changes as unreasonable and unfair. But the Diocese of St Davids said it is obligated by law to charge market-value rent. Rent costs charged to the Community Association of Volunteers are set to increase from £250 to £750 a year and it will also have to meet the costs of the insurance for the first time. The St Davids Diocesan Board of Finance (DBF) said: "A proper valuation of the hall was undertaken and the rental charge increased in line with that. The rental goes to the parish, not the DBF, hence keeping it within the local community." But Mr Walton from the Community Association of Volunteers told Newyddion 9 the finance board is behaving in an unfair, unreasonable and unjust manner. He added: "It's not just the money... we will be taking all of our belongings out of this building on Saturday 27 February and we'll be handing the keys back unless there's a change of heart."

text: The hydrography of the current delta is characterized by the main arms of the delta, such as the Hollandse IJssel, Linge, Vecht, etc., disconnected arms, and smaller rivers and streams. Many rivers have been dammed and now serve as drainage channels for the numerous polders. Construction of the Delta Works changed the delta in the second half of the 20th century fundamentally. Currently Rhine water runs into the sea, or into former marine bays now separated from the sea, at the mouths of the Nieuwe Merwede, Nieuwe Waterway (Nieuwe Maas), Dordtse Kil, Spui and IJssel.

text:
I saw this at the London Film Festival last night, apparently the shorter version. James McNally's summary of the content of the film is very good. Nossiter very deftly blends his investigation of the wine business into wider concerns about globalisation, homogenisation, the effect of the mass media, the power of capital and the need for diversity.
                         
                         The film is shot on hand-held DV which some might find offputting, but which does enable Nossiter to catch people off guard on a number of occasions which probably would not have been possible using more conventional equipment.
                         
                         Despite the sprawling feel of the film, the editing is very sharp, not only giving us a parade of the world's dogs, but also undercutting a number of interviewees' comments with somewhat contradictory visual images, and giving others sufficient rope to hang themselves. To a degree this evoked Michael Moore's recent work (although Nossiter operates in a more subtle way), but probably the roots of the film go back to Marcel Ophuls' ""The Sorrow and the Pity"", both in the way the film is constructed and in the emergence of'salt of the earth' French peasants as the stars. De Montille pere et fils were present at the LFF screening and answered questions afterwards.
                         
                         We do indeed all need a little disorder - bravo Hubert!
                         
                         
                        Overall an excellent film with

text: The elaborate morphology of neurons and the information processing that occurs in remote dendritic and axonal compartments necessitate the use of decentralized cell biological machines. text: We investigated the growth characteristics and physicochemical properties of a doubled haploid population derived from a cross between Cheongcheong and Nagdong to breed a rice variety that tastes good after cooking and to detect quantitative trait loci (QTLs) associated with the taste of cooked rice. Correlation analysis of the amylose, protein and lipid contents indicated that each compound is correlated with the taste of cooked rice. QTLs associated with amylose content were 4 QTLs, those associated with protein content were 2 QTLs, and those associated with lipid content were 2 QTLs. text: The bodies of the Burke family, from the Milton Keynes area, were removed on Friday. Poor weather and challenging terrain at the Rhinog Mountains in Snowdonia has hampered recovery efforts. The search began on Wednesday when the aircraft vanished. Experts from the Air Accidents Investigation Branch have arrived on the scene and it is believed the recovery of the aircraft could take up to three days. The wreckage will be taken to its base at Farnborough, before it can be fully investigated. The Twin Squirrel helicopter was registered to Kevin and Ruth Burke, who were directors of the Milton Keynes-based Staske Construction Company. The group were travelling to Dublin, where Ruth Burke was born. It is believed Kevin Burke was originally from Manchester and was a qualified pilot. The helicopter had left a private airfield in the Milton Keynes area before losing radar contact at around 16:00 BST on Wednesday and crashing in the Rhinog Mountains, between Harlech and Trawsfynydd in Gwynedd. A mountain rescue team has found the wreckage. Police have appealed for anyone in the Trawsfynydd area between noon and 13:00 on Wednesday who may have heard or seen the helicopter to contact them.

text:
This is the rewritten version of the original paragraph. We have included a few additional details, and added a few sentences to explain the results and conclusions.

                        We presented the results of a weak lensing survey of six high-redshift, X-ray selected clusters. We have obtained ultra-deep images of each cluster with the Keck telescope. We measured a weak lensing signal from each cluster. From the background galaxy ellipticities, we created two-dimensional maps of the surface mass density of each cluster. We found that the substructure seen in the mass reconstructions typically agrees well with substructure in both the cluster galaxy distributions and X-ray images of the clusters. We also measured the one-dimensional radial profiles of the lensing signals and fit them with both isothermal spheres and universal dark matter profiles. We found that the more massive clusters are less compact and not as well fit by isothermal spheres as the less massive clusters, possibly indicating that they are still in the process of collapse.

text: The complexities of medications are so great that pharmacy training after pharmacy school involves gaining more education and training through a pharmacy practice residency and sometimes followed by another residency in a specific area. text: This work refits the dimension transmutation parameter of quantum chromodynamics, $\mathrm{qcd}(x,\mu_R)$, to experimental data of Drell-Yan observables. To achieve this, we first obtain the evolution of transverse momentum dependent parton distribution functions (tmdPDFs) up to the nNLO approximation based on the Collins-Soper-Stastler (CSS) formalism. Because of the expected appearance of tmdPDFs at larger values of transverse momentum as the energy scales and the order of approximation increase, the fitted value of $\mathrm{qcd}(x,\mu_R)$ is consistent with the specified acceptable range. Consequently, the calculated Drell-Yan cross sections at different energies agree within the available data.

text: Sayyid Abul Ala Maududi was a prominent early-twentieth century figure in the revival of Islam in India, Pakistan and beyond. He trained as a lawyer and later took up journalism, writing extensively on contemporary issues, such as Islam and Islamic law. In 1941, he founded the Jamaat-e-Islami party and remained its leader until 1972. However, his main influence was through his writings, which he published and translated into many languages. His books explained Islam in modern contexts and helped shape the ideas of conservative ulema and liberal modernizers, such as Abdul Majid Qasuri, who carried his principles forward.

text: Bullous systemic lupus erythematosus ( bsle ) is a rare manifestation of systemic lupus erythematosus ( sle ) characterized histologically by subepidermal bullae, predominantly neutrophilic infiltrate, and immunoglobulin ( igg, iga, igm) and c3 deposition at the basement membrane zone. Often associated is a heterogeneous profile of autoimmunity to components of type VII collagen. It needs to be differentiated from other subepidermal bullous diseases such as bullous pemphigoid ( bp ) in view of potentially associated systemic manifestations of sle. Here, we report a 39-year-old lady with an extensive vesicobullous eruption on face, neck, trunk, and mucosa. She also had photosensitivity, significant anemia, and high antibody titers confirming sle. Routine histopathology and immunofluorescence studies indicated bsle and she responded favorably to dapsone therapy. The importance of clinical and histopathological findings in confirming a diagnosis of bsle is highlighted.
label: dolly

text: We use molecular dynamics simulations in two dimensions to investigate the possibility that a core-softened potential can reproduce the static and dynamic anomalies observed in liquid water, such as the increase in specific volume upon cooling, the increase in isothermal compressibility upon cooling, and the increase in the diffusion coefficient with pressure. We relate these anomalies to the shape of the potential and obtain the phase diagram of the system. We identify two solid phases - a square crystal and a triangular crystal - and discuss the relation between these phases and the polymorphism. We also compare the phase diagram of our model system with experimental data, especially the line of temperatures of maximum density, line of pressures of maximum diffusion constant, and line of temperatures of minimum isothermal compressibility.
label: dolly

text: We describe a 26-year-old woman with a nodular rash on the elbows after an insect bite. Two days later, she developed erythema nodosum. Both these lesions were treated symptomatically. One week later, she had purpura, abdominal pain, hematuria, and arthralgias. Her investigations revealed only microscopic hematuria that disappeared with therapy. This pattern of sequential appearance of rash and a nodular morphology is both unique and rare.
label: dolly

text: Porsche's pre-tax profit dropped to €1.19bn (£841m) for the nine months to 30 September, after the scandal revealed by Volkswagen in September affected its 11 million vehicle's profits. Porsche warned that its profits would be significantly hit by the scandal, which affects 30.8% of Volkswagen's shares. The company expected to make a net profit of between €800m and €1.8bn this year. That will be significantly lower than the €3.03bn profit Porsche posted for 2014. Porsche's results published on Tuesday include no new information about the investigation. The company said that future profit guidance could change depending on the outcome of the investigation. "As the majority shareholder, Porsche SE is affected by developments at the level of the Volkswagen Group," it said. Porsche shares rose 0.6% to €40.01 in Frankfurt. Volkswagen shares fell 1% to €95.51. The value of VW stock has halved in the past three months, in the wake of the scandal.
label: dolly

text: Despite their soft, gelatinous bodies, ancient fossils thought to represent ctenophores, having no tentacles but many more comb-rows than modern forms, were found in lagerstätten as early as the Cambrian, about 515 million years ago. The position of the ctenophores in the evolutionary tree of animals has long been debated, and the majority view at present, based on molecular phylogenetics, is that cnidarians and bilaterians are more closely related to each other than either is to ctenophores. A recent molecular phylogenetics analysis concluded that the common ancestor of all modern ctenophores was cydippid-like, and that all the modern groups appeared relatively recently, possibly after the Cretaceous–Paleogene extinction event 66 million years ago. Evidence accumulating since the 1980s indicates that the "cydippids" are not monophyletic, in other words are not descendants of a single common ancestor, since all the other traditional ctenophore groups are descendants of various cydippids.
label: dolly

text: The shape of the Rhine delta is determined by two bifurcations: first, at Millingen aan de Rijn, the Rhine splits into Waal and Pannerdens Kanaal, which changes its name to Nederrijn at Angeren, and second near Arnhem, the IJssel branches off from the Nederrijn. This creates three main flows, two of which change names rather often. The largest and southern main branch begins as Waal and continues as Boven Merwede ("Upper Merwede"), Beneden Merwede ("Lower Merwede"), Noord River ("North River"), Nieuwe Maas ("New Meuse"), Het Scheur ("the Rip") and Nieuwe Waterweg ("New Waterway"). The middle flow begins as Nederrijn, then changes into Lek, then joins the Noord, thereby forming Nieuwe Maas. The northern flow keeps the name IJssel until it flows into Lake IJsselmeer. Three more flows carry significant amounts of water: the Nieuwe Merwede ("New Merwede"), which branches off from the southern branch where it changes from Boven to Beneden Merwede; the Oude Maas ("Old Meuse"), which branches off from the southern branch where it changes from Beneden Merwede into Noord, and Dordtse Kil, which branches off from Oude Maas.
label: dolly

text: The present study aimed to evaluate and compare the anti-inflammatory effects of aqueous extracts of green and black tea leaves on the denaturation of protein in vitro. The test extracts at different concentrations were incubated with egg albumin under controlled experimental conditions and the anti-inflammatory property was determined by measuring the absorbance. Diclofenac sodium was used as the reference drug. The present results revealed a concentration-dependent inhibition of protein denaturation by both tea extracts. Green tea was found to be more potent than black tea likely due to the higher flavonoid contents. From the present findings, it can be concluded that both green and black tea leaves possess anti-inflammatory effects against the denaturation of protein. Green tea was found to be more active than black tea likely due to the higher flavonoid contents.
label: dolly

Al-Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula (AQAP) is believed to be behind the attacks, which is an al-Qaeda branch in Yemen. The militants fired machine guns and rocket propelled grenades at the security and intelligence agencies' offices.

The al-Qaeda-linked militants launched their attack on the general security and intelligence agencies, likely for their claims of attacking the intelligence agency in Aden earlier in the year. The attack resulted in the deaths of at least two people and multiple casualties are expected.

text: Enda Dolan, from Killyclogher in Omagh, County Tyrone, was involved in a car crash on the Malone Road, near the Elms student village, at 2:25 BST. A 29-year-old was arrested on suspicion of causing death by dangerous driving. A 19-year-old man was detained for suspicion of causing death by dangerous driving and driving whilst unfit through drink or drugs. Mr Dolan was a first year architecture student at Queen's University in Belfast. The Malone Road was closed for almost 12 hours but is now open in both directions. Police have appealed for witnesses, or anyone who was travelling on the Malone Road at the time of the incident, to come forward.

text: An hotel was flooded to the ground floor after the sea wave smashed the windows. The ferries were cancelled in Cornwall and there were delays on trains out of the South West after waves topped sea defences at Dawlish in Devon. Ferry firm Condor said the Liberation was unable to berth in Guernsey and passengers to Poole were advised to book alternative services. The ground floor including the cafe at the Ship and Castle Hotel in St Mawes was flooded for several hours until the fire service pumped out the water. Firefighters were also called to deal with flooding at three homes in Penzance and flooding was also reported in Looe. A spokeswoman at the Ship and Castle said: "There was nothing we could do, the force of the storm pushed in the windows. "Now we are concerned about what is going to happen at the next high tide this evening." The weather is expected to subside, according to the forecasters. Twelve flood warnings - the second highest category - and 16 flood alerts have been issued by the Environment Agency for the South West. A part of the esplanade in Exmouth, Devon was closed to protect people from flying debris. The Sandbanks chain ferry between Poole and Studland in Dorset was halted for two hours. The second day of the two-day Fish and Ships food and boat festival in Portland, where gusts of up to 50mph were predicted, was also abandoned.

text: This work explores the behaviour of the height distributions of the equipotential lines in a region confined by two interfaces: a cathode with an irregular interface and a distant flat anode. Both boundaries, which are maintained at distinct and constant potential values, are assumed to be conductors. The morphology of the cathode interface results from the deposit of monolayers that are produced using a single competitive growth model based on the rules of restricted solid on solid and ballistic deposition models. At each time step, these rules are selected with probability and. For several irregular profiles that depend on, a family of equipotential lines is evaluated. The lines are characterized by the skewness and kurtosis of the height distribution. The results indicate that the skewness of the equipotential line increases when they approach the flat anode, and this increase has a non-trivial convergence to a delta distribution that characterizes the equipotential line in a uniform electric field. The morphology of the equipotential lines is discussed; the discussion emphasizes their features for different ranges of that correspond to positive, null and negative values of the coefficient of the non-linear term in the KPZ equation.
label: dolly

text: We show that, in a model of modified gravity based on the spectral action functional, there is a nontrivial coupling between cosmic topology and inflation, in the sense that the shape of the possible slow-roll inflation potentials obtained in the model from the nonperturbative form of the spectral action are sensitive to both the geometry (flat or positively curved) of the universe and the different possible non-simply connected topologies. We demonstrate this by explicitly computing the nonperturbative spectral action for some candidate flat cosmic topologies given by Bieberbach manifolds and showing that the resulting inflation potential differs from that of the flat torus by a multiplicative factor, similarly to what happens in the case of the spherical forms in relation to the case of the sphere. We then show that, while the slow-roll parameters differ between the spherical and flat manifolds, they do not distinguish different topologies within each class, while the power spectra detect the different scalings of the slow-roll potential and therefore distinguish between the various topologies, both in the spherical and in the flat case.
label: dolly

text: The University of Chicago is a renowned research hub and breeding ground for ideas. In economics, it is the namesake of the Chicago School of Economics, a school of thought which emphasizes free markets and economic freedom. In sociology, the University of Chicago was the first and foremost department of its kind, giving birth to the Chicago School of Sociology. In physics, the University of Chicago conducted the first self-sustained man-made nuclear reaction, and with it was the Manhattan Project. In chemistry, the Miller–Urey experiment was conducted at the University of Chicago in 1953, and was responsible for discovering the fundamentals of life as we know it. The field of sleep, known as Rapid Eye Movement (REM), was also discovered at the University of Chicago in 1953 by Nathaniel Kleitman and Eugene Aserinsky.

text:
Introduction: malignant pleural mesothelioma (mpm) is an aggressive cancer arising from pleural mesothelium. Surgery aims to either cure the disease or control the symptoms. Two surgical procedures exist: Extrapleural pneumonectomy (epp) and pleurectomy / decortication (p/d).
                        Systematic Review: We assessed current evidence on safety and efficacy of surgery. Methods: Five electronic databases were reviewed from January 1990 to January 2013. Studies were selected according to a predefined protocol. Primary endpoint was overall survival. Secondary endpoints included quality of life, disease-free survival, disease recurrence, morbidity, and length of hospital stay. Results: Sixteen studies were included. Median survival ranged from 8.1 to 32 months for p/d and from 6.9 to 46.9 months for epp. Perioperative mortality was 0%-9.8% and 3.2%-12.5%, respectively. Perioperative morbidity was 5.9%-55% for p/d and 10%-82.6% for epp. Average length of stay was 7 days for p/d and 9 days for epp. Conclusion: Current evidence cannot definitively answer which procedure (epp or p/d) is more beneficial in terms of survival and operative risks. Specialised centres have better results.
label: dolly

text: Proposed Action: FTA and CTA published an Environmental Assessment (EA) for the Lawrence to Bryn Mawr Modernization Project on April 29, 2015, established a 30-day public comment period to accept formal comments, and hosted an official public hearing on May 14, 2015. Based on a review of the EA and all public comments received, FTA issued a Finding of No Significant Impact (FONSI) for this project. The FONSI documentation includes responses to comments received as well as suggested mitigation measures to minimize the environmental impacts of the project, including impacts to historic resources. Supporting documents related to the EA process are provided below. The issuance of the FONSI means that CTA has identified all potential impacts and ways to minimize and mitigate those impacts and that based on that information, FTA has found that there would be no significant impacts resulting from implementation of this project. The FONSI is required before CTA can receive federal funding to construct the project.

text: In the aftermath of the St. Bartholomew's Day Massacre, Catholics initiated a massacre of the Huguenots in which thousands were slaughtered. Over the course of three months, more than 3,000 Protestants were killed in the provinces of Paris, Aix, Bourges, Lyons, Meaux, Orleans, Rouen, Toulouse, and Troyes. In Toulouse alone, an estimated 2,000 Protestants were killed in late August and early September. More than 25,000 Protestants were slaughtered throughout the country by the end of September. The Massacre was not necessarily approved by the King, but it was pardoned with an amnesty in 1573.
label: dolly

text: The last glacial epoch spanned a period of ~74,000 years ago until the end of the Pleistocene epoch, ending with the emergence of the Last Glacial Maximum. The last phase saw the disappearance of the lower Rhine and its emergence into the North Sea, the English Channel, and the Irish Channel. At this time, sea level was around 120 m lower than present, meaning most of the land in these regions was submerged.

Average temperatures are less than 9 °C (48 °F) in winter and below 0 °C (32 °F) in the highest parts of the ranges. The state's lowest minimum temperature of −11.7 °C (10.9 °F) was recorded at Omeo on 13 June 1965, and again at Falls Creek on 3 July 1970. text: The best Christmas movie of all time is Santa Claus. This movie explores the plight of the small town Santa, and it's role in Christmas traditions. The film has so many messages, and its portrayal of the one and only Santa Claus, an ordinary man, is the best rendition of the character to date. We witness Santa imprisoning children and spying on children's dreams, and we think, "what could possibly be so bad about ice cream?" In the end, Santa Claus is not the saint we believe him to be, and we ask ourselves, "Is the Santa we believe in really that good?" This movie will take you on a journey, and you will understand the true meaning of Christmas. It's a must watch, and you owe it to yourself to see it.

text: The centrifugal governor was first adopted in 1788 by James Watt for use on a steam engine. It could not maintain a constant speed in response to changes in load, since it would assume a new constant speed when exposed to such changes. Instead, it was effective in handling smaller fluctuations such as those due to fluctuating heat load in the boiler. As a result, engines equipped with only the centrifugal governor were not suitable for operations that require a constant speed such as cotton spinning. Over time, the governor was improved and coupled with variable steam cut-off, it was possible to attain a good speed control in response to load changes. By the end of the 19th century, this was the state-of-the-art technology.
label: dolly

text: Formed in November 1990 by the equal merger of Sky Television and British Satellite Broadcasting, BSkyB became the UK's largest digital subscription television company. Following BSkyB's 2014 acquisition of Sky Italia and a majority 90.04% interest in Sky Deutschland in November 2014, its holding company British Sky Broadcasting Group plc changed its name to Sky plc. text: Supraspinatus muscle atrophy and fatty infiltration are two distinct processes which occur after a chronic massive tear or suprascapular neuropathy. Isolated supraspinatus muscle denervation after shoulder dislocation is extremely rare, and our report focuses on a patient who developed isolated supraspinatus muscle atrophy and fatty infiltration after traumatic anterior shoulder instability. Possible explanations and etiologies of this rare condition are discussed in this report.

text: After a brief introduction on the spin and mass-energy currents, we review the 1995-2001 measurements of gravitomagnetic field of Earth and Lense-Thirring effect obtained from analyzing the orbits of the two laser-ranged satellites Large (Lageos) and Large-II (Lageos II). These measurements have provided a direct measurement of Earth's gravitomagnetism with accuracy of the order of 20 @xmath0. In the future, an accurate measurement of the Lense-Thirring effect, at the level of @xmath1 accuracy, may include the Lares experiment that will also provide other basic tests of general relativity and gravitation. Finally, we report the latest measurement of the Lense-Thirring effect, obtained in 2002 with the Lageos satellites over nearly 8 years of data. This 2002 result fully confirms and improves our previous measurements of the Lense-Thirring effect, confirming and improving the prediction of Einstein's theory of general relativity.

text: anisocoria is the deviation of the two pupils when the patient is in the dark, which is usually caused by a problem with the eye muscles. When the patient is in light, the pupils should constrict. A patient with acute ophthalmoplegia, when not in the dark, should also have hypersensitivity to dilute pilocarpine, and magnetic resonance imaging should be checked to see if the oculomotor nerve is enhanced. This case emphasizes the importance of considering neurosyphilis in patients presenting with acute onset internis ophthalmoplegia and hypersensitivity to dilute pilocarpine even in the absence of other oculomotor nerve findings.

text: Oxygen, as a supposed mild euphoric, has a history of recreational use in oxygen bars and in sports. Oxygen bars are establishments, found in Japan, California, and Las Vegas, Nevada since the late 1990s that offer higher than normal O 2 exposure for a fee. Professional athletes, especially in American football, also sometimes go off field between plays to wear oxygen masks in order to get a boost in performance. The pharmacological effect is doubtful; a placebo effect is more likely. Available studies support a performance boost from enriched O 2 mixtures only if they are breathed during aerobic exercise.

text: On too many occasions, researchers conduct public health and/or epidemiological studies in low-income countries without the appropriate in-country ethical approval. This article reflects on some of the underlying reasons for not applying for ethical approval. The piece concludes that we need to start by educating our junior researchers and research students about the importance of research ethics. We conclude with a number of recommendations for researchers, scientific journal editors and reviewers, and ethical committees in high-income countries to bring the message home to researchers that ethical approval should be sought in low-income countries if and when required!

text:
Just when I thought I would complete a whole year without giving a single movie a "bomb" rating, a friend brought this infamous turd to my house last night. I feared the worst knowing its reputation, and it was as God-awful as I'd anticipated. This is a Mexican-made mess, dubbed into English, and produced by K. Gordon Murray. It's got terrible sets and effects, and features a rather frightening Santa who doesn't operate at the North Pole, but instead from a cloud in outer space, and who doesn't have little elves helping him make his toys but instead all different groups of children from practically every country there is. The opening sequence, where St. Nick chuckles heartily as he observes monitors showing all these kiddies working hard while singing terrible holiday songs in a variety of languages, seems to go on forever, and with no story. Obviously, THIS Santa Claus doesn't observe the child labor laws!

Eventually we get some nasty and slinky red-suited apprentice of the devil himself traveling from hell to Earth, just to make little kids naughty and turn Santa's Christmas Eve rounds into a nightmare. Watching this movie is a trippy and twisted experience, and it's bound to frighten little children and turn them off Santa Claus and the holidays forever. Oddly, the name of Jesus Christ is mentioned often in this Christmas film, which somehow makes it all the creepier in the context of all the bizarre things that are going on. This easily makes my personal list of the "Worst Movie I've Ever Seen", but I'm sure that's nothing unique."
label: dolly

text: New Rochelle, located in Westchester County, seems to have been a great location for Huguenots in New York. According to accounts, they had taken refuge in England due to religious persecution and had ended up in the county after having purchased a tract of land near what is now John Pell's Manor. A church was first erected in the settlement, along with a second church made of stone. These two churches were replaced by a third one, which is now said to be the final resting place of the founders, settlers and prominent citizens of the Huguenot population. The Huguenot cemetery, or Huguenot Burial Ground, is said to be the final resting place for a wide range of the Huguenot founders, settlers, and prominent citizens dating back more than three centuries.

text: There are two distinct approaches to the study of initial value problem for the periodic box - ball system. One way is the rigged configuration approach by Kuniba, Takagi, and Takenouchi. text: Cardiorenal syndrome refers to the interaction between the heart and the kidneys in disease. It encompasses five distinct types according to the initial site affected and the acute or chronic nature of the injury. Type 4, or chronic renocardiac syndrome, involves features of chronic renal disease leading to cardiovascular injury. There is sufficient epidemiological evidence linking chronic kidney disease (CKD) with increased cardiovascular morbidity and mortality. The underlying pathophysiology goes beyond the highly prevalent traditional cardiovascular risk burden affecting renal patients. It involves CKD-related factors, which lead to cardiac and vascular pathology, such as left ventricular hypertrophy, myocardial fibrosis, and vascular calcification. Risk management should consider both traditional and CKD-related factors, while therapeutic interventions, apart from appearing underutilized, still await further confirmation from large trials.
label: dolly

text: The Under-19s team's football drifted off into the North Sea, eventually washed ashore in Norway. Mr Mikalsen told the BBC the ball has travelled a long distance, and said that the team members were “amazed” and that he hoped that it will be returned to Banks o' Dee FC to be used at some point. text: An efficient way to evacuate people from high rises is the use of a vertical escape chute, which aids in the mass and rapid evacuation of people from high structures. The escape chute can be installed on most structures, requiring a clear drop from the evacuation point to ground level, and a person can enter the chute, being able to carry a second person to exit, assisting them to exit with their feet. Once deployed, the chute runs parallel to the side of the building, and the exits are spaced no more than 12 feet from each other. Smoke does not enter the chute, and can be evacuated by people with disabilities. Once the chute is exited, people crouch, and extract their bodies from the chute, walking away.
label: dolly

text:
To run a script from the command line, you navigate to the folder in which the script is saved and run the command /script-name.

                            To reboot a server, you access the server's control panel and select the reboot option.

                            To access the command line, you use an operating system command. For example, on Windows, you would use the Windows Start menu to open the Command Prompt.

                            To access the server's file system, you use the /device/server-name/disk/path command. For example, on a server with an SDCard, you would access the server's file system by running the command /dev/server-name/sdcard.

                            Finally, to reboot a server, you select the Reboot System option in the server's control panel.

                            For a complete list of commands, refer to the Sun Fire V20z and Sun Fire V40z Servers--Server Management Guide (817-5249).
label: dolly

text: Damien Midgley, formerly of Aberford, near Leeds, was tried for child sex offences in 2014, but did not attend the hearing.  He was convicted in his absence and sentenced to six years in jail, with a warrant for his arrest also issued. North Yorkshire Police believe the 39-year-old visited Thailand before Cambodia. Arrangements are being made for him to be deported back to the UK.  Despite fleeing the UK, Midgley clearly thought he would somehow be immune from the sentence handed to him in his absence. text: A wireless powered communication network ( wpcn ) is a novel networking paradigm that uses radio frequency ( rf ) wireless energy transfer ( wet ) technology to power the information transmissions of wireless devices ( wds ). When energy and information are transferred in the same frequency band, a major design issue is transmission scheduling to avoid interference and achieve high communication performance. Commonly used centralized scheduling methods in wpcn may result in high control signaling overhead and thus are not suitable for wireless networks constituting a large number of wds with random locations and dynamic operations. To tackle this issue, we propose a distributed scheduling protocol for energy and information transmissions in wpcn. Specifically, we allow a wd that is about to deplete its battery to broadcast an energy request buzz ( erb ) which triggers wet from its associated hybrid access point ( hap ) to recharge the battery. If no erb is sent, the wds contend to transmit data to the hap using the conventional @xmath0-persistent csma ( carrier sensing multiple access ). In particular, we propose an energy queueing model based on an energy decoupling property to derive the throughput performance. Our analysis is verified through simulations under practical network parameters, which demonstrate good throughput performance of the distributed scheduling protocol and reveal some interesting design insights that are different from conventional contention-based communication networks assuming the wds are powered with unlimited energy supplies.
label: dolly

text: This document introduces the foundations of data preparation, feature selection and learning in high energy physics.  Emphasis is placed on feature selection, namely principal component analysis, information gain and significance measures for features, as well as basic statistical learning algorithms, such as maximum a posteriori and maximum likelihood classifiers. Examples of basic statistical learning algorithms include a simple rule based classification to aid in automated cut finding, and a toolbox for the application of statistical learning techniques. Furthermore, this document introduces a deeper understanding of how data preparation, feature selection, and learning in high energy physics can be achieved.
label: dolly

text: Natural killer cells, or NK cells, are a component of the innate immune system. These cells recognize and attack cells infected by viruses or cells with altered MHC I markers. This recognition process is mediated by killer cell immunoglobulin receptors (KIR) which prevent NK cells from attacking cells with intact MHC I molecules. Normal body cells do not trigger an attack from NK cells because they express intact MHC I molecules.
label: dolly

text:
The goal of this study is to examine the risk of atrial fibrilation in patients with fibromyalgia syndrome.
                         The methods involved collecting data on the subject and comparing it to that of a control group.
                         Patients with fibromyalgia were given a battery of questionnaires and electrocardiograms were taken.
                         The results showed that the patients with fibromyalgia had increased p-wave dispersions, which indicated an increased risk of atrial fibrillation.
                         This information will be used to target patients with fibromyalgia in later stages for possible risks of atrial fibrillation.
                         Additional investigations may be needed to provide more definitive conclusions.

text: Boson sampling, an achievable quantum computation problem, is widely regarded to be one of the most achievable fields in which a quantum computer will outperform a classical computer in the near term, although no upper bound of how fast classical computers can compute matrix permanents has been reported. In this article, we test the computing of the matrix permanent on Tianhe-2, the world's No. 1 system for six times since June 2013, and arrive at the time (about 20 minutes) to compute the permanent of a matrix with an acceptable precision. In addition, we have found that Ryser's algorithm will produce an unacceptable error with the increase of problem scale, compared to Balasubramanian and Glynn's algorithm in the same complexity. The precision issue suggests carefully checking in future research of boson sampling and comprehensive comparison between quantum computer and classical computer.
label: dolly

text: We examine the finite temperature Hartree-Fock-Bogoliubov (HFB) approximation for selected stable sn nuclei with zero-range Skyrme forces. The HFB approximation allows for a straightforward interpretation of the results since it involves both the antisymmetrized product of the number operator, @xmath0 and the symmetrized product of the number operator, @xmath1 which are not matrices as in the Hartree-Fock (HF) approximation. Pairing transitions from the superfluid to the normal state are studied with respect to the temperature. The temperature dependence of nuclear radii and neutron skin are also analyzed. An increase of proton and neutron radii is obtained in neutron rich nuclei especially above the critical temperature. Different Skyrme energy functionals are used to investigate the correlation between the effective mass in symmetric nuclear matter and the critical temperature. The temperature dependence of the nucleon effective mass is also investigated. Proton and neutron effective masses display different behavior below and above the critical temperature, due to the small temperature dependence of the density.
label: dolly

text: For most of human history, having a full stomach and clean water were associated with better health and longer lives. Despite this, in poorer countries, life expectancy increases quickly as per capita income increases, while in middle-income countries and even in the wealthiest countries, the trend has been slowing down for the past few decades. Americans still live no longer on average than Greeks (77 years) or New Zealanders (78) but the USA has a higher GDP per capita. In Sweden and Japan, life expectancy is 80 and 82 years, respectively, where income was more equally distributed.

                        Furthermore, the issues of race and ethnicity have gained popularity as people have become more conscious of the negative effects of bias, prejudice, and discrimination. The potential consequences of this could be significant, as PewDiePie's actions are increasingly seen as an example of why we need to become more mindful of our actions and are complicit in the process of creating awareness.

text: The most basic method of checking the primality of a given integer n is called the trial division method. This routine consists of dividing n by each integer m that is greater than 1 and less than or equal to the square root of n. If the result of any of these divisions is an integer, then n is not a prime, otherwise it is a prime. Indeed, if  is composite (with a and b ≠ 1) then one of the factors a or b is necessarily at most. For example, for, the trial divisions are by m = 2, 3, 4, 5, and 6. None of these numbers divide 37, so 37 is prime. This routine can be implemented more efficiently if a complete list of primes up to  is known—then trial divisions need to be checked only for those m that are prime. For example, to check the primality of 37, only three divisions are necessary (m = 2, 3, and 5), given that 4 and 6 are composite.
label: dolly

text: Self-amplifying RNA or RNA replicon is a form of nucleic acid-based vaccine derived from either positive-strand or negative-strand RNA viruses. The gene sequences encoding structural proteins in these RNA viruses are replaced by MRNA encoding antigens of interest as well as by RNA polymerase for replication and transcription. This kind of vaccine has been successfully assessed with many different antigens as vaccines candidates, including mice, nonhuman primates and humans. A key challenge to realizing the broad potential of self-amplifying vaccines is the need for safe and effective delivery methods. Ideally, a rna nanocarrier should provide protection from blood nucleases and extended blood circulation, which ultimately would increase the possibility of reaching the target tissue. The delivery system must then be internalized by the target cell and, upon receptor-mediated endocytosis, must be able to escape from the endosomal compartment into the cell cytoplasm, where the rna machinery is located. Further, delivery systems for systemic administration ought to be well tolerated upon administration. They should be safe, enabling the multi-administration treatment modalities required for improved clinical outcomes and, from a developmental point of view, production of large batches with reproducible specifications is also desirable. In this review, the concept of self-amplifying RNA vaccines and the most promising lipid-based delivery systems are discussed.
label: dolly

text: To further highlight the difference between a problem and an instance, consider the following instance of the decision version of the traveling salesman problem: Is there a route of at most 2000 kilometres that passes through all of Germany's 15 largest cities? The quantitative answer to this particular problem instance is of little use for solving other instances of the problem, such as asking for a round trip through all sites in Milan whose total length is at most 10 km. For this reason, complexity theory examines computational problems, and not particular problem instances.
label: dolly

text: The objective of this study is to identify the genetic defect in an autosomal recessive pls family with 5 affected individuals, by using whole-exome sequencing and cosegregation analysis. We used whole-exome sequencing to analyze the shared genetic variants in 3 affected individuals, and sanger sequencing for validation of the variants and for cosegregation analysis. We also used a mitochondrial activity assay to assess both affected and unaffected members of the family. Finally, we analyzed the results and used functional studies to determine the genetic defect. This study showed that the compound heterozygous missense variants l695p and i743 t in spg7 are the only mutations cosegregating with the disease in an autosomal recessive fashion. The parents and siblings are genetically heterozygous and clinically unaffected. The pls phenotype can be explained by the effect of the mutations on mitochondrial activity. In conclusion, spg7 mutations are associated with adult - onset pls, and the mutation should be screened for when the condition is familial.
label: dolly

text: Given a set of community detection algorithms and a graph as inputs, we propose two ensemble methods - endisco and medoc. endisco transforms the graph into a latent feature space by utilizing multiple base solutions and discovers disjoint communities. medoc groups similar base communities into a meta-community and detects both disjoint and overlapping communities. Experiments are conducted on both synthetically generated networks as well as on several real-world networks with ground-truth community structure. Our extensive experiments demonstrate that both algorithms significantly outperform state-of-the-art non-ensemble algorithms. Furthermore, we compare endisco and medoc with a recent ensemble approach for disjoint community detection and show that our approaches outperform it. To the best of our knowledge, medoc is the first ensemble approach for overlapping community detection.
label: dolly

text: The Mallee and upper Wimmera are Victoria's warmest regions with hot winds blowing from nearby semi-deserts. During the summer months, average temperatures exceed 32°C (90°F). Temperatures rarely drop below 15°C (59°F) in winter. This inland area is much warmer than around Melbourne due to the hot winds from the nearby semi-deserts. Victoria's hottest maximum temperature since World War II, of 48.8°C (119.8°F) was recorded in Hopetoun on 7 February 2009, during the 2009 southeastern Australia heat wave.

text: Spector and spector have recently been studying classes of self-similar solutions to the equations of radial isotropic elastodynamics that describe cavitating solutions. These solutions decrease the total mechanical energy and provide striking examples of non-uniqueness of entropy weak solutions (for polyconvex energies) due to point singularities at the cavity. To resolve this paradox, they introduce the concept of singular limiting induced from continuum solution, according to which a discontinuous motion is a slic-solution if its average forms a smooth family of approximate solutions to the problem. It turns out that there is an energetic cost for creating the cavity, which is captured by the notion of slic-solution but neglected by the usual entropic weak solutions. Once this cost is accounted for, the total mechanical energy of the cavitating solution is in fact larger than that of the homogeneously deformed state. They also apply the notion of slic-solutions to a one-dimensional example describing the onset of fracture and to gas dynamics in langrangean coordinates with riemann data inducing vacuum in the wave fan. [ Section ] [ Lemma ] [ Theorem ] [ Lemma ] [ Proposition ] [ Lemma ] [ Main Theorem ] [ Lemma ] [ Corollary ] [ Lemma ] [ Definition ] [ Lemma ] [ Remark ] [ Lemma ] [ Remarks ] [ Notation

text: A feasibility study will examine options for a five-mile network linking the city centre and Penarth, Vale of Glamorgan. The planned system will have gondolas travelling along a route from Cardiff Central Station, carrying up to 2,500 tourists and commuters per hour. If plans are put into place, the gondolas will pass through the city's Central Square and Cardiff Bay before terminating in Penarth. The scheme could cost around £20m per mile, which may be funded by the Welsh Transport budget, the private sector, and sponsorship. Chancellor George Osborne's announcement of a City Deal was also seen to benefit the potential plans for the Cardiff Bay Cable Line. "This would be a sustainable public transport system which would serve our growing city," Mr Roberts said, adding that he would like to be able to ride on the line himself. text: A group of researchers, David Rodda, Jacob Vigdor, and Janna Matlack, argued that in part due to income inequality, a shortage of affordable housing has been created. David Rodda noted that from 1984 and 1991, the number of quality rental units decreased as the demand for higher quality housing increased. Through gentrification of older neighbourhoods, for example, in East New York, rental prices increased rapidly as landlords sought out new residents willing to pay higher market rates. The ad valorem property tax policy coupled with rising prices made it difficult or impossible for low income residents to keep pace.

text: In Jacksonville's downtown skyline, the tallest building is the Bank of America Tower, built in 1990 as the Barnett Center. It stands at 617 feet (188 meters) and has 42 floors. text: This paper studies the frequency/time-selective Gaussian interference channel with secrecy constraints. Two distinct models, namely the interference channel with confidential messages and the one with an external eavesdropper, are analyzed. The key difference between the two models is the lack of channel state information (CSI) about the external eavesdropper. Using interference alignment along with secrecy pre-coding, it is shown that each user can achieve non-zero secure degrees of freedom (dof) for both cases. Specifically, the proposed coding scheme achieves secure dof _ with probability one _ per user in the confidential messages model. For the external eavesdropper scenario, on the other hand, it is shown that each user can achieve secure dof _ in the ergodic setting. Remarkably, these results establish the positive impact of interference on the secrecy capacity region of wireless networks.
label: dolly

text: The aim of this study was to investigate the impact of acute hemorrhage on signal changes in different brain regions. New Zealand white rabbits were used for the construction of the acute hemorrhagic anemia model. The signal intensities of swi images of the bilateral frontal cortex, frontal white matter, temporal lobe, and thalamic nuclei were measured. In addition, the cerebral gray - white contrast and venous structures were evaluated by an experienced physician. Repeated bloodletting resulted in significant decreases in the swi signal intensity in the frontal cortex, temporal lobe, and thalamus but was without effect in the frontal white matter. The cerebral white - gray contrast and venous structures were clearer after bloodletting than before bloodletting. Therefore, the effect of acute hemorrhage on the brain is reflected by signal changes in the cerebral cortex and gray matter nuclei.
label: dolly

text: The concept of legal certainty is recognised as an important principle in European Union law since the 1960s. It's a general principle in international law and public law and predates European Union law. As a general principle in European Union law, it means that the law must be certain; it should be clear and precise, and its legal implications should be foreseeable. In order for laws in the EU to have legal effect, they should be formulated so that they are clearly understood by those subject to the law. In European Union law the principle of legal certainty prohibits ex post facto laws, i.e. laws should not come into force before they are published. The doctrine of legitimate expectation, which has its roots in the principles of legal certainty and good faith, is also a fundamental element of the general principle of legal certainty in European Union law. The legitimate expectation doctrine states that "those who act in good faith on the basis of law as it is or seems to be should not be frustrated in their expectations".
label: dolly

text: We study pairing vibrations in the nuclei of @xmath0o and @xmath1ca, solving the time-dependent Hartree-Fock-Bogoliubov equation in coordinate space with spherical symmetry. We use the Sly4 Skyrme functional in the normal part and a local density dependent functional in its pairing part. Pairing vibrations are excited by two-neutron transfer operators. Strength distributions are obtained using the Fourier transform of the time-dependent response of two-neutron pair transfer observables in the linear regime. Results are in overall agreement with quasiparticle random phase approximation calculations for oxygen isotopes, though differences appear when increasing the neutron number. Both low-lying pairing modes and giant pairing vibrations ( gpv ) are discussed. The gpv is observed in the oxygen, but not in the calcium isotopes.
label: dolly

text: I had a strange feeling about the surface I was studying at that point. I couldn't get rid of it. As far as I was concerned, it was both the source of my problem, and the solution to it. I fixed a point on the surface and a complete primary ideal in it. The curves obtained by blowing up the ideal were studied in terms of the base points of the ideal. Criteria for the principality of these curves were obtained. New formulas for their multiplicity, intersection numbers and order of singularity at the singularities of the singular surface were given. The semigroup of branches going through a sandwiched singularity was effectively determined, too.

text: Many farms in the Western Cape province in South Africa still bear French names. Many families, today mostly Afrikaans-speaking, have surnames indicating their French Huguenot ancestry. Examples include: Blignaut, Cilliers, de Klerk (Le Clercq), de Villiers, du Plessis, Du Randt (Durand), du Preez (Des Pres), Duvenhage(Du Vinage), Franck, Fouche, Fourie (Fleurit), Gervais, Gous/Gouws (Gauch), Hugo, Jordaan (Jourdan), Joubert, Kriek, Labuschagne (la Buscagne), Le Roux, Lombard, Malan, Malherbe, Marais, Maree, Minnaar (Mesnard), Nel (Nell), Nortje (Nortier), Pienaar (Pinard), Retief (Retif), Rossouw (Rousseau), Taljaard (Taillard), Theron, Viljoen (Villion) and Visagie (Visage). The wine industry in South Africa owes a significant debt to the Huguenots, some of whom had vineyards in France, or were brandy distillers, and used their skills in their new home.

The court heard how he was driving well over the speed limit on a narrow, unlit road, when he lost control of his Ford Fiesta while negotiating a left-hand bend after overtaking another car.
                        
                        It was found that Harvey had chosen to ignore the hazards around him, and that his reckless driving caused the death of the innocent woman.
                        
                        A life has been tragically lost, as a result of Ian Harvey's carelessness on a narrow, unlit road.
                        
                        An innocent and well-loved woman has tragically died as a result of Ian Harvey's reckless driving on a narrow, unlit road.

text: The symbiotic stars in the Large Magellanic Cloud are known to produce extended emission over the whole electromagnetic spectrum and to display complex photometric and spectroscopic variability.  In this paper, we report the first of a series of observations of the symbiotic stars in the Large Magellanic Cloud, with one exception.  By careful visual inspection and combined time-series analysis techniques, we investigate the photometric properties of the symbiotic stars, trying to distinguish the nature of the cool component.  We find some interesting results, such as the discovery of a 20-year-long steady fading of Sanduleak's star, a peculiar symbiotic star known to produce the largest stellar jet ever discovered.  We discuss the crucial need for long-term multi-band observations to get a real understanding of interacting binary stars.  We introduce Bombolo, a simultaneous multi-band imager for the SOAR 4m telescope, whose design and construction we are currently leading.

text: The Computational Module Integrator (CMI) @xcite is an initiative aiming at a framework, developer tool and repository for computational science. We identify the main ingredients to a solution that would be sufficiently appealing to scientists and engineers to consider alternatives to their deeply rooted programming traditions. The overall structure of the complete solution is sketched with special emphasis on the developer tool standing at the basis of CMI.

text: We investigate the properties of the electron spin, transmission through an Aharonov-Bohm interferometer with an embedded two-dimensional multilevel quantum dot containing magnetic impurities. The effects induced by the exchange interaction to spin-dependent magnetoconductance fluctuations and transmittance phase are shown.

text: Standard order - disorder phase transition in the Ising model is described in terms of rates of processes of spin flips. text: The most useful instrument for analyzing the performance of steam engines is the steam engine indicator. This indicator was used to trace the pressure in the cylinder throughout the cycle, and to spot various problems and calculate developed horsepower. It was routinely used by engineers, mechanics and insurance inspectors. It could also be used on internal combustion engines.

text: Large bowel obstruction is a rare condition due to presence of a gallstone in the large bowel. It is usually caused due to a fistula between the gall bladder and the large bowel. Contrast enhanced abdominal computed tomography is an important diagnostic aid. Surgical management is the treatment of choice to prevent the complications of large bowel obstruction. We present the case of a 92 year old man who presented with symptoms and signs of large bowel obstruction. Radiological investigation showed a large gallstone impacted in the sigmoid colon. Open enterolithotomy was undertaken relieving the obstruction and the patient made a full recovery.

text: In this paper, we present a quantum mechanical description of black hole states, and use it to study the emission and absorption spectra of quantum black holes. We assume that the probability distribution of states of the quantum black hole is given by the ``area'' canonical ensemble, in which the horizon area is used instead of energy, and use Fermi's golden rule to find the line intensities. For a non-rotating black hole, we study the absorption and emission of s-waves, considering a special set of emission lines. To find the line intensities, we use an analogy between a microscopic state of the black hole and a state of the gas of atoms.

text: The question of what is "genuinely quantum" about weak values is only ever going to elicit strongly subjective opinions. It is not a scientific question. Good questions, when comparing theories, are operational, dealing with the unquestionable outcomes of experiment. We give the anomalous shift of weak values an objective meaning through a generalization to an operational definition of anomalous post-selected averages. We show the presence of these averages necessitate correlations in every model, giving rise to them. Characterizing such correlations shows that they are ubiquitous. We present the simplest classical example without the need of disturbance realizing these generalized anomalous weak values.

text: To evaluate the effectiveness of anti-TB drugs, we compared the mutation rates of different Mycobacterium Tuberculosis (M.TB) strains under varying concentrations of anti-TB drugs. text: Interferons (IFNs) were initially identified as antiviral molecules that exert pleiotropic physiological processes ranging from immune modulation, control of proliferation, apoptosis, to antitumor activity. However, type I IFNs (IFNs-I) have recently been shown to apply both beneficial and detrimental effects to the central nervous system (CNS) and a tightly balanced equilibrium between cellular activation and inhibition seems to be essential to maintain homeostasis within the CNS. In inflammatory pathologies affecting the CNS, IFNs-I are in the center of attention not only because interferon beta is used as a standard therapeutic in the treatment of relapsing-remitting multiple sclerosis (MS), but also as IFN-I expression is associated with distinct pathologies. Despite the great efficiency of IFN-I in reducing MS relapses and attenuation of novel inflammatory lesions, underlying molecular mechanisms and cellular target specificities are just beginning to emerge. In contrast to the curative effects, aberrant activation of the IFN-I response have also been shown to be associated with detrimental effects exemplified by the Aicardi-Goutieres syndrome (AGS), a severe disabling autoimmune inflammatory encephalopathy. This review will highlight the dual role of type I interferons during chronic CNS inflammation. Recently uncovered molecular and cellular mechanisms in the etiology of AGS and experimental autoimmune encephalomyelitis (EAE), the murine model of MS, will be highlighted.
label: dolly

text: A new and simple technique has been developed using plastic scintillators for gamma ray and cosmic ray spectroscopy without single channel analyzer or multi-channel analyzer.  In these experiments, only a leading edge discriminator and two-channel scalers have been used.  Energy calibration of gamma spectra in plastic scintillators was done using crystal calorimeter and cesium sources.  Experimental details, analysis procedure, and experimental results are presented in this article.  Plastic scintillator, gamma ray, cosmic ray, spectroscopy, energy resolution.

text: The aim of this study was to categorize concealed penis and buried penis by performing a manual prepubic compression test and describe a simple surgical technique that is based on the anatomical components. Material and methods: From March 2007 to November 2010, 17 patients were diagnosed with buried penis after differentiating this condition from concealed penis. The described surgical technique consisted of a minimal incision and simple fixation of the penile shaft skin and superficial fascia to the prepubic deep fascia, without degloving the penile skin. Result: The mean age of the patients was 10.2 years (ranging from 8 to 15 years). The median follow-up was 19 months (range, 5-49 months). The mean penile lengths were 1.8 cm (range, 1.1-2.5 cm) preoperatively and 4.5 cm (range, 3.3-5.8 cm) postoperatively. The median difference between preoperative and postoperative penile lengths was 2.7 cm (range, 2.1-3.9 cm). There were no serious intra- or postoperative complications. Conclusion: With the simple anchoring of the penopubic skin to the prepubic deep fascia, we obtained successful subjective and objective outcomes without complications. We suggest that this is a promising surgical method for selected patients with buried penis.

We propose an extension of the sabotage games where the first player ( ) traverses an arena with dynamic weights determined by the second player ( ). In our model of quantitative sabotage games, is now given a budget that he can distribute amongst the edges of the graph (), whilst attempts to minimise the quantity of budget witnessed while completing his task. We show that, on the one hand, for most of the classical cost functions considered in the literature, the problem of determining if has a strategy to ensure a cost below some threshold is -complete. text: The concept of prime number is so important that it has been generalized in different ways in different branches of mathematics. Generally, "prime" indicates minimality or indecomposability, in an appropriate sense. For example, the prime field is the smallest subfield of a field F containing both 0 and 1. It is either Q or the finite field with p elements, whence the name. Often a second, additional meaning is intended by using the word prime, namely that any object can be, essentially uniquely, decomposed into its prime components. For example, in knot theory, a prime knot is a knot that is indecomposable in the sense that it cannot be written as the knot sum of two nontrivial knots. Any knot can be uniquely expressed as a connected sum of prime knots. Prime models and prime 3-manifolds are other examples of this type.
label: dolly

Kublai wished to persuade the Chinese that he was becoming increasingly sinicized while maintaining his Mongolian credentials with his own people. A better agreement with the magneto-optical Kerr measurements at higher energies is obtained.                         The principle of cross-cutting relationships concerns the arrangement of the sequences through which they cut and the ages of the sequences. Faults are younger than the rocks they cut; accordingly, if a fault is found to cut some formations but not the ones above it, then the formations that are cut must be older than the fault, and those that are not cut must be younger. Finding the key bed can help determine whether the fault is a normal fault or a thrust fault.

text: A term originally used in derision, Huguenot is uncertain in its origins. Various hypotheses have been proposed. The nickname may have been a combination of the Swiss politician Besançon Hugues (died 1532) and the religiously conflicted nature of Swiss republicanism in his time, using a clever derogatory pun on the name Hugues by way of the Dutch word Huisgenoten (literally housemates), referring to the connotations of a somewhat related word in German Eidgenosse (Confederates as in "a citizen of one of the states of the Swiss Confederacy"). Geneva was John Calvin's adopted home and the centre of the Calvinist movement. In Geneva, Hugues, though Catholic, was a leader of the "Confederate Party", so called because it favoured independence from the Duke of Savoy through an alliance between the city-state of Geneva and the Swiss Confederation. The label Huguenot was purportedly first applied in France to those conspirators (all of them aristocratic members of the Reformed Church) involved in the Amboise plot of 1560: a foiled attempt to wrest power in France from the influential House of Guise. The move would have had the side effect of fostering relations with the Swiss. Thus, Hugues plus Eidgenosse by way of Huisgenoten supposedly became Huguenot, a nickname associating the Protestant cause with politics unpopular in France.
label: dolly

In particular, the t - scores of bmd in the cervical cancer group were found to be significantly lower than those of the control group after one year of cancer treatment. Furthermore, in the analysis of the data, it was observed that patients with cervical and endometrial cancer had lower bmd t - scores compared to controls even though some patients had achieved good responses to cancer treatment. This may be explained by an increased rate of bone turnover in the patients with endometrial cancer, suggesting that bone metabolism should be investigated further. Taken together, this study provides evidence that cancer treatment may have an adverse effect on bone health in patients with cervical and endometrial cancer, and it suggests that bone metabolism should be carefully monitored in these patients.

text: We use a set of simulation-based models for the dissipationless evolution of galaxies since @xmath0 to constrain the fate of accreted satellites embedded in dark matter subhalos.
